column1: GlassUp displays to the user any kind of message, super-imposed on reality. See it as a convenient ""second screen for your smartphone""
• Emails, text messages, Facebook updates, tweets, RSS, calendar events, incoming calls
• Breaking news, weather, stock exchange, sport results
• Real time feedback display for running, biking, sailing, action sports
• Turn by turn directions to riders (motorcycles, bikes,..)
• Translations display when talking in different languages
• Instructions to workers in warehousing or maintenance
• Subtitles at the movies (for hearing impaired and for different languages)
• Details about works of art at a museum
Most of these use cases come from actual customers waiting for the product, so we want to deliver it as soon as possible and open up the possibilities to all, you included!
An output of your smartphone or other Bluetooth connected device

GlassUp is basically a second screen output for your devices (mobile, smartphones, etc). It’s like being up to date with everything, without having to check your smartphone continuously. Information is sent from your smartphone to your GlassUp simply via a Bluetooth connection.
The types of content and data transferred to GlassUp will be determined by the apps you choose to download.
Thanks to our technology you will not need to grab your smartphone continuously anymore, but only when you want to act upon a particular notification.

The concept is similar to that of a Bluetooth earphone (actually, we have thought of a notifier earphone as well). Whatever arrives on the glasses is already on the phone, so it’s useful only to see messages without grabbing your smartphone. We see it as a first step towards telepathy, for which we couldn’t yet find the technology solution (yet :-)).
Comparison with Google Glass and other competitors
Compared to Google Glass, our eyeglasses are more focused on SHOWING information, in a very utilitarian approach.
• GlassUp is ""receive only"". No photos or videos involved, no privacy issues.
• The projection is Monochrome (currently green, but we may switch to amber).
• GlassUp projects the information close to the center of vision, with less strain to the eye of the wearer

The latter is very important: leveraging the experience of our  team member Gianluigi, who had developed optical systems for airplane pilots' helmets, we knew from the start that the information had to appear almost in the center of the field of view, vs forcing you to look laterally. This is the main issue we worked on, and only when we found the technical solution we went on with the project.
A good metaphor is that with Google Glass it’s like seeing something in the rear-view mirror of a car, whereas with GlassUp it’s like seeing it on the windscreen.
Last but not least: Google chose a very distinctive look for their product, our GlassUp will look like a normal pair of eyeglasses.

North-East Italy leads by far the world in terms of eye-wear design, with companies -such as Luxottica, Safilo, Marcolin, De Rigo - designing and producing most of the world leading brands (Ray-Ban, Oakley, Vogue, Carrera, Polaroid, and so many more). We are located in the very center of this district, so we plan to take advantage of the know-how spread in our neighborhood.

We will start with one or two designs, but we plan to have a more varied product line (sport, casual, high-tech, business, etc.), as soon as it makes financial sense. We have already presented our technology to the Italian fashion business, and various brands are willing to work with us.

To develop the product we had in mind, our team member Gianluigi Tregnaghi selected some of the best professionals in this sector. He and Fabrizio Liberati, for instance, are two of the three most qualified optical scientists in Italy. We are collaborating with various universities around Italy, and we are connected with other specialized centers in Italy and elsewhere.

We have filed a patent application covering our technology in Italy, we are planning on filing extensions of said application and we intend to file more applications in the near future on the improvements we will be making. The optical technology, of which we are very proud, is our strength, and we know it’s extremely difficult to replicate.
Francesco Giartosio, CEO, a passion for applied technology and man-machine interaction
Gianluigi Tregnaghi, CTO, exceptional experience developing optical systems, including for car windscreens and air force pilots’ helmets
Andrea Tellatin, COO, managed the development and industrialization of I’m Watch, a successful smartwatch
Alfio Giuffrida, Business Development Director, a long experience as a technical sales manager in the telecommunications industry
Luca Escoffier, Mentor, who we chose particularly for his wide experience in intellectual property, licensing agreements, Asian markets (he follows us from Japan), and strategic partnerships.
Optical Team: Fabrizio Liberati, Tommaso Occhipinti, Fabio Frassetto, Ivan Capraro
Hardware and Firmware Team: Fabio D'Alessi, Alberto Scarpa, Stefano Bianconi and their kidz.
Product Engineering, Manufacturing and Logistics: Fabio Patron and his team.

And many more fans of the project, who are excited to work with us.  Such as Filippo and Jennifer Catalano, who arranged the crowdfunding campaign.  And Giovanni Contini, running the show at the fairs.

The core team lives in the North-East of Italy, that by far leads the world eyeglass market (about two thirds of the eyeglasses in the world are made by companies located here), so for sure we’ll take advantage of the skills, and market coverage, of our region’s industry.

We started the feasibility study in the fall of 2011, the development of the optical system in the spring of 2012, and the development of the hardware and software in the fall of 2012. Our streamlined product vision allowed us to prototype and develop quickly through rapid iterations.
We have now arrived at the first prototype with our own work and money, which was the plan, and that’s where we have to stop and we need you!

What we need to do now is the industrialization, we need to finalize the specs, look for suppliers, define the production process, make molds, take care of the international certifications and additional patent filings, and so on.

We plan to have the final product definition by the end of July, and proceed to the industrialization.  We should have a first buggy pre-series at the end of September.  Once we've fixed the bugs and the specs are final, we'll start the certifications and the production, and we expect to have the product on the market in February 2014.
Is What I See What I get?
• Will the product I get actually look like the one in the video?
• Will the messages I see actually appear like the one in the video?
The answer to both questions is, yes, if not better!  In particular:

• Concerning the design of the glasses, the actors in the video are wearing the eyeglass model that we have currently selected, the sporty one, to which we had attached for this purpose the actual electronic circuit and optical system from the previous prototype.  In the next few months we will test other designs, and try to improve still, so the eyeglasses could look like the ones in the video, or probably better.  The design you see in other images also on this page, such as the classic look, are previous prototypes, again we believe we can improve on them. The frame in the video is still a little thick, we've made it thinner afterwords.

• The image above (sporty look) shows a bulky optical - electronic element.  Forget about that: it is the 3d of the current prototipe, we made it bulky because we need room to work on it.  As soon as it's finalized we'll miniaturize it, no worry.

• The lens will probably be slightly tinted, not completely transparent, because people who do not need eyeglasses don't want to be asked if their sight has deteriorated, and sunglasses blend better in every day use.

• As for the aspect of the messages, the guys who produced the video (brilliant work of Pongofilms from Modena, Italy) were given the actual formats and screenshots from our sdk simulator, so the messages should look quite like those in the video - except if we hire a good designer, which we will do.
(very provisional, we’ll update them over time)
We expect to have two-three designs in two-three sizes, but this will depend on the partnerships we’ll bring home.
Weight around 65 grams (tested on our first prototype)
Sensors: accelerometer, compass, ambient light sensor, precision altimeter, perhaps more (the GPS is already on your smartphone, so we don’t need it)
Optical system, made of a display and a set of lenses and mirrors. The resolution of the display is 320x240. If you ask more details on the optics, you’re a competitor.
• One day of battery life recharge via mini-usb

Controls: A touch-pad, with the usual controls (tap, double tap, long press, swipe vertically and horizontally), we are deciding now which ones to keep for us to on/off the projector (probably the long press), the others will be left to the developers to manage the apps.
Color combinations: The frame you see in the video is red on white, it's one of the two versions we plan to sell - the other is green on black

Prescription glasses - we get asked all the time, and a hard one: can our GlassUp be used with your prescription lenses? The lens of our GlassUp is very special, so you can not replace it with yours. We are working on a solution. We’ll likely be able to accommodate simple vision defects at a small cost

Next versions - We will have to make tough calls in for the evolution of the product. The roadmap (a camera, voice controls? binoculars?..) will take into account market feedback (and yours!) and consider what will be achievable by the team while we increase the team size

We plan to release a few apps on our own, such as the notifier, the visual impaired help, the translator. For the rest, we’ll release the APIs and rely on external developers. We’re confident that there will be many, both because they’re already calling every day, and because Andrea has already gone through this with his smartwatch, and thousands of developers have downloaded the APIs.

On May 25, we presented for the first time our SDK and simulator to a Hackathon in Milan. The winning team developed an app that would read the engine data from the processor of a car or motorbike and send them on the glasses.

Our API will work for Android (they already are) and iOS (almost done), probably also for Windows 7 but this still needs work (on Microsoft side, obviously). We’ll also have to create a translator, a compiler, that will make it possible to convert relatively easily the current mobile apps to show the messages on the eyeglass, instead of on the display of the mobile.

We are working hard to make strategic partnerships, as we want to distribute the product through existing proven channels. We are currently in talks with some companies in different fields: eye-wear, telecommunications, consumer electronics, sports, games - we can’t name them yet and we don’t want to anyway. We have high confidence that at least one of these agreements will be finalized. In case none does, we are already in talks with national importers and distributors.

Our business model is to sell the glasses, and let the external developers sell the apps they make. In addition to the general consumer market, of techies and sportsmen/women, there is a wealth of rich and huge niches (medical, gaming, museums, and so on), that we can work on - when we’ll have time to do it.
- Ok, ok, since you keep asking them you may still have them, just go on our website
- We are in agreements with some of the most famous eyewear brands for the design, so the final ones will be trendier and more varied

(Italian), Digital Trends,
GlassUp displays to the user any kind of message, super-imposed on reality. See it as a convenient ""second screen for your smartphone""
Emails, text messages, Facebook updates, tweets, RSS, calendar events, incoming calls
Breaking news, weather, stock exchange, sport results
Real time feedback display for running, biking, sailing, action sports
Turn by turn directions to riders (motorcycles, bikes,..)
Translations display when talking in different languages
Patients’ body data to a surgeon
Instructions to workers in warehousing or maintenance
Subtitles at the movies (for hearing impaired and for different languages)
Details about works of art at a museum
Most of these use cases come from actual customers waiting for the product, so we want to deliver it as soon as possible and open up the possibilities to all, you included!
An output of your smartphone or other Bluetooth connected device

GlassUp is basically a second screen output for your devices (mobile, smartphones, etc). It’s like being up to date with everything, without having to check your smartphone continuously. Information is sent from your smartphone to your GlassUp simply via a Bluetooth connection.
The types of content and data transferred to GlassUp will be determined by the apps you choose to download.
Thanks to our technology you will not need to grab your smartphone continuously anymore, but only when you want to act upon a particular notification.

The concept is similar to that of a Bluetooth earphone (actually, we have thought of a notifier earphone as well). Whatever arrives on the glasses is already on the phone, so it’s useful only to see messages without grabbing your smartphone. We see it as a first step towards telepathy, for which we couldn’t yet find the technology solution (yet :-)).
Comparison with Google Glass and other competitors
Compared to Google Glass, our eyeglasses are more focused on SHOWING information, in a very utilitarian approach.
GlassUp is ""receive only"". No photos or videos involved, no privacy issues.
The projection is Monochrome (currently green, but we may switch to amber).
GlassUp projects the information close to the center of vision, with less strain to the eye of the wearer

The latter is very important: leveraging the experience of our  team member Gianluigi, who had developed optical systems for airplane pilots' helmets, we knew from the start that the information had to appear almost in the center of the field of view, vs forcing you to look laterally. This is the main issue we worked on, and only when we found the technical solution we went on with the project.
A good metaphor is that with Google Glass it’s like seeing something in the rear-view mirror of a car, whereas with GlassUp it’s like seeing it on the windscreen.
Last but not least: Google chose a very distinctive look for their product, our GlassUp will look like a normal pair of eyeglasses.

North-East Italy leads by far the world in terms of eye-wear design, with companies -such as Luxottica, Safilo, Marcolin, De Rigo - designing and producing most of the world leading brands (Ray-Ban, Oakley, Vogue, Carrera, Polaroid, and so many more). We are located in the very center of this district, so we plan to take advantage of the know-how spread in our neighborhood.

We will start with one or two designs, but we plan to have a more varied product line (sport, casual, high-tech, business, etc.), as soon as it makes financial sense. We have already presented our technology to the Italian fashion business, and various brands are willing to work with us.

To develop the product we had in mind, our team member Gianluigi Tregnaghi selected some of the best professionals in this sector. He and Fabrizio Liberati, for instance, are two of the three most qualified optical scientists in Italy. We are collaborating with various universities around Italy, and we are connected with other specialized centers in Italy and elsewhere.We have filed a patent application covering our technology in Italy, we are planning on filing extensions of said application and we intend to file more applications in the near future on the improvements we will be making. The optical technology, of which we are very proud, is our strength, and we know it’s extremely difficult to replicate.
Francesco Giartosio, CEO, a passion for applied technology and man-machine interaction
Gianluigi Tregnaghi, CTO, exceptional experience developing optical systems, including for car windscreens and air force pilots’ helmets
Andrea Tellatin, COO, managed the development and industrialization of I’m Watch, a successful smartwatch
Alfio Giuffrida, Business Development Director, a long experience as a technical sales manager in the telecommunications industry
Luca Escoffier, Mentor, who we chose particularly for his wide experience in intellectual property, licensing agreements, Asian markets (he follows us from Japan), and strategic partnerships.
Optical Team: Fabrizio Liberati, Tommaso Occhipinti, Fabio Frassetto, Ivan Capraro
Hardware and Firmware Team: Fabio D'Alessi, Alberto Scarpa, Stefano Bianconi and their kidz.
Product Engineering, Manufacturing and Logistics: Fabio Patron and his team.

And many more fans of the project, who are excited to work with us.  Such as Filippo and Jennifer Catalano, who arranged the crowdfunding campaign.  And Giovanni Contini, running the show at the fairs.

The core team lives in the North-East of Italy, that by far leads the world eyeglass market (about two thirds of the eyeglasses in the world are made by companies located here), so for sure we’ll take advantage of the skills, and market coverage, of our region’s industry.

We started the feasibility study in the fall of 2011, the development of the optical system in the spring of 2012, and the development of the hardware and software in the fall of 2012. Our streamlined product vision allowed us to prototype and develop quickly through rapid iterations.
We have now arrived at the first prototype with our own work and money, which was the plan, and that’s where we have to stop and we need you!

What we need to do now is the industrialization, we need to finalize the specs, look for suppliers, define the production process, make molds, take care of the international certifications and additional patent filings, and so on.

We plan to have the final product definition by the end of July, and proceed to the industrialization.  We should have a first buggy pre-series at the end of September.  Once we've fixed the bugs and the specs are final, we'll start the certifications and the production, and we expect to have the product on the market in February 2014.
Is What I See What I get?
Will the product I get actually look like the one in the video?
Will the messages I see actually appear like the one in the video?
The answer to both questions is, yes, if not better!  In particular:

Concerning the design of the glasses, the actors in the video are wearing the eyeglass model that we have currently selected, the sporty one, to which we had attached for this purpose the actual electronic circuit and optical system from the previous prototype.  In the next few months we will test other designs, and try to improve still, so the eyeglasses could look like the ones in the video, or probably better.  The design you see in other images also on this page, such as the classic look, are previous prototypes, again we believe we can improve on them. The frame in the video is still a little thick, we've made it thinner afterwords.

The image above (sporty look) shows a bulky optical - electronic element.  Forget about that: it is the 3d of the current prototipe, we made it bulky because we need room to work on it.  As soon as it's finalized we'll miniaturize it, no worry.

The lens will probably be slightly tinted, not completely transparent, because people who do not need eyeglasses don't want to be asked if their sight has deteriorated, and sunglasses blend better in every day use.

As for the aspect of the messages, the guys who produced the video (brilliant work of Pongofilms from Modena, Italy) were given the actual formats and screenshots from our sdk simulator, so the messages should look quite like those in the video - except if we hire a good designer, which we will do.
(very provisional, we’ll update them over time)
We expect to have two-three designs in two-three sizes, but this will depend on the partnerships we’ll bring home.
Weight around 65 grams (tested on our first prototype)
Sensors: accelerometer, compass, ambient light sensor, precision altimeter, perhaps more (the GPS is already on your smartphone, so we don’t need it)
Optical system, made of a display and a set of lenses and mirrors. The resolution of the display is 320x240. If you ask more details on the optics, you’re a competitor.
One day of battery life recharge via mini-usb
Lenses: Lenses will be slightly tinted

Controls: A touch-pad, with the usual controls (tap, double tap, long press, swipe vertically and horizontally), we are deciding now which ones to keep for us to on/off the projector (probably the long press), the others will be left to the developers to manage the apps.
Color combinations: The frame you see in the video is red on white, it's one of the two versions we plan to sell - the other is green on black

Prescription glasses - we get asked all the time, and a hard one: can our GlassUp be used with your prescription lenses? The lens of our GlassUp is very special, so you can not replace it with yours. We are working on a solution. We’ll likely be able to accommodate simple vision defects at a small cost

Next versions - We will have to make tough calls in for the evolution of the product. The roadmap (a camera, voice controls? binoculars?..) will take into account market feedback (and yours!) and consider what will be achievable by the team while we increase the team size

We plan to release a few apps on our own, such as the notifier, the visual impaired help, the translator. For the rest, we’ll release the APIs and rely on external developers. We’re confident that there will be many, both because they’re already calling every day, and because Andrea has already gone through this with his smartwatch, and thousands of developers have downloaded the APIs.

On May 25, we presented for the first time our SDK and simulator to a Hackathon in Milan. The winning team developed an app that would read the engine data from the processor of a car or motorbike and send them on the glasses.

Our API will work for Android (they already are) and iOS (almost done), probably also for Windows 7 but this still needs work (on Microsoft side, obviously). We’ll also have to create a translator, a compiler, that will make it possible to convert relatively easily the current mobile apps to show the messages on the eyeglass, instead of on the display of the mobile.
Business model, distribution, marketing, partnerships, investors

We are working hard to make strategic partnerships, as we want to distribute the product through existing proven channels. We are currently in talks with some companies in different fields: eye-wear, telecommunications, consumer electronics, sports, games - we can’t name them yet and we don’t want to anyway. We have high confidence that at least one of these agreements will be finalized. In case none does, we are already in talks with national importers and distributors.

Our business model is to sell the glasses, and let the external developers sell the apps they make. In addition to the general consumer market, of techies and sportsmen/women, there is a wealth of rich and huge niches (medical, gaming, museums, and so on), that we can work on - when we’ll have time to do it.

In early June the Senate is planning to vote on a bill (Lieberman-Collins, CISPA's big brother) that would end meaningful online privacy. Our plan: we want to kill this bill like we killed SOPA.

We are Fight for the Future, a project of the Center for Rights, a non-profit organization with a mission to defend fundamental rights online. We were the central organizers behind the SOPA web blackout, American Censorship Day, and Free Bieber campaigns. We can help be a driving force to beat this latest legislative violation of online rights too.

We estimate that it will take $10,000 to fund this organizing effort. Fortunately, Bob Fertik of Democrats.com has graciously volunteered to kick in up to $5,000 in matching funds, so we just need to raise $5,000. Specifically, we need to fund two full-time organizers with web design and development help for two months. We have a great designer who can make flyers, infographics and other materials up to the minute as the campaign progresses. Make sure we don't run out of gas.
We're confident we can kill this bill as long as we have the resources to go all out over the next couple weeks. We will do the following:

[UPDATE 6/1: We've been moving ahead with all of the items listed below. Thousands of calls have been placed, meetings and Senate office drop-ins have happened, emails have been blasted to senators. We're in a great position for when the Senate returns next week. Please, if you can, help us reach our goal of $5,000 so we can secure all of the matching funds. Less than 40 hours to go. Thank You!]

- We will execute on a plan that can delay CISPA in the Senate, ensuring that it dies completely. We will organize people around the country to make thousands of calls to meet with their senators in their home states over the Memorial Day recess to talk about this bill. When senators know that their constituents care and are willing to come out on this, they take this with them to DC (we promise). Meeting with senators face-to-face is the single most effective thing we can do to affect how they vote or if they vote at all.
- We will have central organizing website with a checklist of the steps to help kill CISPA. (UPDATE: www.privacyisawesome.com)
- We will offer a call widget through Mobile Commons that connects people's phones to Senate district offices. This tool is expensive and will cost us $5,000.
- We will have an organizer on to help people plan and prepare for these meetings.
- We will create tools to remind people to call and give them what to say.
- We will pivot to showing up at their Memorial Day events, drop-in meetings and ad hoc gatherings if senators are too busy to meet with us.
- We are working with coalition partners to drive as many phone calls and meetings with Senators as possible.
- We will delay the Senate vote on Lieberman/Collins and score a win for internet freedom.

If the bill passes, all existing privacy laws would be nullified and companies would be encouraged to share all of your emails, texts, and chats with the government with full legal immunity. If you can help us fund this organizing, you'll be doing something huge to defend the internet as a free, open and protected space for doing awesome stuff.
Can your organization or website spread our call to action? Besides donating, one of the best ways you can help is to get the organizing site in front of as many people as possible.
Can you pledge to send the site to 50,000 people? Write us at team@fightforthefuture.org to tell us so we can give you due credit.
Fight for the Future is a project of our 501(c)4 Center for Rights in Action. Your receipt will show Center for Rights in Action.

Thank you for helping to make this campaign happen!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: I don't like running, will the app still work?
column2: >A: You don't always have to run and you could also go for a walk with it. If you're at home for example and won't be moving, the app will still work. Simply turn the Travel function off.
column4: > What if there's a time difference?
column6:
> Your travel data will be stored and your partner will be able to run along to your pace the next day. However, the walkie-talkie function will not be available for this mode.

Q: Why isn't there a chat function?
A: The Great Affair is about creating a more intimate, shared experience. There are many good applications that allow people to chat with each other.

The Story Behind the Girl Who Wants to Make a Difference

Hello world. My name is Gloria and I left the tiny tropical island of Singapore in October 2009 to work in Beijing. Convinced that I had to go to art school to be more ""creative"", I moved to London in January 2013 to do my masters at Central Saint Martins.

For the first couple of months, I struggled with apartment hunting, adapting to London's dark, wet winters and getting acquainted with the life of being a poor art student. However, the thing that affected me most was riding my bike around the city alone. I missed my friends in Beijing, especially Big Dirty Cycling. Rain, shine or snow, we used to ride every Thursday night. Facebook and Instagram only made me miss them more.

Earlier this year in summer, I joined my first art hackathon and everything changed. I came up with an idea to ride with them even though we were geographically separated. The idea was well-received and I realised that there were many people who wanted solitary activities to be less lonely. It has become my mission to turn this dream into reality for anyone who is in a long distance relationship - with partners, friends or family!

The Christmas Wish

Actually, I have a bigger wish this Christmas: to get as many people as possible to be on board with this app idea so that British Airways, Nike, Path and Spotify would collaborate with each other (or at least two of them) and build this app. Why?

column1: • Nike+ Running App allows you to choose music that's currently on your device but with Spotify, you will be able to share a common music library and create collaborative playlists. It will encourage people to subscribe to Spotify so they can enjoy ad-free access, thus paying more artists.
• Instead of adding your entire Facebook network, Path is for ""people in your life who matter most"".

• Airlines could provide you with flight offers for specific routes instead of newsletters with what they think you may like or what they want you to like. I was moved by British Airway's Visit Mum campaign and thought they seemed like a good company to partner with.

Everyone I have spoken to thinks it would be amazing if they all worked with each other but few people believe it was possible. Someone once told me: ""a community can change the status quo"". I'm going to stand by that. 

What I Need

I have already built a simulator of the app with Arduino and tested it with lots of people to get their feedback before I'd finalised on the features and functionalities of the app. My friends Joel and Jonathan have very kindly dedicated their time and helped me put this crowdfunding video together but I still need:

• An iOS app developer
    Previously trained as a web designer/developer, I tried to pick up iOS programming over the past couple of months but given the complexity of this app, I need a professional app developer for the job.

• A graphic designer
    The young and talented graphic designer Romain Blatter from Atelier Julian Legendre will be designing the brand identity and graphics for the app.
With £10,000, I will be able to get the iOS version developed (in about 18 weeks) and anything raised in excess will go towards getting an Android version developed.
column2: >Cocoa Hernando has very kindly and generously sponsored this amazing set of travel inspired luxury chocolates to support this project.

column1: Without a doubt, there are challenges to building this app such as network latency and limited bandwidth but also partnering with the right music services. Historically, it would take about 18 weeks to build an app but given the complexity, it may take longer to have all the features and functions working smoothly.
Do you have photos of people you miss who are not living in the same city as you? Share the photos and tell them how much you miss them.

With your support, we can make this happen.
Thank you so much.

An Android developerBecause not everyone's an iPhone user.

With £10,000, I will be able to get the iOS version developed (in about 18 weeks) and anything raised in excess will go towards getting an Android version developed. Cocoa Hernando has very kindly and generously sponsored this amazing set of travel inspired luxury chocolates to support this project.

Without a doubt, there are challenges to building this app such as network latency and limited bandwidth but also partnering with the right music services. Historically, it would take about 18 weeks to build an app but given the complexity, it may take longer to have all the features and functions working smoothly.
Do you have photos of people you miss who are not living in the same city as you? Share the photos and tell them how much you miss them.
With your support, we can make this happen.Thank you so much.

My name is Ryan and I love smart phones (#teamiphone) and think Siri is my true love.But anyway I have friends that do video work and music and some of us have vision problems.We heard about order prescription lenses and to be honest it was to costly and a hassle in our opinion.It is very uncomfortable trying to shoot videos wearing eyeglasses.I know some people do just wear contacts but there are alot of people who prefer not to. Guess what I don't wear contacts because I know I will fall asleep with them in or lose them.
  Well after joking around with my buddies we started brainstorming and came up with the idea of basic disposable lenses for cam recorders and even some smart phones. We know some peoples vision issues need to be treated with prescriptions but we also found out the most common vision issues are nearsightedness, farsightedness, astigmatism and presbyopia. We wanted to deal with Davison to help with our project until we heard about Indiegogo.
   We were advised to come up with prototypes of each design and it can cost up to 7 Grand. We want to launch this product off looking right and have every angle covered.We put together a video to support our idea and hopefully we will hit the market by 2015. We don't really want to run a company but make money off the products so any advice our contacts to companies interested in supporting our cause please feel free.We will respond to all questions and comments.


 We do have some awesome perks.I know some of our supporters may not have vision issues so we got with some of our musician friends to offer some free music to go along with the products we provide.Please understand that we will make this dream happen one way or another we ask for your help to hopefully get the ball rolling faster.
 Check out our perks we know how people want name recognition and credit for sponsoring projects such as this.So we will put together a video with all supporters name in it when we launch the project.God Bless and Thank You for your time.

We don't really want to run a company but make money off the products so any advice our contacts to companies interested in supporting our cause please feel free.We will respond to all questions and comments.  We do have some awesome perks.I know some of our supporters may not have vision issues so we got with some of our musician friends to offer some free music to go along with the products we provide.Please understand that we will make this dream happen one way or another we ask for your help to hopefully get the ball rolling faster. Check out our perks we know how people want name recognition and credit for sponsoring projects such as this.So we will put together a video with all supporters name in it when we launch the project.God Bless and Thank You for your time.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

It looks frightening. It IS frightening. The second edition of the WOS is even more powerful than the first one, definitely the most powerful iPhone speaker and possibly the most powerful single speaker on the market. With 44 elements plus four mega powerful subwoofers and a weight of 178 kilos it is only for people who believe music should be enjoyed loudly.
But apart from being insultingly powerful, the WOS 2.0 is also a piece of exquisite handmade art, made by skilled carpenters and engineers, equipped with graceful mids and crystal clear highs.
Listening to music the WOS 2.0 way is not a statement. It's a way of living.

Apart from the basic features you might except from an iPhone speaker, Bluetooth, tube amplifier, individually built chambers for the speakers we have built in some pretty cool stuff you might not expect from a speaker. Like a monkey head.

The small monkey head is warning you if playing too loud. Normal (high) volume and the monkey has no problem, his eyes are glowing blue but if you play very loud the eyes turns golden, if you keep on increasing the volume they will turn red. Red means there's an immediate risk for permanent hearing loss. After five minutes playing in the red zone, the monkey´s head pops and the music stops. Once the monkeys head is returned the speaker can be used again, This is a safety feature to prevent damage to ears and property.

Four years ago, we at Studio Total made the first batch of Wall of Sounds. The news spread across the world, making it perhaps the most hyped Audio Gadget in 2008. Our limited edition sold out in days, but the orders kept flowing in from all around the world. Even Kanye West wanted one for his New York crib. Sadly we had neither time nor resources to make so many. We also had other things to do.
Some of the media coverage from WOS 1.0
(We are a special agency, you can watch some of our work: Bears, The Micasa Labs, Hervis Pillow Fight.

Now we have finally developed a follow up. It is basically very similar to the first: the worlds most powerful iPhone speaker, only even MORE mind bendingly, intelligence insultingly powerful. At full throttle it outputs more than 8000 watts, enough to fill a football field, making your electricity bill a serious issue. Of course we also packed it with the latest tech
column2: like bluetooth connection, the new iPhone dock and a improved tube amplifier. <span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column3: >Integrated volume control and an ornament (eyes that glow, white when playing normally and red when playing loud). We also developed an iOS app what controls the WOS 2.0.

With our first two campaigns out of the way, and more than 2800 of our rulers being used all over the world, we've decided to launch something a little different for one week only...

Introducing the CarbonCover!

The CarbonCover is a small, discrete and extremely easy to install premium webcam cover that protects you from being spied on. (We also use them to prevent the camera getting scratched on things like our iPads and phones.)

Cyber security is a big deal these days. We've all heard the stories that range from companies being hacked and vast amounts of data being stolen, to mass surveillance recording and gathering data on everything we do. Along with protecting the files on your devices, protecting yourselves (and others) is just as important!

Held securely in place with 3M adhesive backing, the CarbonCovers will fit to a vast range of devices - be it laptops, all-in-one desktops, tablets or even smartphones. A quick swipe of the finger will slide the cap to either reveal, or cover the camera lens. Fitted in seconds and easy to remove without causing any damage. They're made from the same premium materials as our last campaign, which really helps set them apart from the rest. Why use plastic when you can use carbon fibre?
• Open or close the cover whenever you need with one finger
• At 1mm thick you're able to close your laptop lid on it no problem

Our aim was not to create 'the thinnest webcam cover in the world', but rather, the best. (And the most carbon-y.)

We're fully aware that there is nothing new with the concept of covering up your webcam. Many people (famously including Mark Zuckerberg and former FBI head James Comey) use a little square of tape - as do many people that are interested in cyber-privacy. 

The problem with tape - as we've discovered for the last year or so of using it - is that it's not very practical. It needs to be removed when you want the camera and leaves a residue when you peel it off. They also ruin the look of your devices...

Already use tape? Go for a practicality and style upgrade with the CarbonCover! 

The CarbonCover fully blocks the webcam when closed, but a handy feature (tested on Apple devices) is that the LED indication light remains exposed - so whether a program you're using, a dodgy website or a hacker activates the webcam, you'll be aware of this even though they're not recording any image. 

But why do I need to cover my webcam?

Programs often sold as 'spy on your ex-girlfriend software' are available on the internet and allow people to spy on you using the webcam or front-facing cameras built into your devices. Simply put, if someone can control your webcam and record anything they want - isn’t this something you’d like to prevent? With access to a webcam, people can capture everything and privacy no longer exists. Closed door meetings at work, your children playing in the living room or even things far more intimate can all be targets for users of this type of software. (more on this at the bottom!)

Doing things differently. 

There have been several campaigns for webcam covers that have come and gone on Kickstarter before ours, with many of you probably having backed them! Unfortunately, it seems that there have been numerous issues with them. Everything from flimsy construction and unfeasibly small/thin components, through to supply chain issues, rewards simply not turning up and no communication from the creators.

We hope our simple approach to the design, and great track record of delivering a large volume of high quality carbon parts to backers all over the world will inspire a bit more confidence and keep as many of you safe from webcam hackers as possible!
column8:
Prototyping.

With dimensions of 16.5 x 11 x 1mm, the CarbonCover is tiny. It's small enough to be completely unobtrusive, and yet its rounded edges and glossy carbon twill compliment the design of your device and really set itself apart from other webcam covers on the market. The best selling covers on sites like Amazon are also 1mm thick and in all the testing we've been doing we're yet to find an issue with closing a laptop lid on it.

To develop these covers we began by speaking to our fantastic manufacturing partners. With their advice on board, we made sure the design wouldn't be an issue for the manufacturing tolerances we've come to expect from them - a key area we feel many other campaigns have failed on due to designs that are unrealistic for accurate and consistent machining in large quantities. 

A few 3d printed prototypes later we were able to order our first batch of CarbonCovers to carry on testing. The comparatively large surface area for the 3M adhesive backing ensures the CarbonCover stays firmly in place on all your devices. The sliding lens cap is really easy to open and close with a single flick of the finger. No messy glue or magnets involved here! While the adhesive will remain sticky if you choose to remove the cover and apply to another device, we include a spare adhesive ring for just this eventuality! 

Rewards and Incentives.

If you like the CarbonCover, back it at whatever quantity takes your fancy - then share it with your friends and followers on social media to receive 1 FREE ADDITIONAL COVER! (Don't forget to post the link in the comment section above!)

Will the CarbonCovers fit my devices?

CarbonCovers can be secured to any device with a camera of up to 4.6mm in diameter. We have come across some larger webcams on old laptops, but the CarbonCover still works just fine. In these instances the edges of the cover may be just visible when you're using the webcam, but it will still be perfectly usable for skype/etc. When in the closed position, the lens is fully covered. 

Tell me more about webcam spying!

 

At just over a minute in length this video perfectly demonstrates why you want to have your webcam covered. It is now common knowledge that intelligence organisations around the world can access a webcam without the user ever knowing. However, the bigger privacy threat is actually from hackers, blackmailers and cyber stalkers - thanks mostly to the software being so easy to get hold of and install. If the CarbonCover isn't for you, and you don't fancy buying any of the alternatives, at least grab a bit of tape and get those cameras covered!

column1: Our fulfillment center is located in San Diego, California and has the capabilities and experience to handle world wide logistics. What does all of this mean? It means your LIVE WORK PLAY HYBRID POWER CASE will arrive before Christmas!
We do not anticipate any delays **however** depending on our production volumes, and acts of God, there is always a chance we may experience delays in getting all the units shipped.

Crowdfunding has created a unique situation where consumers are expecting things to hit very tight deadlines that truly are difficult to perfectly predict. We have done our best to account for unexpected delays, and will do our best to handle any bumps, but there is always a chance we could hit a snag bigger than we plan for.

If needed we have the ability to scale up with the intention of shipping all of the units from the campaign between November and early December. We will keep you apprised as things develop and let you know where things stand once the campaign closes.

column2: >Got a question? Maybe it is answered below. If not, drop us an email CustomerService@LVWRK.PL

column1: - $8 For all orders placed in the United States.
Q: Is the HYBRID POWER CASE available for the iPhone 6 Plus or Samsung Galaxy?
A: No. Right now it is only for the iPhone 6 (4.7"" display). The PULSE PORTABLE CHARGER however is compatible with every modern mobile device.
Q: How does the HYBRID POWER CASE increase the volume of my iPhone 6?

A: We engineered two small canals inside the case around the iPhone's speakers. This small but impactful design implementation redirects the iPhone's sound waves towards you for improved acoustics and increased volume.

To experience what it sounds like hold your iPhone 6 in your right hand and play your favorite song (Make sure to turn up the volume all of the way). Now, cup your left hand like you are holding water inside it and place your iPhone 6 with the speakers placed a 1/2 inch directly above the center of the palm of your left hand.
It won't rattle the windows, but you can definitely hear the sound improvement.
Q: How many times can the HYBRID POWER CASE charge my iPhone 6?
A: This all depends on how heavily you use your iPhone 6 (brightness, apps, talk time, video play etc)  but you should get one and a half full charges.
Q: What devices can the HYBRID POWER CASE charge?
Q: Can I sync my iPhone 6 with the HYBRID POWER CASE still attached?
Q: Does the HYBRID POWER CASE interfere with reception at all?

column7: >How much weight will the HYBRID POWER CASE add to my iPhone 6?
>It is very light. The HYBRID POWER CASE weighs 3.35 ounces and is about 26% lighter then the iPhone 6 which weighs 4.55 ounces. Grab three pieces of bread and that's close.

column1: Q: I love my Apple EarPods / EarBuds! Can I use them with the HYBRID POWER CASE on my iPhone 6?
A: Yes. You will have no problem plugging in any of the Apple designed headsets that came with the iPhone 6, iPhone 5 , or iPhone 4.

column2: >Q: I want to order in bulk, who do I need to speak with?
>A: For bulk order inquires please contact us at Hi@LVWRK.PL

column1:
About Us

Southern California based LIVE WORK PLAY (www.LVWRKPL.com) seeks to change the way you live work and play with your favorite mobile electronics. All of our products are designed to deliver complete confidence and total freedom - the freedom to live however, whenever and wherever life takes you. 

                           DESIGNED IN CALIFORNIA | BUILT FOR ANYWHERE



","Meet the world's best case for the iPhone 6

The iPhone 6 is an amazing piece of hardware, but it is marred by several drawbacks.  Most people still need to charge it twice a day with normal usage, the speakers direct the sound away from the user  and it is rather uncomfortable in the hand, even slippery sometimes.

We wanted to create an iPhone 6 power case that people would love, rather then simply carry around separately and use periodically as a backup battery. The HYBRID POWER CASE feels fantastic in the hand, the sound boost is rich, the extra battery power is robust (not to mention much needed), the kickstand is surprisingly useful and not needing to carry an extra cable to charge the HYBRID POWER CASE is incredibly handy.
We really like it and we are just happy that other people do to."" - LIVE WORK PLAY

Great product design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Great product design is how it works. The HYBRID POWER CASE by LIVE WORK PLAY truly is the ideal everyday iPhone 6 case to keep you charged through the day and well into the night.

The HYBRID POWER CASE intelligently protects your iPhone 6 and enhances your phones functionality. The dual integrated speaker canals located at the bottom of the case redirect the audio towards you, optimizing playback and increases your speaker performance. The protective and powerful light-weight design also delivers more than 200% extra battery power with the push of a button. All of this means you will have more time to talk, chat and run your favorite Apps. We also engineered the HYBRID POWER CASE with a raised beveled edge, which lifts your screen off of flat surfaces. Your iPhone 6 truly never sounded better or lasted longer.

This case is more than just functional, it’s designed to enhance the appearance and features of your iPhone 6. Our new HYBRID POWER CASE for the iPhone 6 merges intelligent sound distribution, more protection and precision engineered battery power.

The HYBRID POWER CASE has cut-outs for the iPhone's camera, flash, side switch, side buttons, lightning connector and headphone port. No ports or sensors are covered or blocked, making it a true extension to your iPhone 6. Every curve and edge of the case has been meticulously designed for an ultra-thin 15mm profile without sacrificing much needed protection.

Achieving a beautiful ergonomic design was a key factor in designing the HYBRID POWER CASE. Every corner, seam, and opening has been refined into a smooth continuous form. For the outer shell, we completely wrapped the HYBRID POWER CASE with a soft touch metallic rubber composite to increase comfort and provide an improved grip. We are proud to say that the HYBRID POWER CASE truly feels amazing in your hand even while holding your iPhone 6 for long periods of time.

Your iPhone 6 is an incredible robust machine that isn't just used for talking, web browsing, and texting. We understand that sometimes you want to have a handsfree Skype call or even enjoy a movie.  With this in mind we added in a kickstand to the back of the HYBRID POWER CASE that will allow you to enjoy more of your favorite content on your iPhone 6 handsfree.  Weighing in at only 3.35 ounces, all of these must-have features are packed into an elegant design that fits comfortably in your pocket.

Hate carrying around extra cords that are only made for charging individual gadgets? So do we! That is why we engineered the HYBRID POWER CASE with QUICK CHARGE TECHNOLOGY. You can fully charge your iPhone 6 in under two hours and the device also allows you to use your existing Apple Lightning cable to charge and sync the HYBRID POWER CASE. The days of losing, searching and packing extra charging dongles and cables are long gone!

This is not our first time bringing an awesome product to market. Rest assured that we are using a trusted manufacturer who currently manufactures our first product, the PULSE PORTABLE CHARGER. We’ve already initiated the tooling for HYBRID POWER CASE and we expect to ship all of the orders at the end of November if not before.

Our fulfillment center is located in San Diego, California and has the capabilities and experience to handle world wide logistics. What does all of this mean? It means your LIVE WORK PLAY HYBRID POWER CASE will arrive before Christmas!
We do not anticipate any delays **however** depending on our production volumes, and acts of God, there is always a chance we may experience delays in getting all the units shipped.

Crowdfunding has created a unique situation where consumers are expecting things to hit very tight deadlines that truly are difficult to perfectly predict. We have done our best to account for unexpected delays, and will do our best to handle any bumps, but there is always a chance we could hit a snag bigger than we plan for.

If needed we have the ability to scale up with the intention of shipping all of the units from the campaign between November and early December. We will keep you apprised as things develop and let you know where things stand once the campaign closes.
Got a question? Maybe it is answered below. If not, drop us an email CustomerService@LVWRK.PL
Q: How much will shipping cost?
A: *One unit purchases*  ( HYBRID POWER CASE)

A: We engineered two small canals inside the case around the iPhone's speakers. This small but impactful design implementation redirects the iPhone's sound waves towards you for improved acoustics and increased volume.

To experience what it sounds like hold your iPhone 6 in your right hand and play your favorite song (Make sure to turn up the volume all of the way). Now, cup your left hand like you are holding water inside it and place your iPhone 6 with the speakers placed a 1/2 inch directly above the center of the palm of your left hand.
It won't rattle the windows, but you can definitely hear the sound improvement.
Q: How many times can the HYBRID POWER CASE charge my iPhone 6?

A: It is very light. The HYBRID POWER CASE weighs 3.35 ounces and is about 26% lighter then the iPhone 6 which weighs 4.55 ounces. Grab three pieces of bread and that's close.
Q: I love my Apple EarPods / EarBuds! Can I use them with the HYBRID POWER CASE on my iPhone 6?
A: Yes. You will have no problem plugging in any of the Apple designed headsets that came with the iPhone 6, iPhone 5 , or iPhone 4.

column2:
>NOW SHIPPING.

 

 

Protect and Upgrade your Smartphone

Each year our smartphones get smarter and faster.  But each year we need them to do more: to last longer
column3: capture and store higher resolution videos
column4:
allow us to watch 4k movies.  They can lag behind the demands you place on it. For example, how long does your battery last?

 

The i-BLADES Smartcase (www.i-blades.com) is a phone case that delivers an entirely new level of performance and functionality to your smartphone. Transforming its capabilities.

 

The i-BLADES Smartcase upgrades the capabilities of your smartphone through attachable and detachable Smartblades. They even bring new functional possibilities for making your life easier.

 

 

Slimline Protection

    A tough, durable but slimline protective phone case. That protects from scratches and abrasions and drops. Drop tested up to military grade standards (MIL-SPEC 810G-516.6) from 4ft.

    Available in premium Napa leather or soft-touch rubber coated TPU.

     

     

    Our soft touch leather wallet Smartcase has protection, smart technology but also it acts as a replacement leather wallet. The i-BLADES Leather Wallet Smartcase is made from the highest quality grain leather that is exceptionally smooth to the touch. It is designed as a wallet replacement with slots for cards and has all the snap-on functionality of a Smartcase.

     

    It has a smooth tactile feel with an exclusive satin-like finish.  It's irresistible to touch and the first time that such advanced technology has been encased in a premium leather finish. 

    SHOP OUR LEATHER WALLET SMARTCASES

     

    Advanced Smart Technology

    The i-BLADES Smartcase is the most advanced and intelligent smartphone case ever created, covered by existing and pending patents. Its built-in micro processing technology intelligently enables your smartphone functionality to be expanded and enhanced in limitless ways. Supercharge your phone with new capabilities. Simply insert your phone into the low profile protective case.

    Technology upgrades for new Smartblades become available over time without you buying another smartphone.
column5:
> 

 

By attaching our slimline Smartblades you add that extra functionality to your Smartcase - whether it's battery, memory or numerous other capabilities.  Importantly it allows you to add this ONLY when you need it and then you can easily clip the Smartblade off when finished. There is simply no other case like it.

The possibilities of what Smartblades can do for you are limitless. No rushing to power points when your battery is low, no ""out of memory"" notifications when capturing those unmissable memories. No need for other separate devices, with the right Smartblade you can do anything. 

The Smartblades can be stackable as well, so you can stack and charge multiple Smarblades in one go if you wish.

 


 

The i-BLADES Tech

There are three key parts to our patented and patent pending technology. 

1) Integrated smart technology in the case
column7:
/>

The i-BLADES Smartcase has an intelligent built-in MCU that can automatically detect which Smartblade is attached, without you doing anything. The Smartcase can tell if you have placed a memory blade on the case, or a battery blade and it will adjust the functionality it offers the smartphone accordingly.

2) High-speed data connection

i-BLADES has designed a smart system that delviers energy and data at high-speed and efficiently from the Smartblade to the Smartcase without wires.  This is faster and more efficient than other wireless technology allowing data to be transferred without wires. 

This is universal across ALL Smartblades making them compatible with all current and future Smartcases, regardless of smartphone operating system. 

3) i-BLADES Smart App

The Smartcase comes with software that will load onto your smartphone, allowing you to both manage the additional functions and enjoy the content available. You can transfer data from your Smartblade wirelessly, enjoy the environmental 4-1in-1 sensor in your case or capture photos directly to your Smartblade.

 

<
column9:
Now Shipping

After all the support and the hard work of our team we are now shipping Smartcases for the Galaxy S6, S6 edge, S7, S7 edge, S8, S8 Plus, Note 8 and shortly the S9 and S9 Plus.  The iPhone is on our future roadmap later this year.
 
We would like to thank all our supporters.
 

We will be launching more Smartcases and Smartblades in the near future. We now offer a range of Smartcase at www.i-blades.com.

 

 

 

 

 

The journey

Its been a long journey, from a Dana Coffee Shop in Silicon Valley to hands of our customers.  We have been designing, revising, testing, re-testing, tweaking, improving the experience and the product. Unlike other ventures we did not want to launch until we were ready and we were confident that people would love our product when they got it in their hands. 

 

Our Passionate Team

 

 

We’re an international team with a  background in innovation, technology and consumer electronics. We are based in Silicon Valley. We have run and launched successful businesses and products. Inventor and CEO Jorge Fernandes created and patented the technology that launched Apple Pay, We’re passionate about combining hardware and software into delivering a new world of smartphone possibilities. We’re especially excited about hearing your feedback and your ideas for i-BLADES.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Is there an application that runs with i-BLADES Smartcases?

Yes there is. The i-BLADES Smart App is the application that runs on your smartphone and controls the functions of your Smartblades.

 

What models and makes of smartphones are you currently supporting?

We are launching on Indiegogo with the Samsung S4 and S6 first. We will be announcing more models shortly. Note it’s just the Smartcase that is unique to a phone model,  the Smartblades are swappable and interchangeable.

What operating systems will i-BLADES Smartcases support?

Our intention to offer Smartcases across all operating systems.  But we are starting out with Samsung G6 and GS4 smartphones first. Our Smart App will work on any smartphone we design for.  All Smartblades are universal for any Smartcase regardless of the operating system or phone type.
Will the Smartblade fall off?
No. The magnetic connection that holds the Smartblade to the Smartcase is very strong.  We have had to create a quick release slot to help people take off the Smartblade. The snap on mechanic will last for millions of cycles its very robustly designed.

Do magnets affect the functions of my smartphone?

No.  They do not.

 

Does the Smartcase interfere with my antennae reception?

All Wi-Fi and 4G functions on your smartphone are unaffected by the Smartcase case. You may wirelessly charge or use NFC features.

Does the Smartblade interfere with my antennae reception?

All Wi-Fi and 4G functions on the smartphone are unaffected by the Smartblades. You may NOT wirelessly charge or use NFC features to their fullest when the Battery Blade is snapped on. 

What is the compatibility of i-BLADES in countries outside the U.S.?
i-BLADES Smartcases are fully compatible with smartphones supported worldwide.

 

 

Do I need to charge my phone and i-BLADES Smartcase separately?

No. You can charge your phone and Smartcase with blade together at the same time, or you can choose to charge them separately. You may choose to have multiple Smartblades charged for quick on the fly swapping of power. We have designed Smartcases so you don’t have to change what you’re already doing. 

 

 

How do I know my Smart Battery Blade needs charging, and how do I know when it is fully charged?

The i-BLADES Smart app will tell you. It will send you alerts so you know you need to power up and recharge.

When I snap the Smart Battery Blade on the Smartcase does it generate heat?

 

No it does not generate considerable heat when you connect the Smart Battery Blade.

 

How thick is a Smartblade?

Smartblades vary in thickness from 2mm up to 9mm. In the main they will be slimmer.  However, sometimes when functionality dramatically increases thickness may increase, for example with Smart Battery Blades size is related to power.

 

 

Does the Smart Battery Blade work seamlessly with my phone’s battery, do I need to do something? 

The Battery Blade runs seamlessly with your phone’s power and is automatically self-managing so you don’t even have to think about it.

 

Can I transfer files from the Smart Memory Blade onto my laptop or desktop?

Yes, you can easily transfer files from your Smart Memory Blade to a laptop or desktop.

What happens if I lose my Smart Memory Blade, can others see my files?

Each Smartblade, including the Smart Memory Blade, has a public portion and a private portion on it. So it’s up to you as to how and with whom you share the various sections. If you do lose a Smartblade, only the “public” portion is viewable.

 

How quickly does the Smart Battery Blade charge?

The Smart Battery Blade uses Lithium Ion technology and charges at the very same rate as your smartphone. 

 

How many Smartblades can I attach and stack to the Smartcase at one time?

 

We have designed our stackable Smartblades to stack infinitely or snap on and snap off on the fly. We will offer people the choice of stackable and non-stackable Smartblades. Of course it’s all up to you to determine how many fit comfortably as you use your phone.
column11: >Can I share or swap Smartblades with friends?

column1: Yes, you can share Smartblades with friends. Please note that each Smartblade has a public area and a private area that you control accessibility.

column4: >Please share this with your friends in your Social world!

NOTICE: Thickness is the main concern for people.  The production units will be light and 1/4"" thick.

We developed a revolutionary electrical generator design.  We had an example of the design tested by Advanced Energy on the North Carolina State University campus – a U.S. Department of Energy Test Site.  In other words, what they say is incontrovertible.  The generator was extraordinarily easy to turn, made tremendous power, and had an exceptionally high efficiency (how much effort it took to turn it versus how much power you got out) at low RPM – 92.3%.

column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">
Here’s the link to their final report – http://www.ftcinnovations.com/FTCReport.pdf

column1: As we have been successfully building generators of all sizes for over 7 years, it was easy for us to take that exceptional design and miniaturized it.  One great thing about that design is that no matter which way you turn the generator shaft it always produces the same polarity.  In other words, the red lead is always positive and the black lead is always negative.  That gave us an idea.

Years ago some wrist watches were ‘self-winding’.  By just walking around, you wound your mechanical watch.  That ‘self-winding’ was accomplished by using a half-circle weight connected to a shaft.  The weight always tried to stay level with gravity.  The wearer’s movement caused the weight to be shifted.  The weight would react by swinging back one way or another. Through some gears, that swinging motion wound the watch.

We took that same principle, but instead of tying the weight to gears we connected it to the shaft of our miniaturized generator.  Moving the device caused the weight to swing the generator’s rotor back and forth.  This movement created electrical current because the magnets on the rotor are swept past stationary coils of wire.  We take that electrical potential and convert it into charging voltage.

This only works because the proven power, efficiency, and ease of turning inherit in our revolutionary generator.  Again – we have been tested by the highest rated independent 3rd parties so you can be confident in our assertions.  Ordinary generators cannot do what our highly efficient generator has proven it can do.

How does the user benefit?  The patent pending iMoveCharger™ cuts the cord -- so to speak.  If you drop this little device in your pocket or purse, your motion will cause the generator to charge its internal battery.  You can simply connect your device to the iMoveCharger™ and never be without power again. It’s light, rugged, and water resistant.  You can select charging voltages from 3.3 vdc to 15 vdc and all voltages in between.  We’ll even supply multiple adapters so that virtually every known device can be charged.
Whether you are walking, running, riding your bike, or just reaching for something
column2: the iMoveCharger™ will be converting that motion into power you will be able to use.  Think about it.  Every move you make means more battery life.  Just walking down the hall adds power to your battery.  Shift your weight in your chair – more power.  If you move at all, you’ll have more power.  Our revolutionary generator makes this all possible.  The heart of the iMoveCharger™, the generator, is a proven thing and it will take battery anxiety out of your life forever.  Never lose that important call again.  Using our technology, you will always stay connected to your world.

column1: We have all the pieces in place to make the iMoveCharger™ in quantity quickly if we are able to reach our financial goal.  The manufacturer has been identified.  The suppliers of the parts are ready to deliver.  Obviously, the design has been proven.  The only thing we are waiting on is the people willing to help us fund our project.

The projected retail price of these units will be $80 and we expect to sell a lot of these at that price.  To get the process started, however, we are going to offer the first 1,000 for only $50.  You also get a two year replacement warranty if the unit should ever fail.  We use the finest magnets, the most advanced circuitry, the best bearings, and the strongest materials in order to give you the best product possible.   A product that will last for years and give you exceptional value.

column4:
>

Thanks to support and feedback from the ShiftCam community, our design team has taken the award-winning original version and made it even better.

A slicker, sleeker solution for users who are constantly on the go.

ShiftCam 2.0 is a comprehensive set of 6 camera-enhancing lenses in 1 convenient and portable iPhone case. The shifting mechanism allows users to get the most out of their dual camera feature.
column6:
>

Now with an upgraded 6-in-1 shift mechanism, improved lens capacity and a more ergonomic case design, this slim-lined protective iPhone case enhances your dual lens camera function.

The ShiftCam 2.0 comes complete with magnetic lens cover and brand new additional front-facing wide angle adaptor.

column2:
wmode=transparent"" width=""612"">
 

ShiftCam 2 - ProLens Short Video
column6:
>

Used in conjunction with the ShiftCam 2.0 iPhone case, these groundbreaking interchangeable Pro-grade lenses give users the freedom to capture images of the highest-quality without the expensive, heavyweight equipment.

The five-strong range of individual lenses includes:

column3:
'/>

We’re going to make this really simple for you:

column1: • 1. Click the back now button below.
• 2. Take a look at our list of Perks and choose the one that suits you best.
• 3. Pledge and wait for your order to arrive.

column2:
>

Compact and portable, the Pro Lens expansion set turns your iphone into a pocket-friendly professional camera.

Used in conjunction with the ShiftCam 2.0 iPhone case, this five-strong range of interchangeable lenses includes Pro Wide Angle, Pro Telephoto, 238° Pro Fisheye and Pro Macro.

column5:
>

ShiftCam products are designed by photographers, for photographers. We know each of our products successfully enhance the photographic capacity of your iPhone – they do the job, so why not make them look and feel good too?

The ShiftCam team has worked tirelessly to develop to create products that are lightweight, compact and ergonomically designed. With an improved shift mechanism, a magnetic lens cap and a sleeker soft- touch finish, the ShiftCam 2.0 is the best version of the multi lens phone case to date. Built to last, the cases are compact, durable and with an inner rubber casing, protect your iPhone.
column6:
>

The Pro Lens set harnesses several decades of the ShiftCam design team’s photography experience to produce pro-grade lenses, taking mobile photography to a whole new level. Travel-friendly, each interchangeable lens can be on hand at all times so that you can focus on making memories last.

column2:
>

Creators of the world’s first 6-in-1 dual lens case for iPhone 7/8 plus and X

In early 2017 ShiftCam was founded with a mission to reinvent mobile photography, making it even more convenient, compact and comprehensive. Our aim is to enable the most seamless transition from smartphone to a professional camera.

Our team is made up of a group of photographers, designers, and engineers who have a vision of taking photography to a whole new level. These are the people who developed ShiftCam, an ingenious product combining a comprehensive set of 6 camera-enhancing lenses in 1 convenient and portable iPhone case.
column3:
>

Now, thanks to support and feedback from the ShiftCam community, our design team has taken the award-winning original version and created an even slicker, sleeker ShiftCam2.0 and the ProLens expansion collection.

We believe the ability to take creative photos should be accessible to everyone. So if you don’t have an iPhone 7/8 Plus or X, not to worry... there’s always RevolCam, the ultimate camera solution for any smartphone.

The beauty of photography should have no limits – ShiftCam ensures nothing gets in your way.

Creators of the world’s first 6-in-1 dual lens case for iPhone 7/8 plus and XIn early 2017 ShiftCam was founded with a mission to reinvent mobile photography, making it even more convenient, compact and comprehensive. Our aim is to enable the most seamless transition from smartphone to a professional camera.Our team is made up of a group of photographers, designers, and engineers who have a vision of taking photography to a whole new level. These are the people who developed ShiftCam, an ingenious product combining a comprehensive set of 6 camera-enhancing lenses in 1 convenient and portable iPhone case.Now, thanks to support and feedback from the ShiftCam community, our design team has taken the award-winning original version and created an even slicker, sleeker ShiftCam2.0 and the ProLens expansion collection.We believe the ability to take creative photos should be accessible to everyone. So if you don’t have an iPhone 7/8 Plus or X, not to worry... there’s always RevolCam, the ultimate camera solution for any smartphone.The beauty of photography should have no limits – ShiftCam ensures nothing gets in your way.

The Ultimate Tool for Data Storage 

iKlips DUO+ is a smart lightning flash drive which enables you to backup, connect, and share your media at lightning speed, with improved design to fit seamlessly with any case on. That’s right, get your files in no time – even with a thick, waterproof cover!

 

It enables you to take your HD movie collection with you on flights, record hours of 4K video without running out of memory space, or the ability to do serious video editing on your iPad Pro, and then effortlessly move, copy and share data between your iOS device and your desktop – in the smallest, most stylish package yet.

 

 

 

 

 

Secure, Cloud-free data storage. 

With iKlips DUO+ there's no need to pay monthly fees for cloud storage or worry about the security of your data. Our complimentary app is the perfect data management tool custom-made for both iPhone and iPad.

 

 

 

 

Camera, iCal, Facebook, Instagram, &
column2:

Our app backs up data from your Camera, Calendar, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube apps, and has a variety of features designed to make your life so much easier.

 

 

 

 
 
 

Landscape mode too. 

It also supports landscape and portrait modes on all Apple devices!

 

 

 

 

 

Watch movies &
column3:
listen to music. No data or WiFi required. 

Watch HD movies on your flights, listen to your entire music collection, record up to 6 hours of video, and have the ability to shoot and save up to 68,000 photos without running out of storage, data, or using a Wi-Fi connection. iKlips DUO+ is truly the perfect sidekick for your international travels or nature-bound weekend trips.

 

 

 

 

 

The World's Fastest Memory Storage System

Produced with top-quality flash memory, iKlips DUO+ features one of the world’s fastest memory storage systems. It’s super-fast, stable, &
column4:

LifeProof and OtterBox friendly. 

With the extended Lightning connector and overall design of iKlips DUO+ you can use easily use iKlips with any iPhone or iPad case, including LifeProof and OtterBox.

 

 

 

 

 

The perfect sidekick for your device and adventures. 

Take iKlips DUO+ on all of your adventures without worrying about your phone getting damaged or running out of storage while your taking photos and video clips!

Six Colors

Zinc alloy makes iKlips DUO+ shock-resistant and dustproof, so it is able to withstand long-term, day-to-day use and the Aluminum alloy is the same premium aluminum found in Apple’s iPhone 6. The concentric circles-brush finish highlights the uniqueness of the special flash drive: it's slimmer and smoother than any other flash drive on the market.

Fits all your storage needs. 

iKlips DUO+ is available in three different storage capacities: 32GB / 64GB / 128GB, to fit all of your storage needs.

 

 

 

Truly made for Apple devices. 

Designed specifically for Apple devices, the iKlips DUO+ meets strict performance and manufacturing standards. Fully certified and licensed by Apple as a “Made for iPhone, iPad &
column2:
