Record your videos directly to iKlips DUO+

The iKlips Camera lets you record video in 4k directly to iKlips DUO+ with no limits on file size. Just like using the iDevice built-in camera app, simply tap the screen to focus, press the shutter and record for hours. No more worries about video storage space on your iDevice!
column6:
'>Goodbye 4GB file size limit.

iKlips DUO+ comes formatted in exFAT, so there are no limitations on individual file sizes. Competing devices are usually FAT32, limiting individual file sizes to 4GB – not even enough for most HD movies.

 

 

 

Model Name: iKlips DUO+ 

Interface: Lightning connector and USB Type-A connector for USB 3.1 Gen1
*NOTE: The 2 connectors cannot be plugged in any device simultaneously.

Capacity: 32GB/64GB/128GB

Transfer Speed Read Speed: up to 130 MB/s. exFAT support

OS Compatibility: iPhone 7, iPhone 7 Plus, iPhone SE, iPhone 6s Plus, iPhone 6s, iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5s, iPhone 5c, iPhone 5, iPad Pro, iPad mini4, iPad Air 2, iPad mini3, iPad Air, iPad mini 2, iPad mini, iPad (4th gen.) iPod touch (5th gen.)
iOS 8 or above / Windows XP/7/8 /10/ Mac OSX""

Certificate MFi (Made for iPhone/iPad/iPod): CE/FCC/BSMI/C-tick/WEEE

Memory Solution: Flash memory

Format: FAT32, ex-FAT

App Requirement: Free download App: iKlips. Up to date app specs can be found at the iTunes App Store.

Dimensions: L 53.4 x W 12.2 x H 9.5 mm 

Weight: 7.4g

Warranty: One year

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

How does iKlips DUO+ work?
iKlips DUO+ works together with our free iOS companion – the Free iKlips App. When inserting iKlips DUO+ in to your device, you’ll automatically be prompted to download it.

 

Does iKlips DUO+ require charging?
No. iKlips DUO+ is 100% powered by your device – no battery or charging needed.

 

Which devices are compatible with iKlips DUO+?
Any iOS device is compatible: iPhone, iPad, iPad Pro, iPad Mini, Mac, and PC.

 

Can you transfer data to and from iDevices to PC?
Yes, you can easily transfer data between PC and Apple devices.

 

Has iKlips DUO+ been certified by Apple?
iKlips DUO+ is fully Mfi-certified by Apple as a product made for iPhone and iPad, guaranteeing strict performance and manufacturing standards.

 

Which video formats does the DUO+ support?
iKlips DUO+ supports mp4, mov, m4v, mkv, avi, rm, and rmvb video formats.

 

Can you take photos or videos from your computer and transfer them to your iPhone or iPad? 

Sure, you can transfer any type of data from your computer to the iKlips DUO+, videos and photos included.

 

Does it support subtitles?
Yes - mp4 and srt in utf-8 coding.

 

Which music formats are supported?
iKlips DUO+ supports mp3, wav, acc, diff, and m4a music formats.

 

How about other formats?
In addition to iOS-native formats, the following file types can be stored and viewed on DUO+: pdf, epub, txt, doc, docx, xls, xlsx, ppt, pptx, jpg, png, tiff, gif, and bmp.

 

Can you store apps on iKlips?
No. but you can connect the iKlips 3.0 app with your Facebook, Instagram and YouTube accounts to directly save the files you shared with friends on social media.

 

Are apps supported?
Apps can’t be installed on iKlips DUO+ directly, as iKlips DUO+ is used purely for content and files.

 

How does the iKlips App work?
Great question! Check out this video we made about how it works: https://youtu.be/kMpheT200kQ

 

Can I play movies or music off my iKlips on my phone?
Yes! The iKlips app has a great built-in media player so you’ll be able to watch or listen to all of your favorites.

 

How can you transfer data to and from iDevices to PC?
It’s super easy! To transfer from iOS to PC or Mac: Insert your iKlips DUO+ into the iDevice's lightning port, open the iKlips app and transfer desired data from the iDevice to your iKlips DUO+. Then remove the iKlips DUO+ from the iDevice and swivel the connector body to the USB side to insert into your PC or Mac USB port. The iKlips DUO+ will appear as external storage so simply transfer the data however you like from there without the assistance of the app.

Reverse the process to transfer to your iOS device from a PC or Mac.

 

How many hours of video can I store on my iKlips?
32GB About 1.5 hrs. of 4K Video
64GB About 3 hrs. of 4K Video
128GB About 6 hrs. of 4K Video

 

How many photos can I store on my iKlips?
32GB About 17,000 photos
64GB About 34,000 photos
128GB About 68,000 photos

 

How many songs can I store on my iKlips?
32GB About 8,000 songs
64GB About 16,000 songs
128GB About 32,000 songs

 

Say I'm at a concert - can I record a video and have it directly save to my iKlips so it never takes up space on my phone? Is that the same with photos?
YES! When taking video or photos with the iKlips camera function it will save directly to your iKlips DUO+ by default. (This can be changed in the camera function settings)

 

Is iKlips available for Android devices?
None of the iKlips series works with Android devices as no Android device uses the lightning connector.

 

Will iKlips work with my iPad or only my smartphone?
Of course it will. Furthermore, the iKlips app differentiates between iPhones and iPads in order to give you the best experience for whichever device you’re currently using.

 

What devices are iKlips compatible with?
It requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with lightning enabled iPhones, iPads, iPad pros and iPod Touches.

 

My phone has an Otter Box/ Life Proof case on it. Can I still use iKlips?
YES! We designed the iKlips DUO+ with thick and durable cases in mind.

 

If I have other questions, who should I contact?
Don’t hesitate to send a message to hello@adamelements.com!

 

What are the shipping methods and rates for iKlips?
We offer free shipping by either USPS or DHL depending on your location.

 

In comparison to other cloud-based services, how can iKlips ensure my content is safe?
The iKlips DUO+ is not a cloud based service so there are no internet security risks.

 

Why is iKlips better than cloud storage?
You don’t need an internet connection to get to your data.

 

What are the transfer speeds?
Lightning: Read speed 25 MB/s
USB 3.1 : Read speed 130 MB/s

 

Will iKlips use my data?
Nope.

 

Is there a warranty?
Yes. Each iKlips DUO+ has a one-year warranty.

 

Can iKlips DUO+ be shipped?
Yes. iKlips DUO+ will be shipped worldwide with DHL or USPS for peace of mind. After dispatch, a tracking number will be provided for you to track your order. Orders take around 5 working days for delivery. Please provide your telephone number in case we need to reach you.

 

What if I want to return my iKlips DUO+?
Not a problem. If you wish to send it back to us, simply contact us at hello@adamelements.com

 

Disclaimer: Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

iLanyard™, Making Technology Wearable™

We all know the hassles that an unwieldy earbud cord presents. They can get in your way at the most inconvenient times. And, what the heck do you do with them when you want to take them out and chat with someone for a moment.

Note: Prototype end grips are high resolution 3D prints.

Doubles as a Cord Wrap

When you want to pack away your earbuds you can use iLanyard™ to tie everything into one nice, neat bundle, without detaching the end grips. The next time you need your earbuds they'll roll right out, untangled and ready to use. 

Eyewear iLanyard, Too!

Turn your earbud cord into a lanyard for your sunglasses. Just attach these to the earpiece of your eyewear, then clip on your earbuds and, voila! Now your earbuds and eyewear are held tight.

Safe and Secure

As with anything worn around your neck, it's extremely important that it be able to easily release in case of entanglement. While you might think earbud cords are thin and break easily, think again. The tensile strength of a high quality flat earbud cord exceeds 10 lbs (4.5 kg). That's more than enough to cause serious personal injury. Imagine an earbud cord caught in a car door and the car quickly driving away. In that split second, the cord absolutely must be able to easily break free.

iLanyard™ is designed to release with less that 1/4 lb (0.12 kg) of pull. We use a patented open groove design molded from pliable TPR (thermoplastic rubber). Your earbud cord will hold secure under all normal circumstances, yet easily release when necessary without causing injury.

Materials and Construction

The iLanyard™ neck strap is made of soft nylon cord. The end grips are molded from a firm yet pliable TPR (same material as many jacket zipper pullers). The TPR is co-molded onto the cord creating a permanent connection between the cord and grip ends.

We'll also be making end grip versions for both round and flat cords.

Note: The prototype earpiece tips for the eyewear iLanyards™ are patent protected by another company. We're using these for demonstration purposes only. On the final product we will be using our own design (shown above).

Colors, colors, colors. And Reflective too!

Everyone loves colors. Our cord will come from legendary climbing rope manufacturer, BlueWater Ropes, a US manufacturer with a history that dates back over 100 years. We use 3mm cord for these products. Their standard style 3mm cord comes in
column2: >Red, Blue, Purple, Forest, Mandarin, Black, Camo, Red Mix, Forest Mix, or Mandarin Mix.
column3:
>Bluewater cords are made of solution dyed yarns. This adds color prior to the extrusion process (where they spin the molten nylon into fiber) thereby avoiding the energy intensive and dirty process of dyeing the yarn afterward. Solution dyeing also makes the fibers completely colorfast. The cords are UV resistant and will retain their full brightness for years. [I've toured factories doing solution dyed yarn. It's fascinating to watch in action.]

Bluewater reflective cord has a strand of reflective strip woven in to provide a visual accent in low light or night situations, available in Blue, Red, Orange, Yellow, and Black.

End Grip Color Accents

We'll be able to do all the cord colors we need regardless of funding level because we can purchase the cord in small lots. The end grips are a custom design and mold, and will require minimum runs for each color. If we only hit a low funding level we'll have to just stick to black end grips. But as funding goes higher we'll look to color coordinate the end grips to the cord colors for a more compelling product selection.

Patent pending design, filed in 2008

iLanyard™ is part of an extensive patent filing related to earbud cord management systems. We filed our
column9: ved=0CEoQ6AEwAw"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">patent in 2008 and have, to date, received 3 issuances from the USPTO (
column12:
>US8621724 B2). The lanyard embodiment of this filing is still pending but we're expecting issuance on that aspect very soon.

Where we are in development

I have over 25 years of manufacturing experience, including a wide range of molded products. We have the 3D files completed and ready for the molder. In the video you see a hard 3D printed prototype that we've used to test the fit and function of iLanyard™. Once the project is funded it takes about 30 days to cut the mold, and then another ~2 weeks to mold the parts.

Sorting and packing the rewards should take another two weeks and then we'll be shipping your iLanyards™. The May delivery date includes a healthy margin for unexpected problems. If we get a strong response for this product we may need a little extra time to run production.

Long Term Vision

I've done domestic manufacturing, having run my own factory for 13 years, and I've done manufacturing in China (even speak Cantonese). But, while I have nothing against off-shore production, I truly love making stuff in my own facility. There's just something astoundingly great about doing it yourself!

While initial production of these parts will definitely be done in China, my long term goal is to turn this into a broad line of earbud cord management products, and to produce all the products in my own facility in the US.

This simple Indiegogo project is just the first step on a long journey to building a successful manufacturing venture. Years from now, given a little luck, you'll be able to say, ""I was one of the first backers that helped start that."" 

Come along! You'll enjoy the ride.

- - - - - - - - - - - -

Special thanks to Greg Bass, Director of Product Dev at Timbuk2, for being a great sport as our spur-of-the-moment model. And also, thanks go to Jason Miller, of The Finer Points, for his masterful voice-over.

Now your earbuds and eyewear are held tight.Safe and SecureAs with anything worn around your neck, it's extremely important that it be able to easily release in case of entanglement. While you might think earbud cords are thin and break easily, think again. The tensile strength of a high quality flat earbud cord exceeds 10 lbs (4.5 kg). That's more than enough to cause serious personal injury. Imagine an earbud cord caught in a car door and the car quickly driving away. In that split second, the cord absolutely must be able to easily break free.iLanyard™ is designed to release with less that 1/4 lb (0.12 kg) of pull. We use a patented open groove design molded from pliable TPR (thermoplastic rubber). Your earbud cord will hold secure under all normal circumstances, yet easily release when necessary without causing injury.Materials and ConstructionThe iLanyard™ neck strap is made of soft nylon cord. The end grips are molded from a firm yet pliable TPR (same material as many jacket zipper pullers). The TPR is co-molded onto the cord creating a permanent connection between the cord and grip ends.We'll also be making end grip versions for both round and flat cords.Note: The prototype earpiece tips for the eyewear iLanyards™ are patent protected by another company. We're using these for demonstration purposes only. On the final product we will be using our own design (shown above).Colors, colors, colors. And Reflective too!Everyone loves colors. Our cord will come from legendary climbing rope manufacturer, BlueWater Ropes, a US manufacturer with a history that dates back over 100 years. We use 3mm cord for these products. Their standard style 3mm cord comes in Red, Blue, Purple, Forest, Mandarin, Black, Camo, Red Mix, Forest Mix, or Mandarin Mix.Bluewater cords are made of solution dyed yarns. This adds color prior to the extrusion process (where they spin the molten nylon into fiber) thereby avoiding the energy intensive and dirty process of dyeing the yarn afterward. Solution dyeing also makes the fibers completely colorfast. The cords are UV resistant and will retain their full brightness for years. [I've toured factories doing solution dyed yarn. It's fascinating to watch in action.]Bluewater reflective cord has a strand of reflective strip woven in to provide a visual accent in low light or night situations, available in Blue, Red, Orange, Yellow, and Black.End Grip Color AccentsWe'll be able to do all the cord colors we need regardless of funding level because we can purchase the cord in small lots. The end grips are a custom design and mold, and will require minimum runs for each color. If we only hit a low funding level we'll have to just stick to black end grips. But as funding goes higher we'll look to color coordinate the end grips to the cord colors for a more compelling product selection.Patent pending design, filed in 2008iLanyard™ is part of an extensive patent filing related to earbud cord management systems. We filed our patent in 2008 and have, to date, received 3 issuances from the USPTO (US8225465 B2, US8539649 B2 and US8621724 B2). The lanyard embodiment of this filing is still pending but we're expecting issuance on that aspect very soon.Where we are in developmentI have over 25 years of manufacturing experience, including a wide range of molded products. We have the 3D files completed and ready for the molder. In the video you see a hard 3D printed prototype that we've used to test the fit and function of iLanyard™. Once the project is funded it takes about 30 days to cut the mold, and then another ~2 weeks to mold the parts.Sorting and packing the rewards should take another two weeks and then we'll be shipping your iLanyards™. The May delivery date includes a healthy margin for unexpected problems. If we get a strong response for this product we may need a little extra time to run production.Long Term VisionI've done domestic manufacturing, having run my own factory for 13 years, and I've done manufacturing in China (even speak Cantonese). But, while I have nothing against off-shore production, I truly love making stuff in my own facility. There's just something astoundingly great about doing it yourself!While initial production of these parts will definitely be done in China, my long term goal is to turn this into a broad line of earbud cord management products, and to produce all the products in my own facility in the US.This simple Indiegogo project is just the first step on a long journey to building a successful manufacturing venture. Years from now, given a little luck, you'll be able to say, ""I was one of the first backers that helped start that."" Come along! You'll enjoy the ride.- - - - - - - - - - - -Special thanks to Greg Bass, Director of Product Dev at Timbuk2, for being a great sport as our spur-of-the-moment model. And also, thanks go to Jason Miller, of The Finer Points, for his masterful voice-over.",15.0,0,"1 Campaign

Who are we?

We are 4th year students from Digital Interaction Design and Product Design courses at the University of Dundee, and together we are Social Digital.

We’re designing products that address real issues in a variety of fields such as health and wellbeing, education, communication technology and many more. Our tools and methods differ, but all of our designs focus on enhancing people’s lives.

You will be able to see our work on display at the Duncan of Jordanstone Degree Show in May and New Designers in London in July. These are great opportunities to showcase our talent and to meet people working in the industry.
THIS IS WHERE WE NEED YOUR HELP!

In order for us to showcase our work, we need to get materials to build our exhibition space/structures, design and print brochures/catalogues and also transport all equipment, build and products down to London for New Designers.

column3: >Donate £5 - You will receive a beautiful and unique postcard designed by our students.
>Donate £20 - Guided tour and hospitality package at the Degree Show.
>Donate £50 - Signed brochure with a printed acknowledgement for your donation.
>Donate £75 - Commemorative poster designed by us. (A3 size)
>Donate £100 - Your name will be displayed at the Degree Show and New Designers for acknowledgement alongside a copy of all previous rewards.

column9: >If you would like to support us, your help would be very much appreciated.

I am a software developer by profession and I enjoy technology. As a hobby
I have always been playing around with optical instruments like microscopes and
telescopes. I also have some background in production as my family used to own
a small unit in the past.
Please do see the demo video. It's a short video of about 3.5 minutes video that covers all the important information.
This microscope is a complete redesign of the classical field
microscope. It's a very compact design and is made especially for
smartphones. You can simply use your smartphone screen to view the enlarged
image and click pictures and videos. It's
great fun to use and also has an amazing educational value for kids,
students or teachers. It's very easy to use. My own 8 year old is already hooked on it.
- High quality optical parts as found in any professional microscope
- Long lasting battery life (over a year with normal usage)
- Comes as a complete set which includes a carry case and prepared slides
- Dimensions: Length 140 mm, Width 55 mm, Height 140 mm
It has the perfect magnification to enjoy watching the amazing world of
microorganisms. All the demo pictures and videos have been shot with the above
combination. Thanks to high quality optics, the image quality is so amazing that

you can even do further digital zoom to increase the magnification. Or you can simply stream a live video directly on your TV (if your mobile phone allows screen mirroring).


Quality
components to achieve this amazing image quality. This is not comparable with
any other microscopes which use only single lens. The body is made of high quality aluminium with anodizing finish similar to that found in apple products.
Designed and prototyped by me in Switzerland (where I live).
The parts are made in Asian countries as per my 3D designs.
These parts are then quality controlled and carefully assembled in Switzerland
from where the final product will be shipped.<div>
The road from idea to final product is a very long one.  I am well aware of this considering my past production background.  This product is
not just an idea but it's in the advanced stage of production. The parts used
for trial production are actual parts produced with plastic molding and metal cutting machines, the same process as they would be produced in mass
(not from 3D printing).  Now it's more about achieving the economies of
scale so that it's possible to keep the costs low.
By funding this campaign you can be the first ones to own this
cool product.  The raised funds along with my personal
investments will be used to produce this microscope in large quantity so that

the economies of scale can be achieved. You will be helping to spread this product along with its educational value to many many more people at an affordable price.  It's so simple to use, that even kids can use it.
You receive a hand written thank you note.
Once I have my costs covered, I intend to pass on this perk to students
and teachers in poor countries by offering them my product at reduced price or
even for free in some cases. The details are still to be worked out.

59 USD for the full microscope set 
The full microscope set contains all the accessories needed, like carry case and prepared slides. I have even added a few plain slides and
cover slips for your use. I want you to have a full experience without having
!!!!Note: I do need to charge additional 20 USD shipping charge for shipping the product outside Switzerland.
I have set this campaign as a flexible one. Which means that if I am not able
to achieve full funding, you will still get the product. Even though this means
that my production cost will be much higher initially. My motivation here is
mainly to bring this interesting product to as many people as possible. I do
hope that as more and more people know about it, the sales will then pickup.
Any temporary issues during the production process can affect the
expected delivery dates. For example it can happen that some part acquires a defect in the process of mass production. This will then have to be fixed
again which can cause a delay of few weeks in the delivery of final product.
However, the risk is already minimized as a trial production has already
experience in how the production and assembly works, I can ensure you that the
are not able to participate, you can still help me by spreading the word
around. For example if you know other people, like friends, students or
teachers who could be interested in something like this, you can let them know
about this product. You can use Indiegogo share tools for this
purpose or just send them a link to this page.

column3:
>For Your Phone

A revolutionary power bank with built-in bluetooth speaker and wireless earpiece, allowing you to stream your music anytime, in anywhere.
column4:
>Civia In The Press

""This is by far the best implementation I have seen for switching between speaker and earpiece synergies.""    

""I believe that this device with so many versatile functionalities is a must-have device for everyone.""
column5:
>The Most Versatile Power Bank

Versatile. Sleek. Compact. Civia isn't just a 5000mAh charging station for your digital device, it's also a Bluetooth speaker and a wireless earpiece with built-in magnetic charging base.
column6: >2 Amp Ultra Fast Charge

column1: Super Charge, Fully Safeguarded

column3:
Leather Body

We wanted Civia to not only be extremely functional, but also beautiful. The out casing has an exquisite aluminum front, which received a 32-step anodized finishing process and a leather back which will age beautifully over time.
column4:
>Small In Size, Big On Sound

Using a unique digital signal processor, and customized ultra slim dynamic speaker, we eliminated every bit of wasted space and shrink the speaker down to a compact dimension without giving up high performance audio fidelity.
column5:
>Durable And Portable

At just 160g and 13.5mm thin, Civia is designed to go wherever you go. And it's as durable as it is portable, with an aluminum and leather combined body that delivers a quality and luxurious feel.
column9:
>With Powerful Chip

The wireless earpiece is driven by the powerful CSR8615 chip that integrated Bluetooth 4.1. It produces extremely efficient wireless for a better connection and crystal-clear stereo audio. There is a magnetic charging base for the earpiece to sit on that juice up the earpiece. You can stream music for 4.5 hours on a single charge.
column11:
>Hanging Design

The wireless earpiece has been designed to hang in your ears and come with no additional pressure to the conch and ear canal areas. Just pop the it into your ears and play your music.
column13:
>Optimum Voice Quality

Civia wireless earpiece adopted latest CVC 6.0 noise isolation technology to maintain your voice call quality by efficiently mitigating background noise.
column14:
>The Power Of One Single Button

Use the single button to play, pause, make and take phone calls, or to simply loop the song you love.
column15:
>Pair With All Bluetooth Devices

Connect to any Bluetooth enabled device to listen musics, stream movies, immerse yourself in games, or even to just walk around the house to answer your phone calls.
column17:
>Support Our Project

column8: >I would like to introduce you to the BravoBot

column1: BravoBot is available with dual or single all metal hotends for single or multi extrusion printing. Dual will allow for simultaneous printing of multiple colors, multiple materials or printing using a dissolvable support material.

Small prints are not a problem with BravoBot. This print was done with a 0.4 extruder nozzle and as you can see that even with a rather large nozzle it still produces very high resolution prints. total print time was under a minute and a half.

column2: >

column1: Build Chamber Heater with Integrated carbon Filter

The following materials have been successfully used in this machine with great results. PLA, ABS, LAYWOO-D, LAYBRICK, Nylon, TPE, Polycarbonate and High Impact Polystyrene. I even ran some trimmer line threw it just to see what it would do, and to my surprise it printed very well.
What this means is, that upon the successful launch of this kickstarter. I will make all the of the blueprints, mechanical drawing and wiring diagrams available for download.

column2: >

column1: The digital temperature controller allows for very accurate temperatures within the build chamber. Temperature measurement and control -30℃ to 300℃/-22℉ to 572℉ Temperature upper and lower limits setting function With power-fail data save function.
We are using a Ramps 1.4 and ArduinoMega2560, because they are a reliable and proven control systems for 3D printing.
The production model will not contain any wood. It will be comprised of an Extruded aluminum frame and acrylic panels.
All of the Injection Molded Plastic Parts on BravoBot are off the shelf parts ordered in bulk. So as to make them less expensive and readily available online should you ever need a replacement.
These are some of the programs I like to use for printing are Slic3r, Cura, Sketchup, MeshLab and SolidWorks
BravoBot is compatible with the majority of the printing software currently available for Mac, Linux and Windows.

column3: >

column1: These are the stretch goals so far, if you have thoughts on the goals listed or would like to see other goals let me know. My goals is you give you the best product for your money.
","I would like to introduce you to the BravoBot

BravoBot is available with dual or single all metal hotends for single or multi extrusion printing. Dual will allow for simultaneous printing of multiple colors, multiple materials or printing using a dissolvable support material.

Small prints are not a problem with BravoBot. This print was done with a 0.4 extruder nozzle and as you can see that even with a rather large nozzle it still produces very high resolution prints. total print time was under a minute and a half.
This is a torture test print.
Build Chamber Heater with Integrated carbon Filter
Built In webcam For remote viewing

The following materials have been successfully used in this machine with great results. PLA, ABS, LAYWOO-D, LAYBRICK, Nylon, TPE, Polycarbonate and High Impact Polystyrene. I even ran some trimmer line threw it just to see what it would do, and to my surprise it printed very well.
What this means is, that upon the successful launch of this kickstarter. I will make all the of the blueprints, mechanical drawing and wiring diagrams available for download.

The digital temperature controller allows for very accurate temperatures within the build chamber. Temperature measurement and control -30℃ to 300℃/-22℉ to 572℉ Temperature upper and lower limits setting function With power-fail data save function.
We are using a Ramps 1.4 and ArduinoMega2560, because they are a reliable and proven control systems for 3D printing.
The production model will not contain any wood. It will be comprised of an Extruded aluminum frame and acrylic panels.
All of the Injection Molded Plastic Parts on BravoBot are off the shelf parts ordered in bulk. So as to make them less expensive and readily available online should you ever need a replacement.
These are some of the programs I like to use for printing are Slic3r, Cura, Sketchup, MeshLab and SolidWorks
BravoBot is compatible with the majority of the printing software currently available for Mac, Linux and Windows.
These are the stretch goals so far, if you have thoughts on the goals listed or would like to see other goals let me know. My goals is you give you the best product for your money.

0,"

Toro enables users to surf the internet, chat and send instant messages anonymously.

Toro aims to provide protection for ordinary people who want to follow the law.

The Toro is a physical device which ensures that traffic coming out of your computer is routed into the Tor network.

Why Toro?

 ""I don't see any reason why someone should purchase a device to access a free, publicly available service like Tor. It isn't any more difficult to setup than installing any other software...""

When a person uses Tor to bring up a Web page, the request is encrypted and sent along a random path through other Tor computers that act as relays. This obscures the originating IP (Internet protocol) address—a unique code that can be used to track down a Web user, to filter access to certain sites or services, or to build up a profile of a person’s Web use.

It is possible to get around such a block, however, but we configured the Toro software to act as a ""bridge,"" and made a private relay, that can only be discovered by word of mouth.

Generally, the process results in lag and restricts bandwidth, which deters some people from using Tor. The primary way to address that problem is to have more Tor relays in more places, connected to high-bandwidth, low-latency lines. Toro is  built with the computational resources necessary to smoothly run a large capacity Tor relays.

The Onion Router or Tor is a server that keeps users anonymous on the Internet. It works by moving data across many Tor servers, called ""hops"". The role of each server is to only move that data to another server. With the final hop moving data to the end site. As a result, information transmitted in this way is hard to trace.

Tor periodically creates virtual circuits through the Tor network through which it can multiplex and onion route that traffic to its destination. Once inside a Tor network, the traffic is sent from router to router along the circuit, ultimately reaching an exit node at which point the cleartext packet is available and is forwarded on to its original destination. Viewed from the destination, the traffic appears to originate at the Tor exit node.

For 100% safety, Toro is using servers placed in Deep Web to cloak your IP address.

Deep Web (also called the Deepnet,Invisible Web,or Hidden Web) is that portion of World Wide Web content that is not indexed by standard search engines. (This is in contrast with the portion that is indexed by standard search engines, known as the Surface Web.

Early estimates suggested that the deep web is 4,000 to 5,000 times larger than the surface web. However, since more information and sites are always being added, it can be assumed that the deep web is growing exponentially at a rate that cannot be quantified. (source: Wikipedia)


Plug'n'surf

Toro doesn't require any installation. Plug in the USB power cable (included) to power up the device. Then you plug in a cable(included) to the side labeled WAN and connect it to your router with existing cable on LAN/SETUP side. That's all!

The Tor software is a program you can run on your computer that helps keep you safe on the Internet. Tor protects you by bouncing your communications around a distributed network of relays run by volunteers all around the world: it prevents somebody watching your Internet connection from learning what sites you visit, and it prevents the sites you visit from learning your physical location. This set of volunteer relays is called the Tor network. You can read more about how Tor works on the overview page.

The Tor Project is a non-profit (charity) organization that maintains and develops the Tor software.

What protections does Tor provide?

Internet communication is based on a store-and-forward model that can be understood in analogy to postal mail: Data is transmitted in blocks called IP datagrams or packets. Every packet includes a source IP address (of the sender) and a destination IP address (of the receiver), just as ordinary letters contain postal addresses of sender and receiver. The way from sender to receiver involves multiple hops of routers, where each router inspects the destination IP address and forwards the packet closer to its destination. Thus, every router between sender and receiver learns that the sender is communicating with the receiver. In particular, your local ISP is in the position to build a complete profile of your Internet usage. In addition, every server in the Internet that can see any of the packets can profile your behaviour.

The aim of Tor is to improve your privacy by sending your traffic through a series of proxies. Your communication is encrypted in multiple layers and routed via multiple hops through the Tor network to the final receiver. More details on this process can be found in the Tor overview. Note that all your local ISP can observe now is that you are communicating with Tor nodes. Similarly, servers in the Internet just see that they are being contacted by Tor nodes.

Generally speaking, Tor aims to solve three privacy problems:

First, Tor prevents websites and other services from learning your location, which they can use to build databases about your habits and interests. With Tor, your Internet connections don't give you away by default -- now you can have the ability to choose, for each connection, how much information to reveal.

Second, Tor prevents people watching your traffic locally (such as your ISP) from learning what information you're fetching and where you're fetching it from. It also stops them from deciding what you're allowed to learn and publish -- if you can get to any part of the Tor network, you can reach any site on the Internet.

Third, Tor routes your connection through more than one Tor relay so no single relay can learn what you're up to. Because these relays are run by different individuals or organizations, distributing trust provides more security than the old one hop proxy approach.

Note, however, that there are situations where Tor fails to solve these privacy problems entirely: see the entry below on remaining attacks.

Is Tor like a VPN?

Do not use a VPN as an anonymity solution. If you're looking for a trusted entry into the Tor network, or if you want to obscure the fact that you're using Tor, setting up a private server as a bridge works quite well.

VPNs encrypt the traffic between the user and the VPN provider, and they can act as a proxy between a user and an online destination. However, VPNs have a single point of failure: the VPN provider. A technically proficient attacker or a number of employees could retrieve the full identity information associated with a VPN user. It is also possible to use coercion or other means to convince a VPN provider to reveal their users' identities. Identities can be discovered by following a money trail (using Bitcoin does not solve this problem because Bitcoin is not anonymous), or by persuading the VPN provider to hand over logs. Even if a VPN provider says they don't keep logs, users have to take their word for it---and trust that the VPN provider won't buckle to outside pressures that might want them to start keeping logs.

When you use a VPN, websites can still build up a persistent profile of your usage over time. Even though sites you visit won't automatically get your originating IP address, they still know how to profile you based on your browsing history.

When you use Tor the IP address you connect to changes at most every 10 minutes, and often more frequently than that. This makes it extremely dificult for websites to create any sort of persistent profile of Tor users (assuming you did not identify yourself in other ways). No one Tor relay can know enough information to compromise any Tor user because of Tor's encrypted three-hop circuit design.

Aren't 10 proxies (proxychains) better than Tor with only 3 hops?

Proxychains is a program that sends your traffic through a series of open web proxies that you supply before sending it on to your final destination. Unlike Tor, proxychains does not encrypt the connections between each proxy server. An open proxy that wanted to monitor your connection could see all the other proxy servers you wanted to use between itself and your final destination, as well as the IP address that proxy hop received traffic from.

Because the
column3:
f=tor-spec.txt"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Tor protocol requires encrypted relay-to-relay connections, not even a misbehaving relay can see the entire path of any Tor user.

While Tor relays are run by volunteers and checked periodically for suspicious behavior, many open proxies that can be found with a search engine are compromised machines, misconfigured private proxies not intended for public use, or honeypots set up to exploit users.


  • 10% of raised funds will be donated to the Official Tor Project and the Electronic Frontier foundation.



","Toro enables users to surf the internet, chat and send instant messages anonymously.Toro aims to provide protection for ordinary people who want to follow the law.The Toro is a physical device which ensures that traffic coming out of your computer is routed into the Tor network.Why Toro? ""I don't see any reason why someone should purchase a device to access a free, publicly available service like Tor. It isn't any more difficult to setup than installing any other software...""When a person uses Tor to bring up a Web page, the request is encrypted and sent along a random path through other Tor computers that act as relays. This obscures the originating IP (Internet protocol) address—a unique code that can be used to track down a Web user, to filter access to certain sites or services, or to build up a profile of a person’s Web use.It is possible to get around such a block, however, but we configured the Toro software to act as a ""bridge,"" and made a private relay, that can only be discovered by word of mouth.Generally, the process results in lag and restricts bandwidth, which deters some people from using Tor. The primary way to address that problem is to have more Tor relays in more places, connected to high-bandwidth, low-latency lines. Toro is  built with the computational resources necessary to smoothly run a large capacity Tor relays.The Onion Router or Tor is a server that keeps users anonymous on the Internet. It works by moving data across many Tor servers, called ""hops"". The role of each server is to only move that data to another server. With the final hop moving data to the end site. As a result, information transmitted in this way is hard to trace.Tor periodically creates virtual circuits through the Tor network through which it can multiplex and onion route that traffic to its destination. Once inside a Tor network, the traffic is sent from router to router along the circuit, ultimately reaching an exit node at which point the cleartext packet is available and is forwarded on to its original destination. Viewed from the destination, the traffic appears to originate at the Tor exit node.For 100% safety, Toro is using servers placed in Deep Web to cloak your IP address.Deep Web (also called the Deepnet,Invisible Web,or Hidden Web) is that portion of World Wide Web content that is not indexed by standard search engines. (This is in contrast with the portion that is indexed by standard search engines, known as the Surface Web.Early estimates suggested that the deep web is 4,000 to 5,000 times larger than the surface web. However, since more information and sites are always being added, it can be assumed that the deep web is growing exponentially at a rate that cannot be quantified. (source: Wikipedia)Plug'n'surfToro doesn't require any installation. Plug in the USB power cable (included) to power up the device. Then you plug in a cable(included) to the side labeled WAN and connect it to your router with existing cable on LAN/SETUP side. That's all!

column1: The Tor software is a program you can run on your computer that helps keep you safe on the Internet. Tor protects you by bouncing your communications around a distributed network of relays run by volunteers all around the world: it prevents somebody watching your Internet connection from learning what sites you visit, and it prevents the sites you visit from learning your physical location. This set of volunteer relays is called the Tor network. You can read more about how Tor works on the overview page.The Tor Project is a non-profit (charity) organization that maintains and develops the Tor software.What protections does Tor provide?Internet communication is based on a store-and-forward model that can be understood in analogy to postal mail: Data is transmitted in blocks called IP datagrams or packets. Every packet includes a source IP address (of the sender) and a destination IP address (of the receiver), just as ordinary letters contain postal addresses of sender and receiver. The way from sender to receiver involves multiple hops of routers, where each router inspects the destination IP address and forwards the packet closer to its destination. Thus, every router between sender and receiver learns that the sender is communicating with the receiver. In particular, your local ISP is in the position to build a complete profile of your Internet usage. In addition, every server in the Internet that can see any of the packets can profile your behaviour.The aim of Tor is to improve your privacy by sending your traffic through a series of proxies. Your communication is encrypted in multiple layers and routed via multiple hops through the Tor network to the final receiver. More details on this process can be found in the Tor overview. Note that all your local ISP can observe now is that you are communicating with Tor nodes. Similarly, servers in the Internet just see that they are being contacted by Tor nodes.Generally speaking, Tor aims to solve three privacy problems:First, Tor prevents websites and other services from learning your location, which they can use to build databases about your habits and interests. With Tor, your Internet connections don't give you away by default -- now you can have the ability to choose, for each connection, how much information to reveal.Second, Tor prevents people watching your traffic locally (such as your ISP) from learning what information you're fetching and where you're fetching it from. It also stops them from deciding what you're allowed to learn and publish -- if you can get to any part of the Tor network, you can reach any site on the Internet.Third, Tor routes your connection through more than one Tor relay so no single relay can learn what you're up to. Because these relays are run by different individuals or organizations, distributing trust provides more security than the old one hop proxy approach.Note, however, that there are situations where Tor fails to solve these privacy problems entirely: see the entry below on remaining attacks.Is Tor like a VPN?Do not use a VPN as an anonymity solution. If you're looking for a trusted entry into the Tor network, or if you want to obscure the fact that you're using Tor, setting up a private server as a bridge works quite well.VPNs encrypt the traffic between the user and the VPN provider, and they can act as a proxy between a user and an online destination. However, VPNs have a single point of failure: the VPN provider. A technically proficient attacker or a number of employees could retrieve the full identity information associated with a VPN user. It is also possible to use coercion or other means to convince a VPN provider to reveal their users' identities. Identities can be discovered by following a money trail (using Bitcoin does not solve this problem because Bitcoin is not anonymous), or by persuading the VPN provider to hand over logs. Even if a VPN provider says they don't keep logs, users have to take their word for it---and trust that the VPN provider won't buckle to outside pressures that might want them to start keeping logs.When you use a VPN, websites can still build up a persistent profile of your usage over time. Even though sites you visit won't automatically get your originating IP address, they still know how to profile you based on your browsing history.When you use Tor the IP address you connect to changes at most every 10 minutes, and often more frequently than that. This makes it extremely dificult for websites to create any sort of persistent profile of Tor users (assuming you did not identify yourself in other ways). No one Tor relay can know enough information to compromise any Tor user because of Tor's encrypted three-hop circuit design.Aren't 10 proxies (proxychains) better than Tor with only 3 hops?Proxychains is a program that sends your traffic through a series of open web proxies that you supply before sending it on to your final destination. Unlike Tor, proxychains does not encrypt the connections between each proxy server. An open proxy that wanted to monitor your connection could see all the other proxy servers you wanted to use between itself and your final destination, as well as the IP address that proxy hop received traffic from.Because the Tor protocol requires encrypted relay-to-relay connections, not even a misbehaving relay can see the entire path of any Tor user.While Tor relays are run by volunteers and checked periodically for suspicious behavior, many open proxies that can be found with a search engine are compromised machines, misconfigured private proxies not intended for public use, or honeypots set up to exploit users.10% of raised funds will be donated to the Official Tor Project and the Electronic Frontier foundation.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

KYSS: un logiciel gratuit contre la surveillance et le piratage de masse sur internet

Notre objectif est simple: fournir un logiciel simple, gratuit et légal pour que chacun puisse se protéger, contre la surveillance de masse opérée sans scrupule sur l'ensemble des activités internet, par de nombreux gouvernements et certaines corporations.


Pourquoi ?

Cette surveillance systématique sur internet n’est pas à prendre à la légère. Il en va de notre vie privée, de notre sécurité et de notre liberté.

L’Article 12 de la déclaration des Droits de l’Homme par les Nations Unies est clair :

""Nul ne sera l'objet d'immixtions arbitraires dans sa vie privée, sa famille, son domicile ou sa correspondance, ni d'atteintes à son honneur et à sa réputation…""


Alors que pouvons nous faire ?

Notre réponse à cette surveillance et ce piratage de masse, est de mettre à disposition de tous, un logiciel de chiffrement (""cryptage""), gratuit et facile à utiliser.

Le premier logiciel de la société KYSS (Keep Your Secrets Safe) permettra  de protéger vos e-mails et vos documents par un système efficace de ""cryptage"".

Quelles en sont les caractéristiques?

column1: • Les e-mails sont ""cryptés"" de point à point: seuls l’expéditeur et le destinataire peuvent lire les messages et les documents. Vous n’avez pas à donner votre confiance à une quelconque entreprise et à ses web-masters. Il en va de l’indépendance de la solution.
• Vous continuez à utiliser votre boîte mail habituelle (Gmail, hotmail et Outlook).
• Le logiciel KYSS est compatible avec tous les services internet (Serveurs, Routeurs, VPN etc.)

• La différence est que vos e-mails sont – quand vous le décidez – totalement chiffrés donc invisibles et privés ! Pour ce faire nous combinons trois algorithmes réputés de chiffrement dont celui utilisé par l’armée américaine.
• Le logiciel KYSS est libre de droit, gratuit et accessible par téléchargement à partir du site : www.kyss.email

Nous méritons mieux pour nos e-mails. Chacun mérite des logiciels de sécurité compatibles, libres et faciles pour protéger – à la demande – sa vie privée, sa sécurité et la liberté qui va avec.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Hiipe is the 1st chat app that rewards you for communicating like you already do. Users earn points – smart points – which they can redeem for a chance to win prizes or get discounts from participating merchants world wide
Hiipe is in Beta version and available for download for Android and iPhones.

Earn points for inviting others, chatting, calling, browsing the web, sharing pictures and videos - Things you do every day on one or more chat apps out there from Whatsapp to Instagram to Snapchat without getting anything in return except the feeling of being trendy!
With the points you earn you can enter into raffles for a chance to win prizes or get discounts to products and services all over!

Device and number independent - How many times do you have to register for Whatsapp and Viber, each time you switch phones or get a new number? And for every device you have, you have a different set of friends. With Hiipe, you do not have to re-register each time you get a new device or phone number. All this is made possible thanks to our patented email to phone number resolution approach.

Private and secure – keep your phone number private so you chat with who you want to, when you want to. Only chat with friends you want to chat with, and if you block a person or delete them from your list, they are done! No spam, no pranks! Furthermore, our end-to-end encryption ensures your chats are secure.

Let’s be real, the present version of Hiipe being a beta version is far from perfect, though it does well to showcase our concept. It is limited in usability and experience. We have already completed the design for the next major release and now need your help to get there. The money you contribute will enable us to:
1. Improve the design of the app interface to ensure it is bug-free, highly functional and user-friendly.
2. Introduce new chatting features like group chatting, video calling so you can interact face-to-face with family and friends from anywhere in the world.

3. Create merchant profiles in the app, improve merchant portal and acquire additional merchants so our users have access to exciting rewards like spa packages, travel discounts, fitness classes, and the latest electronic gadgets.
All backers get 1,000 starter points for immediate use. In addition, on launch day, backers will get:
$100 - 25,000 points + voucher for unlimited raffle entries for 2 months
$500 - 50,000 points + voucher for unlimited raffle entries for six months + VIP User Status
All backers get unlimited campaigns during beta phase. Additionally, upon launch, backers will get
$2500 – promotion voucher worth $6,000 + VIP Merchant club
$5000 – promotion voucher worth $15,000 + VIP Premier merchant club

Like Whatsapp, Viber, Tango, users easily discover friends and chat free of charge, HOWEVER, communication is private using patented technology that allows users to keep their numbers private and use email addresses only as reference for chatting in a similar manner in which Paypal uses email addresses to associate multiple bank accounts. This flexibility allows users can connect from ANY device which runs the app. Further distinguishing it from Whatsapp, Viber is the social element which connects users to friends of friends as well as merchants that match their preferences or whose campaigns they have participated in.

Like Groupon or LivingSocial merchants can promote products and services, HOWEVER merchants retain 100% of all sales and only pay a one time fee of $10 per campaign. Furthermore, merchants can offer raffles as an alternative to discounts to spur engagement and build their following, thereby providing a mechanism to build loyalty, which Groupon and LivingSocial do not offer.
Some of the design elements may change during the course of development. This is not unusual with any development process that seeks to implement the best and most functional solution.
Delivering what we promise is contingent upon reaching our funding objectives. The good thing about the development process is that it is flexible
column2: we will be able to scale down if we do not reach the desired goal, and of course scale up once we exceed our target.

column1: We believe that 6 to 7 months is a reasonable time frame to consider implementing our development goals. Adjusting the deliverables for example, could shift the release date to the left or right. Please understand we will do everything possible to honor the time frame but please understand that in delays could happen by seen and unforeseen circumstances.

HopMotion is the LeapMotion app for Android.

Our goal is to allow LeapMotion to function with Android as easily as it does with Mac and PC operating systems i.e. plug in and play. The app already has a prototype but I'm here to get your help in completing it.

I have been a fan of LeapMotion since they first introduced their prototype product. This is “Minority Report” in the flesh, in fact it’s even better, because you don’t need the gloves. Sure, there are detractors who are willing to go on and say the technology isn’t as promised or not good enough. But, that goes with any emerging technology and it will take years to perfect and consumers to become comfortable with it. Like, how Blackberry users switched to iOS and Android smartphones, despite the initial few years of reluctance, I believe motion sensing technology will replace current human interaction peripherals.

As with any new technology it is hard to find investors who are willing to take a risk with your product. All too often investors demand a say in the product, collateral, performance reports, and prioritize their vision. As with too many cooks in the kitchen, we end up with Cyanide instead of Crème Brûlée. This is the reason why I’m here on Kickstarter to get the funds necessary to finish this project.
HopMotion is not some distant project, or a glimmer in our eyes, it is real, it is here and it works.

We funded the first phase of development ourselves but we need more money to finish the product and move it to the Alpha stages of testing, which incidentally is one of our rewards. Now some of you might ask why don’t we simply wait till LeapMotion publishes the SDK and support for Android for free.

Well, SDK and native support takes time to deliver. Any driver on Android will have to be part of an Android update because it will require KERNEL level programming. This process is not only long and time consuming but, it is also depended on product testing by both LeapMotion and Google. It is not too farfetched to believe that support of LeapMotion devices on Android will not happen till Google’s next I/O conference in June 2014.

How does HopMotion get around this problem while two large companies can’t? The answer is simple we go another direction. Instead of using KERNEL level programming to build a driver for LeapMotion, we are using Virtual Network Computing (VNC) protocols to take over the Android device and port the existing SDK over to Android.
This means essentially, we let the controller take over the device.
I can see the brianiacs among you raising your eyebrows and hands, ready to lay down bear the disadvantages of using VNC protocols to connect with a peripheral device.

Relax! I know it’s not ideal, but initial testing shows that it works quite well with basic tasks such as browsing, opening apps, zooming, etc… Further, since the LeapMotion device is hard connected (Micro USB to Micro USB)to the Android device there is no question of buffering interval/time lag.

Besides, like I said earlier no new technology will come out of the box perfect, the only real question is do you want to play with LeapMotion on your Android in two weeks or do you want to wait months to a year?
That’s right folks, we plan on releasing the Alpha stage of the App within 2 weeks of completion of funding.
We are currently working on a video and it should be posted as an update soon. The video will show the prototype app doing its thing.
The goal of this Android app is to bring the world of LeapMotion to your Android device as early as tomorrow and I don’t mean figuratively.
1. Prototype/Experimental – Our current stage, where we prove that using VNC we can port a driver for Android.
2. Alpha Stage – LeapMotion functions essentially as a mouse pointer on your android screen
Besides the use of a new method of programming to introduce an experimental interface to your mobile device, bypassing software restrictions to provide unfettered access, not tomorrow but today!
100% of this money will go to pay for the development of the app.
Got questions? Ask me!! I want to hear from you!
Stretch Goal #1 - $30 000 – Better Beta Stage Development (multi-gesture controls)
Stretch Goal #2 – Infinity – Updates, larger feature integration, Google Play Store availability, development of Micro USB to Micro USB plug

column2:
> 

The World's Most Intuitive Smart Stylus

column1:
Flip works just like the pencil you grew up with. 

With Flip, you don't have to worry about charging your stylus or connecting to your tablet to unlock the features like flip to erase and palm rejection. Flip knows what you want it to do without using batteries or Bluetooth. It’s intuitive, easy to use, and gives you all the features and benefits of an active stylus without the complexity.
column2: >
column4:
>

Want to erase? Flip knows. Just flip it over, and your stylus is now an eraser.
column5:
>

Flip is also a very powerful tool that both professional and amateur digital artists will love. With Flip's interchangeable magnetic tips, the artist in you will be inspired to draw, sketch, and paint in all your favorite apps.
column6:
>

Want to rest your palm on the screen while using the stylus? Flip knows. Since we know the exact location of the stylus, we can perfectly reject any other object touching the screen.

Want to hover and then zoom in to generate more detail? Flip knows. Just enable the hover functionality, and we can even detect the stylus while it is still in the air.

Want to take notes in a class or meeting but don't want to re-enter your password and reconnect your Bluetooth stylus every time your iPad wakes up again? Flip knows. We sense when you stop writing, automatically dim your screen to help save power, and instantly turn your screen back on when you reach to make your next note.

Flip uses an incredibly simple and unique method of communication with any iOS device so you can write on your iPhone or iPad just like you would with a pen and paper.

In the past, advanced smart stylus features like flip to erase, palm rejection, and others have required complex electronics. To improve upon this, we've powered Flip with magnets.

Our rare earth magnets produce an exact invisible magnetic field that is always on, just like the earth's magnetic field.

Bluetooth-Free and Battery-Free

Flip's patented software algorithms, developed by our software partner Widevantage, use the hardware already in your device to sense and detect Flip's magnetic field and determine the precise location and orientation of the stylus, so our palm rejection, flip to erase and other features work perfectly without ever needing Bluetooth or batteries.
column7:
>

Flip comes with a free, easy to use note taking and drawing app called Flip Notes.

We also know many of our backers already have their favorite apps, so we've developed an app developer's kit that allows any note taking or drawing app to quickly integrate Flip's features into their software.

Apps we are currently working with include:
column8:
>

Apps we plan to work with include:
column9:
>

We are happy to keep adding to the list - just let us know your favorite app, and we will work with them!

A Clean Corner is a touch screen stylus designed to allow you to avoid direct contact with dirty surfaces like ATMs, Buttons, Checkouts, and Touch Screens!
A Clean Corner is the most convenient solution to avoiding dirty public touch screens with its self-cleaning copper corner.
See how easy it is to interact with all shared surfaces!
We took a prevention first approach with A Clean Corner.
People touch their faces without realizing they just interacted with a dirty surface.
With A Clean Corner, you can avoid direct contact with any touch screen or button!

Compact, Fast and Powerful— Prelude Portable Wireless Charger

At BEZALEL, we value the advancement of wireless charging technology, simplicity of design, and seamless user experience. That's why we created the Prelude wireless power bank - a portable charger that 'sticks' on your smartphone and conveniently charges your devices without any cords or cases required:
• Convenient — Simultaneously charge while talk, type, or play.
• True Wireless — Smartphone and battery pack charge cord-free.
• No Add-Ons — Secure nano-suction sticks without extra pieces.
• Compact — Other than full battery, you'll hardly know its there.
• Quick Charge — Fastest wireless charger with 15W fast-charging.
It's as easy as shaking it, sticking it, charging it, and using it.
The Prelude everyday carry power bank conveniently charges you up and keeps your devices at full power in 4 simple steps:
• Shake It —  One shake of the battery pack will turn it on and activate charging.
• Stick It  — Press its microscopic nano-suction cups to safely secure to any device.
• Charge It — Electromagnetic induction wirelessly charges at up to 15W of power.
• Use it — Compact shape design allows uninhibited phone use while you charge.
On top of consistently having full battery power, you'll hardly notice our Prelude is even there with its compact, sleek design.

Unlike other similar type devices that use magnets, tapes, or require add-on attachments to charge, our Prelude uses microscopic nano suction cups to safely secure its ultra-light, 5oz power bank to the backside of smartphones or other devices as it wirelessly charges them.

This nano-suction technology allow the Prelude easily stick or adhere to the glossiest of surfaces with easy removal that doesn't damage your device's shiny finish. For those with the latest iPhones (iPhone 8, 8 Plus, X, XS, XS Max and XR), we offer a case with a magnetic alignment feature that guides your Prelude to the optimal spot every time!
The Prelude is compact, powerful, and compatible with most newer model smartphones from popular manufacturers.
2018 List of Wireless Charging Smartphones:

Prelude is nearly complete. All chargers on this page and in the videos were built on our production line. We’re currently ramping up at our factory and are ready to meet the estimated delivery times.

Forecasting Risk 
We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan. We’ve learned a lot from the past year, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible.

Supply Chain Risk 
We’ve built a very capable team from the past year on all our products. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.

Terms and Conditions 
For International Backers, please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

Prelude is nearly complete. All chargers on this page and in the videos were built on our production line. We’re currently ramping up at our factory and are ready to meet the estimated delivery times.

Forecasting Risk We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan. We’ve learned a lot from the past year, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible.

Supply Chain Risk We’ve built a very capable team from the past year on all our products. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.
Terms and Conditions For International Backers, please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.",5.0,1,"3 Campaigns
Welcome to Pyxur box, the premier solution to integrate you, your phone and the beauty of your life.
• The premier cross-body, hands free, and ultimate mobility case

Pyxur box is the ideal solution for active people who use their mobile device far beyond the simple reaches of ""just a phone"".  Pyxur box allows you to integrate the multi-media functions of your phone into a stylish, easy to access fashion statement that allows you to express the uniqueness of your experiences.

We created the solution, patented it and are ready to change how the world uses their phone.  Invest in us now and be on the front end of what will soon become the standard solution in the mobile device accessory market.
• At Pyxur box, we are looking to generate $20,000 for marketing, production and distribution
• Get in on this modern movement now and be on the front end of what make your current phone case obsolete
• Once funded, Pyxur box will be positioned to finalize the marketing, production and essential steps in the supply chain needed to take our product on a global scale
Your contributions will make a major impact on a great need that prior to us has been widely overlooked.
• From 2013 to 2017 there was a increase of 5.4B pictures taken on mobile devices
• In 2017, smartphones accounted for 85% of all pictures taken with just 10.3% coming from traditional cameras
• Pyxur box effectively closes the gap between the increased demand for smartphones as cameras while also bringing stylistic solutions for fashion and function
Whether you engage in the campaign financially or not, please help us:
• Share this link with your circle of influence
• Be a catalyst of innovation and show your friends what is coming next in the world of smartphone accessories

And that's all there is to it.

With inCharge USB-C to Dual and inCharge USB-C to USB-C you can source power from any USB-C port, including MacBook Pro, powerbanks and even phone-to-phone!
column2: >

column1: Risks &
column2:
Challenges

While funding a crowdfunding project always comes with some level of risk, we have done everything in our power to reduce it as much as possible. Thanks to our 4 years experience in manufacturing inCharge cables, we have an efficient production line, with reliable manufacturers and a strong logistic structure.

inCharge Universal was engineered after a long phase of research and prototyping, supported by the feedbacks of over 300’000 inCharge users. During development, we extensively tested sample units to find any weaknesses, before reaching the final design.

We have also took in a lot from our previous campaigns, learning the main risk factors and how to manage them. We are now ready for mass production, and we will make sure to be transparent with each step of the process.

 

FAQs

 

What is inCharge?
inCharge is the original keyring cable, invented by us in 2014.

 

What is inCharge Universal?
inCharge Universal is the new line of inCharge, it comes in two versions, inCharge Dual and inCharge All in One.

 

What is the difference between inCharge Dual and inCharge All in One?
inCharge Dual is compatible with Lightning (Apple) and MicroUSB devices. inCharge All in One is compatible with Lightning (Apple), MicroUSB and USB Type-C devices.

 

What connector does my device have?
If it’s an Apple device, it will use Lightning. If it’s an Android or other OS, it will either use MicroUSB or Type-C. Most smartphones after 2017 use Type-C. If you are unsure, please check your phone’s instructions.

 

Is inCharge MFi?
Since the Universal connector is an evolution of the Lightning connector, it doesn't need MFi certification. We have worked with quality of components as our main focus, and we can guarantee that inCharge Universal won't have any compatibility problem, no matter the device or iOS. You can find a table of the tests we performed at this link.

 

Does inCharge Universal work for data tranfer?
Yes, both inCharge Dual and inCharge All in One work for data sync.

 

What happens if you don’t reach your goal?
You will receive a full refund of your contribution.

 

I'm a journalist, where can I find press materials?
You'll find everything you need in the press room: incharge.rocks/Press_Room.zip

 

Can I buy a larger quantity?
If you are interested in making a bulk order, please contact carlo@incharge.rocks and we will send you a quotation right away.

 

Can I invest and are you looking for agents and distributors?
We are always excited to speak with anyone that believes in our project. If you are interested in getting involved as an investor, agent, or distributor, email us at info@ferrarisgroup.ch and let’s start talking!

 

How long does shipping take?
Shipping depends on your country, usually it takes around 6-10 business days, but for some countries it can take up to 15 business days.

 

Is shipping tracked?
Yes, all shipping methods are tracked.

 

What shipping method will be used?
Most orders will be shipped with Deutsche Post or Swiss Post.

 

I moved. Can I change my address?
You can change your address only if your order status is ""Processing"". To change it, please visit your order's page.

 

My address is wrong but the order is already shipped. What can I do?
We are sorry but since your package has already been shipped you can't change your address at this time. If your address was wrong the package will be shipped back to us. Once we receive it we will ship it to you again to the correct address.

 

Is inCharge covered by a warranty?
Absolutely! Our warranty lasts for 2 years.

 

I have got my inCharge. Where can I leave my review?
Your feedback is important to us! Please leave your review here: incharge.rocks/reviews

 

I have got my inCharge and I want to order more. Where can I do so?
You can get inCharge on our website incharge.rocks/universal

 

Is it possible to request a refund?
If you have changed your mind, you can request a refund if your order status is ""Processing"". If your order is ""Ready for shipping"" or ""Shipped"", you will need to wait until you receive the package, then you can ship the package back to us. Once received, we will send you the refund.

 

Other questions?
If you didn't find your answer here, contact us at: info@incharge.rocks

What is a Modular Synthesizer Sequencer-

Modular synthesizer users need sequencers to produce complex series of notes or effects upon which to build interesting musical structures. Having a sequencer which is simple to use, inexpensive, and offers up to 16 steps in a compact format allows the user the ability to combine multiple units for creating complex sequences. This sequencer is flexible, allowing two independent 8 step or one 16 step sequence to be dialed in, programmable, with individual step functions as well as global settings to be made from a simple user interface, and economical, priced in the range of many other synth modules.
• Your contribution will help put this flexible device into production.
• Three versions will support the current major synthesizer formats.
• Features such as built in quantizers, programmable gate width outputs, two operating modes, and multiple voltage output ranges give it capabilities beyond basic sequencers.

You can help us get this module into production with a contribution and get a fabulous Grove Audio t-shirt as a token of our appreciation or if you contribute at the highest level, you will receive a production unit in your format of choice.
Here is What Your Contribution Will Do-

Contributions made to this campaign will be used exclusively to fund the production costs of this new module. When we create a new device, we encounter production costs beyond the cost of the components used to make each unit. A portion of the funds contributed will be used to offset these one-time charges.

Three major components are used in any module and have substantial tooling costs to get even one part made. These components are the panel, the printed circuit boards, and any specialized parts. In this module, there is a microprocessor which controls the unit and provides the functions of the operator interface. In addition to these tooling charges, sufficient quantities of parts to produce an initial run of modules will be purchased.
• The value of your contribution can be applied as a discount in the future toward the purchase of the new module.
• If you contribute to the successful campaign at the top two levels, you will receive free domestic or discounted international shipping on the perks that you will receive.
• At all contribution levels, you will receive the incredible limited-edition Grove Audio project t-shirt that will stun your friends at the next synthesizer gathering you attend.

This new compact sequencer won't cure any diseases but it will provide immediate relief from boring synthesizer patches. It will multiply your creativity by implementing exciting percussion rhythms and soaring arpeggios. It will remove the drudgery of counting notes in complex tempos.
• The project fulfills the need for a multifunctioned basic sequencer for use in your modular synthesizer.
• Supplements and expands your existing sequencer modules.
• Brings a compact sequencing option to all popular analog modular formats including Dotcom (MOOG), MOTM, and Eurorack.
• Two operating modes - Two independent 1X8 step sequences or one 1X16 step sequence.
• Each step can be set to enabled, skip, or stop.
• Each sequence length can be set for 2 to 8 or 1 to 16 steps depending on current mode.
• Each sequence provides a control voltage output and a gate output signal for each active step.
• Control voltage range is set by a front panel selector to 0-2V, 0-5V or 0-10V range.
• Gate output signal is a 0-5V active-high pulse.
• Each channel has a clock input and a reset input. The voltage level is 0-5V active-high for both types of input.
• The Gate pulse width is settable to be a fixed width or dependent on the width of the clock pulse.
• The unit width for Dotcom format is 4.25 inches (2MU), for MOTM format is 3.50 inches (2MT) or for Eurorack is 183 millimeters (36HP).
• Each channel has a switchable quantizer to divide the voltage ranges into 1/12th volt steps to allow accurate note values to be produced.
