There are already a number of great
security tags available on the market that employ the latest
Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy standards, newer ones are now in development
that don't even use traditional batteries for power input, this is
all good news for the consumer!
reinventing the wheel and designing a new shaped, different coloured
alternatively powered security tag is really not necessary at this
stage of the market emergence. Instead we want to focus on the
customer interface applications and the scope of services offered to
the end user.  Combined with a tried and tested security tag rather
than an untested tag that comes to market and then simply does not
perform as expected out of the lab, this for us and many potential
investors is just too high risk.  We want to go with what we know,
but make it a far better experience for the consumer.
The IntelliBlue tag enables you to
keep track of your valuable things and alerts you should you leave
them behind or they are moved out of range from your smartphone.
This could be your young children, keys, luggage, bags, laptop and or
laptop case and lots more.  Basically, anything you can attached the
IntelliBlue tag to can be monitored by the IntelliBlue app on your
Attached to a rucksack
Attached to your keys
Two-Way Alerting is an option that
can be set on some or all of your  tags you are monitoring from your
smartphone, so if a tag goes out of range, then not only does the
smartphone audibly and visually alert you, but the tag audibly alerts
too.  This enables you to put a tag in your jacket pocket or any
where else on yourself and be alerted should you walk away from your
smartphone... no more left behind phones after a business meeting or
You can decide at what range a tag
needs to move outside of before you are alerted, this can also be
done on a per tag basis if so desired.
Should you be alerted of an out of
range tag, then you can simply use the IntelliBlue app with the built
in tag finder to track down the wayward tag up to a maximum distance
of 50m (160 ft).  Using a radar like system the app will guide you
towards the proximity of the missing item.
If you still cant find the item
with the tag attached to it, then we can help with that too,  using
the IntelliBlue Global Community (IGC) which is made up of all
IntelliBlue apps installed and running on smartphones around the
world.  You simply mark the tag as Missing on your app, this status
is then sent to the IntelliBlue servers and broadcast immediately to
the IGC to be on the look out for your tag.  The minute any other
IntelliBlue app detects your tag nearby, the location is securely
transmitted back to your app in the form of a notification, so even
when an item is lost, there is still help available with finding it.
relay the tags your smartphone and the IntelliBlue app are monitoring
to a secure IntelliBlue cloud account, which you can login to from
any web browser or other mobile phone in the world and see in
real-time what tag are currently being tracked by your smartphone.
You can also choose to share this real-time tracking information with
others be sending them personal invites.  This feature could be
really useful for parents and guardians wanting to keep tabs on young
children perhaps with an older sibling or other family member or
The IntelliBlue app is designed to run on any Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy
capable smartphone, right now this is Apple iPhone devices from the 4S
onwards that are running IOS 7 and also Android smartphones running Android
version 4.3 or later. You should check with your manufacturer for guaranteed
computability, or contact us to check for you.
your smartphone, you will be able to add tags to your monitor list,
activate and deactivate each one as and when required, set the

column2: one-way or two-way and set the range for the alerting

column1: to start, 10M, 20M etc.  Give each tag you add an easy to remember
name, laptop bag, keys, bicycle and so on.
when your phone is turned on and will automatically form part of the
IntelliBlue Global Community (IGC) mentioned earlier to help locate
missing tags for other IntelliBlue community members and because of
the use of Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy this will have an almost
insignificant impact on your smartphone battery life.
The tags we are planning to
initially use are 40mm x 40mm x 13.5mm and weight just 30g, although
not the smallest tags available on the market today, they are very
good at what they do, unlike some of the thinner smaller tags that
don't seem to quite perform as they should.
The tag uses a small coin battery
for power that is simple to replace when required, which for average
use should be around once every 12-18 months.
We are working very closely with
the hardware manufacturer at this time and are looking to enhance the
second revision of the tag to make it lighter and perhaps a little
smaller, also to add extra functionality and improved performance
like waterproofing, longer life or self recharging battery and
rubberised housing for improved protection against damage.
We are so confident about our
product and service that we will happily replace any of your
IntelliBlue tags should they stop working for any reason other than
accidental or intentional damage.  Just so long as you have been an
active member of the IntelliBlue Global Community (IGC) for the the
last 30 days by having the IntelliBlue app running on your
smartphone, then we will replace your tag non-working tag completely
We have a number of staged funding
goals to reach, each stage will enable us to accelerate the project and
continue to increase the performance and features of the products and
We are only a small group of 7 people right now, but we are always on the look out for
new talent that can bring that something special to the project.  So if you can commit
some of your time now to help us make the IntelliBlue products and services even better,
then once we are fully funded and operational, we will consider a more permanent and paid
Just drop us an email on hr@intelliblue.co.uk

column1: It was 4am. She had gone out with some friends and had not come home.
There had recently been a sexual assault on campus. I lay in bed, worried.
I called for the millionth time. Straight to voicemail. Her phone is dead.
Fast forward to the next day, she is fine. She fell asleep at her sisters.
She apologizes for worrying me and brings me cookies. All is well.
But I thought to myself there must be a better way.
So I bought a power bank. It sucked. It was huge and inconvenient.
So I designed a small, thin one that could fit in a purse or a wallet comfortably.
Engineers laughed at me. Said it couldn't be done.
Supplier after supplier said it was not possible, batteries are not that thin.
Year after year I asked and was rejected.
Until now. Meet Clutch - The World's Thinnest Portable Charger.
We are in production and are accepting Pre-orders.
Stay connected with those you love, get Clutch.
Clutch is currently in production and only a few weeks away from shipment. We are offering        Pre-Sale discounts up to 37% off to thank our early contributors.
In addition to your clutch charger, patrons will receive hand signed thank you letters from our founder. As well as have their names published in our newsletter.
Never worry about your phone dying again.
Stay connected with your loved ones.
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.
Get the word out! Make some noise about clutch!

>Tabble: The Ultimate Hands-Free Tablet Experience

The Tabble is the personal tablet holder that will help you use your tablet more often, and more comfortably. When you're wearing it, it's sturdy and comfortable. When you're not, it folds up into a small compact unit.

column1: NEW FEATURE FOR INDIEGOGO BACKERS - The Tabble is also a simple desktop stand!
Whatever you use your tablet for, and wherever you are, having two hands free is better than one. You will enjoy the freedom of the Tabble experience.
The Tabble is versatile - an essential part of your briefcase, handbag, backpack or desk.
• The Tabble is a simple, accessible tablet stand for a work desk or table top.
• We were going to save this feature for the second version of the product but thought we would reward our earliest Indiegogo backers with this amazing feature!
• Apple iPad. Samsung Galaxy Tab. Amazon Kindle. And more!
• Fits all screen sizes from 6"" to 13"" displays
• The Tabble arms close around and secure the tablet from the sides
• The Tabble is designed to fold up compactly to fit in your bag.
• The Tabble has easily adjustable arms to help you find the perfect position, in every situation.
• The Tabble doesn't get in the way of your audio - there are holes positioned to support headphone jacks whichever way your tablet is positioned.
• A bonus for our Indiegogo backers - A special Waist Strap for added stability on the move.
• To get the Waist Strap just add $5 onto your pledge, or get one FREE with your Tabble if you share our page on social media!

Most of the phone stands on the market are plain and dull
column2: their designs remain unchanged for decades. Why not get an astonishing alternative? Zonto is the world’s most chic spinnable phone stand that can turn every phone into a mind-blowing fidget spinner, not to mention it creates psychedelic arts on the screen while your phone is spinning. Now, be ready to dive into a colorful world!
column5:
Elegant Design

The toughness and bearing performance of zinc alloys achieve the goal of pulling the spinner and phone together offering you the firmness and elegant simultaneously.

  • Make Your Phone Cooler Than Ever

The real deal with Zonto is reflected in the spin of the phone. By employing premium NSK bearing that has significantly outperformed their counterparts, it delivers a perfectly smooth spin time for 3 minutes with little noise and small vibration. You will definitely be the centre of the spotlight with Zonto Ring Spinner in your hands.

  • Flexible Phone Stand

Zonto is not only distinctive in design, it’s perfect for day-to-day practical use. It serves as a kickstand to hold your phone up at optimal viewing angles, so you can conveniently enjoy hands-free shows.

  • Anti-drop Grip For Smartphone

Except for an adjustable phone stand, Zonto can prevent you from dropping your phone and facilitate those trying to navigate or type with one-hand. The ergonomic curve design and generous size of the ring make it easier to grip your phone.

Whether you like to relax, meditate or stay focused, Zonto offers the most entertaining way to increase productivity and efficiency with inspiration.

Now it’s the time to light up the phone screen and let your imagination run wild. Watch out though -- don’t get too addicted to it.

Zonto is delightfully easy to use. Simply peel off the sticker, and apply it to the right spot of your phone, then you’re good to go.

column1: Ring Spinner is founded by a group of passionate engineers and designers with extensive working experience in designing, marketing, tool-making, and manufacturing process. We are dedicated to creating products that will bring endless fun and convenience to our users through an unparalleled commitment to R&
column2:
D. Combined with mobile tech and fashion, Ring Spinner aims to bring you the best and coolest gyroscope phone stand ring.

The process of developing products is arduous, time-consuming and costly. Over the past few months, we’ve spent countless hours in designing, engineering, prototyping, testing and modifying. We are now capable of bringing you our upgraded version- Zonto, with an excellent combination of comfortable hand-held experience, exquisite workmanship, premium material in accordance with our core belief and quality that we endeavor to achieve. The Zonto shown in the videos and photos are real working prototypes. With your support, we are able to bring Zonto to a larger community, let them enjoy the fun, beauty, and convenience brought by innovation. We’ve also conducted our pilot production, and we are confident that we can handle any unexpected issue that could occur along the way by cooperating with our experienced manufacturing partners as well as our experienced team.
column3:
theater"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">

1.Does Zonto work with my phone?

Zonto is compatible with 97% of phones, tablets, and phone cases. It’s suitable for any flat and smooth surface.

2. What colors can I choose from?

Currently, Zonto is only available in black color.

3. How can I get a perfect spin?

Zonto comes with an intuitive packaging. Simply align your phone with the graphic on the packaging, stick to the right spot, then you’ll get perfect spin.

4. Where can I get access to Ring Spinner App?

Ring Spinner App is available on Google Play and App Store now. You can find it with “Ring Spinner”.

5. When will you ship the item?

We expect to begin the shipment in the middle of December if everything is running smoothly. We’ll keep you informed of the progress through updates or emails.

6. What’s the shipping cost?

It'll cost you US$2 for worldwide shipping.

7. How will my order be shipped?

For all US backers, we’ll likely be using USPS priority. For international backers, we will utilize different couriers to ship Zonto to you depending on where you are. Each order will have its independent tracking information. Due to the variations in courier regulations, our shipping methods are subjected to change.

8. How do I choose more than one reward?

To get more than one perk, please make a new contribution for each perk.

9. Do I have to pay VAT and duty?

All international duties, VAT or clearing fees are not included in the prices. We highly recommend you to consult your local tax authorities before pledging a perk.

10. What’s the warranty period on Zonto?

Ring Spinner Zonto is warranted to be free from defects of quality for a period of three months from the date of receiving your product. However, it does not cover gradual wear and tear throughout it's lifetime that is to be expected from normal use.  If you have any problems with this product, you can email us at hi@ringspinner.com

11. Remote area shipping cost.

Please kindly note that shipping cost does NOT include extra costs like remote area shipping fees. Customers may refer to http://raslist.dhl.com/jsp/first.jsp. to see if you're located in a remote area with your city’s postal code.

** Update 2: We've added new info on the unsung champions (pun intended, see below) who gave mankind's first image of the atom **

<h3>** Update 1: We've been live for 1 day and are already adding new supporter rewards! Including the 'Gold' prize of determining your own research project with the new instrument **<span style=""color: #333333

column4: >Optical microscopes magnify x1,000. Atom microscopes magnify x1,000,000. Building a biomedical atom microscope would revolutionize health research.

column3: >
>A Vision for the Future of Genomics Research
>""...ideas were raised about analogous 'technological leaps'... if they could be achieved, they would revolutionize biomedical research and clinical practice.""
>F.S. Collins et al., Nature, Vol. 422, No. 6934, 2003

column4: preview=false"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">supercomputer took 100 days to map 1 million atoms in the first simulation of a life form.

column1: Today, using an atom microscope, mapping 1 million atoms takes

column3: >Being a relatively new instrument, atom microscopes are presently built to map atoms of high-tech alloys and semi-conductors - they aren't designed for biological materials.  These microscopes are being used every day to discover new atomic structures and solve technology problems, but only for inorganic materials.
>In recognising the many incredible possibilites of this technology for fundamentally advancing medical research, I'm sure you'll agree that the atom microscope is not yet realising its potential!

column4: >The Solution

column3: >Microscope inventions are not sexy or celebrated, nor are they well-funded, but they underpin scientific revolutions!  Only 200 years ago medical doctors didn't wash their hands and the new theory of tiny 'germs' was ridiculed.  Its hard to believe in something you can’t see, huh?  A pioneer of this era is widely regarded as ‘the father of microbiology’
column4: he was Dutch microscope builder Antonie van Leeuwenhoek.

column1:
An example application:
Proteins are the nanometre sized machines that control virtually all of the molecular functions for life -

column3: > They serve as cleaners, builders, motors, messengers, and transporters in our cells. Each protein has a unique sequence of amino acids, which is encoded by a segment of DNA (called a gene).  A protein will fold into a unique and often complex three dimensional conformation which determines the function.

>We understand only a fraction of how proteins operate and how they control human health - this is because we simply struggle to see them!  An atom microscope would enable researchers to directly image, in full 3D, the atomic structure of proteins for the first time.

column1: Why? Across the globe science funding is facing a crisis:

""Science in America: Crisis Looming, Physicists Warn"" - Huffington Post
""NIH Research Funding Faces ‘Unprecedented Threat’"" - American Association for Cancer Research
""Scientists stage mock funeral outside parliament in funding protest"" - The Guardian
""Funding freeze halts research"" - Sydney Morning Herald

column3: >
>You can be part of this exciting research and make it happen!  We are university academics running a national research facility for advanced microscopy &
column4: microanalysis - we are passionate about excellence in microscopy and science communication.  Crowd funding is awesome for supporting projects that people think matter.  These science / technology projects are inspirational:

column1:
$1.3 million raised to build a museum for science pioneer Nicola Tesla
http://indiegogo.com/teslamuseum
$10.2 million raised to build an e-paper watch
http://kickstarter.com/projects/597507018/pebbl...
We have set stretch goals: from 50k to initiate work, up to 850k to commence the full project.  Pledging just $1 will help build momentum.  Tell your friends!

column10: >o support this exciting project now, please see our pledge rewards and click 'Contribute'! Thankyou!

column3: >""It is interesting to speculate about potential revolutionary technical developments that might enhance research and clinical applications in a fashion that would rewrite entire approaches to biomedicine.""
>F.S. Collins et al,Nature, Vol. 422, No. 6934, 2003
>Q: How do atom microscopes lead to discoveries?
>A: Let us show you through interpretive dance!

column4: >""A Super-Alloy is Born""

column1: Winner of Science magazines 'Dance Your Ph.D.' competition!  It will be premiered at TEDx Brussels.

column3: >1955: Man's first image of the atom

column5: >Did you know: the pioneers of man’s first image of the atom didn’t get a Nobel prize?

column3: >

>The earliest version of today’s atom microscope (pictured above) gave man’s first image of the atom.  The year was 1955 and the atom was widely regarded as being too small to ever image.  At Penn State University, Ph.D. student Kanwar Bahadur (left) and supervisor Prof. Erwin Muller (right) had just completed their newly designed field-ion microscope.  The resulting magnification was x1,000,000!  This is literally a thousand times better than an optical microscope.

column6: >Unsure whether to contribute?  Do it for Muller!  Wikipedia doesn't even have a picture on his profile!

column1: Still unsure!?  Do it for Kanwar!  This Indian PhD student discovered the final step needed to achieve atomic resolution AND has Freddie Murcury's good looks.
He was THE FIRST MAN to see the atom and he doesn't even have a wikipedia page.

column6: >Perhaps one day these pioneers will be recognised and celebrated for their achievements.

column3: >Common names for modern atom microscopes are: atom probe microscopy, atom probe tomography, atom probe field-ion microscopy and 3D atom probe.  How do atom microscopes work and what are some example publications?  Please see the following

column1:
The future of atom probe tomography
Miller, M.K., Kelly, T.F., Rajan, K., Ringer, S.P.
Materials Today, Vol. 15, Iss. 4, pp. 158–165, 2012

Nanoscale chemical tomography of buried organic–inorganic interfaces in the chiton tooth 
L. M. Gordon and D. Joester.
Nature 469 (7329), pp. 194-197, 2011

Nanostructural hierarchy increases the strength of aluminium alloys
Liddicoat, P.V., Liao, X.Z., Zhao, Y., Zhu, Y.T., Murashkin, M. Y., Lavernia, E. J., Valiev, R. Z., Ringer, S.P.
Nature Communications, Vol 1, Issue 6, pp. 63-69, 2010

Direct measurement of dopant distribution in an individual vapour-liquid-solid nanowire
Perea, DE
column6:
Lauhon, LJ.
Nature Nanotechnology, Vol 4 , Iss 5, pp. 315 - 319, 2009

column3: >The project will be led by Prof. Simon Ringer, A/Prof. Filip Braet, and Dr. Peter Liddicoat.  Combining skills and expertise (see profiles for journal &
column4: book publications) in atom microscopy and biomedical research, the teams experience also includes: leadership in running a national research facility, diverse international collaborations, and science communication with the wider community.

column3: ><span style="""">The project team collaborates widely with respected international experts and pioneers in microscopy and biomedical science
>Dr. Thomas Kelly, Division Vice President for Atom Probe Technology and Operations, Cameca Instruments
>Prof. Eddie Wisse, Department of Pathology, Maastricht University Medical Centre, The Netherlands
>Dr. Michael Moody, Department of Materials, University of Oxford
>Prof. Tomokazu Matsuura, Department of Laboratory Medicine, Jikei University School of Medicine, Japan
>Dr. Dave Larson, Director of Atom Probe Technology, Cameca Instruments
>Prof. Dar-Bin Shieh, Institute of Oral Medicine and Department of Stomatology, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan
>A/Prof. Batiste Gault, Department of Materials Science and Engineering, McMaster University

>Three key features will be combined to build the first biology focussed atom microscope: specimen cryo-transfer, laser assisted imaging, and bio-informatics data processing.  The technologies for each feature have been successfully employed in different forms in a variety of instruments.  There are, of course, multiple approaches available to integrating the technologies that would be explored and optimised through the project.
>

>Atom microscopes have already demonstrated an existing capacity, albeit limited, for biological analysis.  In 2011, Gordon et al. published in Nature a study upon the nanoscale chemical tomography of buried organic–inorganic interfaces in the chiton tooth. This is an example of a ‘hard’ biological material study, the critical next step is to configure the atom microscope so that it can study nanoscale ‘soft’ materials – proteins, viruses, antibodies etc.

>A 21st century microscope is not a stand-alone instrument, rather, it requires orchestration of advanced imaging technologies, data storage facilities, and specialised data processing engines.  As part of the NeCTAR (National eResearch Collaboration Tool and Resources) we are currently building an atom microscope workbench.  The workbench will be accessible from anywhere as a research cloud.  The workbench will contain characterisation tools optimised for performance, publication quality figures, and the user-experience – including a developer platform to add new tools. The virtual lab will be hosted on existing high-performance computing infrastructure and available internationally.
>

Optical microscopes magnify x1,000. Atom microscopes magnify x1,000,000. Building a biomedical atom microscope would revolutionize health research.
A Vision for the Future of Genomics Research
...ideas were raised about analogous 'technological leaps'... if they could be achieved, they would revolutionize biomedical research and clinical practice.""
F.S. Collins et al., Nature, Vol. 422, No. 6934, 2003
In 2006, a supercomputer took 100 days to map 1 million atoms in the first simulation of a life form.
Today, using an atom microscope, mapping 1 million atoms takes 5 minutes.

Being a relatively new instrument, atom microscopes are presently built to map atoms of high-tech alloys and semi-conductors - they aren't designed for biological materials.  These microscopes are being used every day to discover new atomic structures and solve technology problems, but only for inorganic materials.
In recognising the many incredible possibilites of this technology for fundamentally advancing medical research, I'm sure you'll agree that the atom microscope is not yet realising its potential!

Microscope inventions are not sexy or celebrated, nor are they well-funded, but they underpin scientific revolutions!  Only 200 years ago medical doctors didn't wash their hands and the new theory of tiny 'germs' was ridiculed.  Its hard to believe in something you can’t see, huh?  A pioneer of this era is widely regarded as ‘the father of microbiology’
column2: he was Dutch microscope builder Antonie van Leeuwenhoek.

column1: An example application:Proteins are the nanometre sized machines that control virtually all of the molecular functions for life -

They serve as cleaners, builders, motors, messengers, and transporters in our cells. Each protein has a unique sequence of amino acids, which is encoded by a segment of DNA (called a gene).  A protein will fold into a unique and often complex three dimensional conformation which determines the function.

We understand only a fraction of how proteins operate and how they control human health - this is because we simply struggle to see them!  An atom microscope would enable researchers to directly image, in full 3D, the atomic structure of proteins for the first time.
Why? Across the globe science funding is facing a crisis:

Science in America: Crisis Looming, Physicists Warn"" - Huffington Post""NIH Research Funding Faces ‘Unprecedented Threat’"" - American Association for Cancer Research""Scientists stage mock funeral outside parliament in funding protest"" - The Guardian""Funding freeze halts research"" - Sydney Morning Herald

You can be part of this exciting research and make it happen!  We are university academics running a national research facility for advanced microscopy & microanalysis - we are passionate about excellence in microscopy and science communication.  Crowd funding is awesome for supporting projects that people think matter.  These science / technology projects are inspirational:
$1.3 million raised to build a museum for science pioneer Nicola Teslahttp://indiegogo.com/teslamuseum $10.2 million raised to build an e-paper watchhttp://kickstarter.com/projects/597507018/pebbl...
We have set stretch goals: from 50k to initiate work, up to 850k to commence the full project.  Pledging just $1 will help build momentum.  Tell your friends!
There's more info below, but to support this exciting project now, please see our pledge rewards and click 'Contribute'! Thankyou!

It is interesting to speculate about potential revolutionary technical developments that might enhance research and clinical applications in a fashion that would rewrite entire approaches to biomedicine.""
F.S. Collins et al,Nature, Vol. 422, No. 6934, 2003
Q: How do atom microscopes lead to discoveries?
A: Let us show you through interpretive dance!
Winner of Science magazines 'Dance Your Ph.D.' competition!  It will be premiered at TEDx Brussels.
1955: Man's first image of the atom
Did you know: the pioneers of man’s first image of the atom didn’t get a Nobel prize?

The earliest version of today’s atom microscope (pictured above) gave man’s first image of the atom.  The year was 1955 and the atom was widely regarded as being too small to ever image.  At Penn State University, Ph.D. student Kanwar Bahadur (left) and supervisor Prof. Erwin Muller (right) had just completed their newly designed field-ion microscope.  The resulting magnification was x1,000,000!  This is literally a thousand times better than an optical microscope.
Unsure whether to contribute?  Do it for Muller!  Wikipedia doesn't even have a picture on his profile!
Still unsure!?  Do it for Kanwar!  This Indian PhD student discovered the final step needed to achieve atomic resolution AND has Freddie Murcury's good looks.
He was THE FIRST MAN to see the atom and he doesn't even have a wikipedia page.
Perhaps one day these pioneers will be recognised and celebrated for their achievements.

Common names for modern atom microscopes are: atom probe microscopy, atom probe tomography, atom probe field-ion microscopy and 3D atom probe.  How do atom microscopes work and what are some example publications?  Please see the following:
The future of atom probe tomographyMiller, M.K., Kelly, T.F., Rajan, K., Ringer, S.P.Materials Today, Vol. 15, Iss. 4, pp. 158–165, 2012
Nanoscale chemical tomography of buried organic–inorganic interfaces in the chiton tooth L. M. Gordon and D. Joester. Nature 469 (7329), pp. 194-197, 2011

Nanostructural hierarchy increases the strength of aluminium alloys Liddicoat, P.V., Liao, X.Z., Zhao, Y., Zhu, Y.T., Murashkin, M. Y., Lavernia, E. J., Valiev, R. Z., Ringer, S.P. Nature Communications, Vol 1, Issue 6, pp. 63-69, 2010
Direct measurement of dopant distribution in an individual vapour-liquid-solid nanowirePerea, DE
column6: Lauhon, LJ. Nature Nanotechnology, Vol 4 , Iss 5, pp. 315 - 319, 2009

column1: The project will be led by Prof. Simon Ringer, A/Prof. Filip Braet, and Dr. Peter Liddicoat.  Combining skills and expertise (see profiles for journal & book publications) in atom microscopy and biomedical research, the teams experience also includes: leadership in running a national research facility, diverse international collaborations, and science communication with the wider community.
The project team collaborates widely with respected international experts and pioneers in microscopy and biomedical science
Dr. Thomas Kelly, Division Vice President for Atom Probe Technology and Operations, Cameca Instruments
Prof. Eddie Wisse, Department of Pathology, Maastricht University Medical Centre, The Netherlands
Dr. Michael Moody, Department of Materials, University of Oxford
Prof. Tomokazu Matsuura, Department of Laboratory Medicine, Jikei University School of Medicine, Japan
Dr. Dave Larson, Director of Atom Probe Technology, Cameca Instruments
Prof. Dar-Bin Shieh, Institute of Oral Medicine and Department of Stomatology, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan
A/Prof. Batiste Gault, Department of Materials Science and Engineering, McMaster University

Three key features will be combined to build the first biology focussed atom microscope: specimen cryo-transfer, laser assisted imaging, and bio-informatics data processing.  The technologies for each feature have been successfully employed in different forms in a variety of instruments.  There are, of course, multiple approaches available to integrating the technologies that would be explored and optimised through the project.

Atom microscopes have already demonstrated an existing capacity, albeit limited, for biological analysis.  In 2011, Gordon et al. published in Nature a study upon the nanoscale chemical tomography of buried organic–inorganic interfaces in the chiton tooth. This is an example of a ‘hard’ biological material study, the critical next step is to configure the atom microscope so that it can study nanoscale ‘soft’ materials – proteins, viruses, antibodies etc.

A 21st century microscope is not a stand-alone instrument, rather, it requires orchestration of advanced imaging technologies, data storage facilities, and specialised data processing engines.  As part of the NeCTAR (National eResearch Collaboration Tool and Resources) we are currently building an atom microscope workbench.  The workbench will be accessible from anywhere as a research cloud.  The workbench will contain characterisation tools optimised for performance, publication quality figures, and the user-experience – including a developer platform to add new tools. The virtual lab will be hosted on existing high-performance computing infrastructure and available internationally.",9.0,0,"1 Campaign

The Ockel Sirius A is small enough to fit in the palm of your hand, but is just as powerful as a desktop PC. This unique little machine combines the connectivity and functionality you want and need when you are using a personal computer with the portability you expect from today’s technology.
column5:
'/>

 

 

 

Everything we do at Ockel, every choice we make, is inspired by what we think is the definition of radical innovation. We create products that combine unique designs with new functionalities.

We see the mobile and desktop world growing towards each other and with that in mind we developed the Ockel Sirius A.

We were able to come up with a design that includes an incredible amount of connection options in one single device, without handing in on portability.
column6:
> 

The Ockel Sirius A runs all Windows programs. The majority of Android, iOS and Windows Mobile devices run on ARM compatible architectures, but this architecture cannot run the same software as laptops or desktop PC’s. And in case you have a mobile device that does run on the x86 compatible architecture, you often have to hand in on the options to connect peripherals. The Ockel Sirius A however doesn’t compromise on the architecture used to make your software run and it doesn’t sacrifice connectivity. The Sirius A and the Sirius A Pro are equipped with a full Windows 10 version (64-bit) and give you the real desktop experience with the benefits of a mobile device.

 

The Sirius A is equipped with the latest WiFi AC and Bluetooth technology for fast and wireless connection, but also includes all the ports you want to have when you are working on a desktop PC:


The Ockel Sirius A and the Ockel Sirius A Pro are equipped with powerful hardware components, ready for optimal performance. The Intel Atom x7-Z8750 processor, 4GB or 8GB of LPDDR3-1600 RAM and 64GB or 128GB of eMMC flash storage enable you to work, play games, watch movies and run almost any program or executable you want.

The latest Intel 3165 Bluetooth and WiFi AC chip give you the fast and wireless connection you expect from today’s technology.

column1:
Every Ockel Sirius A and Ockel Sirius A Pro includes a fingerprint scanner!
Results have shown that more than 55% of our backers would like to have a fingerprint scanner integrated in the Ockel Sirius A. Actually, it was the top requested feature after 8GB RAM, 128GB Flash eMMC Storage and Windows 10 Pro. Features which we already included in our Ockel Sirius A Pro version. Something that makes sense, since most of you will probably carry around their Ockel device and with all your personal data stored on it security is an extremely important issue.

The fingerprint add-on is guaranteed for everyone who already joined us and for any future backer. Are there any additional cost for you? No!

The small form factor of the Ockel Sirius A makes it hard to believe you are carrying your complete desktop PC with you.

 

We designed the Sirius A in such a way that ventilation fans are not required. This unique feature combined with the flash storage means you can enjoy working in silence and benefit from ultra-low power consumption.

The powerful hardware components of the Sirius A obviously generate heat. A regular passive cooling isn’t able to cool this heat. That's why we decided to create an eye-catching heat sink with the pattern of the Canis Major star constellation. This is the star constellation where the Sirius A star (yes, that's right, the Sirius A is a star!) can be found. This heat sink cools all the heat generated by the Ockel Sirius A without any fan.
column5:
'/>

Every Ockel Sirius A comes with 64GB of internal (eMMC) flash storage. The Sirius A Pro comes with 128GB of internal (eMMC) flash storage. Do you require more storage space? Easily extend storage with a Micro SD-card, or connect your own external hard disk using the USB Type-C port or one of the two USB 3.0 ports.

The Sirius A has an easy to reach Micro SD-card slot which (theoretically) supports Micro SD-cards up to 2TB.
column7:
>128GB Flash Storage is the equivalent of 42500+ songs, 64000 images or 985 minutes of video!*
*(Average file size: 3mb for a song
column9:
130mb 1 minute of HD-video recording)

 

With the Sirius A you are able to access all your files, applications and make use of the full Windows 10 desktop experience even when you are away from your office or home, straight out of your pocket.

The built-in battery and the full HD touchscreen ensure access to all of your files, wherever you are. The WiFi AC chip enables you to use apps and enter your files stored online.

The 3.500 mAh battery has enough capacity to power your Sirius A up to 4 hours (casual use) without being connected to a power outlet. 

 

We offer two versions of the Sirius A: 

1. The Ockel Sirius A. Every Sirius A comes with a fully activated license of Windows 10 Home (64-bit), a sleeve and a power adapter.

2. The Ockel Sirius A Pro. Every Sirius A Pro comes with a fully activated license of Windows 10 Pro (64-bit), a sleeve and a power adapter.

An important note for all Dutch backers: Please use 'Netherlands' as the country of destination in the Indiegogo order process. 

If you are a reseller, business owner or other Sirius A enthusiast and you would like to buy more than 10 units, please contact us at sales@ockelcomputers.com for the options. 

 

Do you want to use the Ockel Sirius A mainly for business or educational purposes and do you need Windows 10 Pro? Make sure to back our campaign with one of the Ockel Sirius A Pro perks. All perks available with the ‘Pro’ tag will come with a pre-installed version of Windows 10 Pro.

The Ockel Sirius A Pro has the same dimensions, processor and other features as the Ockel Sirius A. In addition to that we upgraded the 4GB RAM to 8GB, 64GB eMMC to 128GB eMMC flash storage and last but not least the Ockel Sirius A Pro is running on Windows 10 Pro.

Unlock enhanced management and security features with Windows 10 Pro

If you choose for an Ockel Sirius A Pro you automatically have access to all the enhanced management and security features and options Windows 10 Pro offers. BitLocker, Dynamic Provisioning, Device Encryption and Windows Information Protection are a few examples of features builtinto Windows 10 Pro.

Click here for the complete list of features of all Windows 10 versions.

 

We reached the $500,000 mark! The Avanca team will now create a special Ockel Sirius A ToughGlass, so you can protect the display of your Ockel Sirius A.
Avanca ToughGlass is made of top quality tempered Japanese glass, an ultra-thin (0.33mm) sheet of glass that you ‘glue’ to your device. The 9H (Mohs scale) scratch-free surface of the glass is extremely hard and easily resists keys or even a knife. In case you accidently drop your device, Avanca ToughGlass absorbs the impact of the shock, so your screen is less likely to break or burst.

We are offering you this amazing product (retail price approximately 25 USD) for free!

 

The shipment of all Ockel Sirius A &
column10:
Ockel Sirius A Pro models has begun! 

You can’t accomplish the best results on your own. That’s why our team is made up of  technology addicts, geeks, marketeers and design wizards. We're Ockel, it's great to meet you!

 

The Ockel team is supported by a large network of talented people. It's impossible to mention all of them, but we want to at least name a few.

Our special advisor Paul Pardon has more than 30 years of experience in the computer market. He founded Laser Computer, one of Europe's largest and most well known computer brands back in the 80's. He connects Ockel Computers to the right engineers, suppliers and manufacturers and provides no-nonsense business feedback.

The awesome Microsoft team offers us their support and knowledge when it comes to software development, licensing or any other question related to Windows 10.

We've partnered up with artist, instrument maker and prototype builder Ming Hou Chen to create the best mock-ups and prototypes possible.

With this diverse and experienced team and your support, we are confident we can bring this project to life!

Our special thanks go out to the entire crew of Evenblij Film for helping us creating the top-notch crowdfunding video and to Laut Rosenbaum for his creative  mind and ultracool sketch of our definition of innovation.

 

Ockel Computers is part of the same group of companies as Avanca, the first company founded by Tim and currently the fastest growing hardware company in the EMEA-region. 

Ockel Computers was raised with the same spirit as Avanca. In the past nine years we gained the experience and skills needed to launch Ockel and we have access to many of the essential resources needed to successfully bring this project to life: a warehouse, customer service and a network of top engineers and suppliers. At the same time, we have a great amount of freedom to innovate. 

Last year, the first products in the Ockel Sirius line – the Ockel Sirius B and the Ockel Sirius B Black Cherry – were introduced as crowdfunding campaigns and more than 460.000 dollars were raised to develop the two devices. The feedback and learnings from that project inspired us to create the Ockel Sirius A.

We need your support to cover the development and production costs of the Ockel Sirius A. But, more important perhaps, is that you will contribute to a company that has many more ideas about doing things differently. If you, just like Ockel, are passionate about true innovation, join us!

 

As with any hardware project, there are some risks and challenges.

We are currently in the prototyping phase of the development process. We have already manufactured a first prototype and we’re currently working on the second one. In the next months we will develop a fully working prototype and in partnership with Microsoft we will be working on the software features, some of them exclusively built for the Ockel Sirius A.

The Ockel team has a combined experience of 70 years in the manufacturing world, and together with our network we are confident that we can meet the timelines mentioned in our project. However, unexpected delays can occur due to manufacturing issues, component shortages, and other unforeseen challenges.

The Sirius A project is not our first crowdfunding journey. We have gained experience in the past with successful projects on Indiegogo and Kickstarter and learned from our experiences. Our commitment to all of you is that we will make every effort to deliver you an innovative product, and we will communicate with you regularly along our journey of getting the Sirius A delivered to you!

 

HARDWARE QUESTIONS

What does x86-64 mean?

The Sirius A runs on an Intel x86 platform in 64-bit mode.That means you can run a full desktop version of Windows and install any Windows programs.Unlike mobile phones with ARM processors, the Sirius A can run the same Windows applications as a traditional desktop.

What Windows license is included?

All Sirius A computers will ship with a fully activated license for Windows 10.The standard model includes Windows 10 Home while the pro model upgrades to Windows 10 Pro, and both have the 64-bit version installed.

Why would I want Windows 10 Pro?

While the Sirius A Pro includes other upgrades, one major difference is the change from Windows Home to Windows Pro.Only Windows Pro has certain business features enabled including joining a domain, running Bitlocker encryption, and the ability to defer updates. For more information on different Windows editions, see https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/WindowsForBusiness/Compare.

Can I install another operating system on the Sirius A?

The BIOS will be unlocked so theoretically any OS that runs on a x86-64 platform could be installed, including older version of Windows or Linux.However, alternative operating systems will need driver support, which may or may not exist, for all the hardware to fully function.Currently only Windows 10 will be supported via Ockel.

Can I reinstall Windows 10 if something goes wrong?

Yes, using an HDMI display and USB media you can do a Windows installation.A support page at the Ockel website and technical support team will be available once the Ockel Sirius A ships.

Can I attach Thunderbolt 3 accessories to the USB-C port?

While Thunderbolt 3 shares the same style of connector with USB-C it requires extra chips to enable it. The Sirius A currently does not include that and therefore only USB accessories will work.

What type of display is included?

The Full HD panel is still being sourced, however it will likely be an IPS LCD panel.

Can I use a stylus with the display?

A capacitive stylus should work with the touchscreen. However, the Ockel Sirius A does not include an active stylus digitizer for more precise location/pressure level detection.

What type of HDMI port is included?

The Sirius A includes Intel HD Graphics 405 integrated graphics.This chipset includes an HDMI 1.4 port.

Can I connect to a wireless display/projector?

The Sirius A includes an Intel Wi-Fi AC chipset that supports the Miracast standard.

Can I expand the RAM?

If you are interested in moving from 4GB to 8GB of RAM, please consider upgrading to the Ockel Sirius A Pro. Adding or changing memory separately is not an option.

Can I expand the storage?

Two options are available for expanded storage. Every Sirius A includes a microSDXC slot that supports a maximum of 2TB storage (currently only 400GB is available). The built-in storage is eMMC and cannot be upgraded post-purchase. If you would like to move from 64GB to 128GB of storage, please consider upgrading to the Ockel Sirius A Pro.

Can I replace the built-in battery?

While the battery can be serviced at a repair center, the Sirius A does not include a user serviceable battery. Replacements will we available at a reasonable cost.

How can I charge the Sirius A?

Two options are available- either AC or USB Type-C.Every Sirius A will ship with an included AC adapter that can be used to power the system and charge the battery. USB-C based chargers or battery packs can also be used.

Are any of the full-size USB ports powered for use with external drives like port powered Western Digital Passport for instance?

Yes, you will be able to attach portable harddrives that are powered over USB 2.0, 3.0 or Type-C. 

ORDERING QUESTIONS

How can I order more than one Sirius A?

You're loving the Sirius A as much as we do! Unfortunately, currently the only way to order more than one Sirius A is by placing separate orders. This automatically means you’ll receive multiple packages. For orders of 10 units or more, please reach out to our Product Manager Jesper Baumgarten (jesper@ockelcomputers.com).

Why is a different country showing when I am from the Netherlands?

You probably filled-in 'Nederland', 'Holland' or 'The Netherlands' as your shipping country in the ordering process. Due to a small error in the ordering systems of Indiegogo the synonyms for 'Netherlands' are not recognized. Please reach out to us at support@ockelcomputers.com to resolve this issue

How can an early bird back upgrade from the Sirius A to the Sirius A Pro?

When the pro model was announced, backers were emailed a special link to streamline the add-on process. If you did not receive the email or need a new copy, please contact support@ockelcomputers.com.

What Micro SD specifications are needed?

We advise to use a class 10 Micro SD card. However, the Ockel Sirius A is compatible with all Micro SD card versions up to 2TB.
column12:
'>Will there be any import duties or costs?

For EU backers, no import duties apply. For all other backers, the answer will vary based on your country. Even if there is no import tariff, the shipper may charge you a documentation fee which is typically small ($10 or less). Any standard internal taxes (VAT, state/county sales taxes, etc.) will apply to all backers based on your local laws.

What will be the expected retail price?

The expected retail price of the Sirius A will be $699 without shipping. During the Indiegogo campaign you will have to chance to order your Sirius A with a huge discount. Once our campaign is over the price will match the expected retail price. The expected retail price of the Sirius A Pro will be $799.

How are the shipping costs calculated?

Shipping costs vary on your shipping address. The Ockel Sirius A isn’t a cheap device. That’s why we offer a delivery service with track &
column13: trace, proof of delivery and insurance. Please note that any import duties that may apply to the Sirius A (only applies for backers outside of the EU) are not included in the shipping costs.
column14: >Do you offer refunds to backers?
column16: '>In case you would like to drop-out of the campaign before we ship the Ockel Sirius A or Ockel Sirius A Pro, your contribution might be eligible for a refund. Please note that the full sum of your contribution will not be refunded: there are 10% in Indiegogo and payment fees that will be deducted in these cases, as we have had to pay these already.
column18:
'>If you would like to request a refund, please reach out to us at: support@ockelcomputers.com. Make sure to include your  PayPal address and/or bank details in the refund request e-mail. 

PRESS QUESTIONS

I’m from the press, who do I have to contact?

You can reach out to our Marketing team (press@ockelcomputers.com) for all your press related questions or inquiries. We also have a press kit available. Please visit our Cision newsroom for more information.

In addition to that we upgraded the 4GB RAM to 8GB, 64GB eMMC to 128GB eMMC flash storage and last but not least the Ockel Sirius A Pro is running on Windows 10 Pro.Unlock enhanced management and security features with Windows 10 Pro If you choose for an Ockel Sirius A Pro you automatically have access to all the enhanced management and security features and options Windows 10 Pro offers. BitLocker, Dynamic Provisioning, Device Encryption and Windows Information Protection are a few examples of features builtinto Windows 10 Pro.Click here for the complete list of features of all Windows 10 versions. We reached the $500,000 mark! The Avanca team will now create a special Ockel Sirius A ToughGlass, so you can protect the display of your Ockel Sirius A.Avanca ToughGlass is made of top quality tempered Japanese glass, an ultra-thin (0.33mm) sheet of glass that you ‘glue’ to your device. The 9H (Mohs scale) scratch-free surface of the glass is extremely hard and easily resists keys or even a knife. In case you accidently drop your device, Avanca ToughGlass absorbs the impact of the shock, so your screen is less likely to break or burst.We are offering you this amazing product (retail price approximately 25 USD) for free! The shipment of all Ockel Sirius A & Ockel Sirius A Pro models has begun! You can’t accomplish the best results on your own. That’s why our team is made up of  technology addicts, geeks, marketeers and design wizards. We're Ockel, it's great to meet you! The Ockel team is supported by a large network of talented people. It's impossible to mention all of them, but we want to at least name a few.Our special advisor Paul Pardon has more than 30 years of experience in the computer market. He founded Laser Computer, one of Europe's largest and most well known computer brands back in the 80's. He connects Ockel Computers to the right engineers, suppliers and manufacturers and provides no-nonsense business feedback.The awesome Microsoft team offers us their support and knowledge when it comes to software development, licensing or any other question related to Windows 10.We've partnered up with artist, instrument maker and prototype builder Ming Hou Chen to create the best mock-ups and prototypes possible.With this diverse and experienced team and your support, we are confident we can bring this project to life!Our special thanks go out to the entire crew of Evenblij Film for helping us creating the top-notch crowdfunding video and to Laut Rosenbaum for his creative  mind and ultracool sketch of our definition of innovation. Ockel Computers is part of the same group of companies as Avanca, the first company founded by Tim and currently the fastest growing hardware company in the EMEA-region. Ockel Computers was raised with the same spirit as Avanca. In the past nine years we gained the experience and skills needed to launch Ockel and we have access to many of the essential resources needed to successfully bring this project to life: a warehouse, customer service and a network of top engineers and suppliers. At the same time, we have a great amount of freedom to innovate. Last year, the first products in the Ockel Sirius line – the Ockel Sirius B and the Ockel Sirius B Black Cherry – were introduced as crowdfunding campaigns and more than 460.000 dollars were raised to develop the two devices. The feedback and learnings from that project inspired us to create the Ockel Sirius A.We need your support to cover the development and production costs of the Ockel Sirius A. But, more important perhaps, is that you will contribute to a company that has many more ideas about doing things differently. If you, just like Ockel, are passionate about true innovation, join us! As with any hardware project, there are some risks and challenges.We are currently in the prototyping phase of the development process. We have already manufactured a first prototype and we’re currently working on the second one. In the next months we will develop a fully working prototype and in partnership with Microsoft we will be working on the software features, some of them exclusively built for the Ockel Sirius A.The Ockel team has a combined experience of 70 years in the manufacturing world, and together with our network we are confident that we can meet the timelines mentioned in our project. However, unexpected delays can occur due to manufacturing issues, component shortages, and other unforeseen challenges.The Sirius A project is not our first crowdfunding journey. We have gained experience in the past with successful projects on Indiegogo and Kickstarter and learned from our experiences. Our commitment to all of you is that we will make every effort to deliver you an innovative product, and we will communicate with you regularly along our journey of getting the Sirius A delivered to you! HARDWARE QUESTIONS What does x86-64 mean?The Sirius A runs on an Intel x86 platform in 64-bit mode.That means you can run a full desktop version of Windows and install any Windows programs.Unlike mobile phones with ARM processors, the Sirius A can run the same Windows applications as a traditional desktop.What Windows license is included?All Sirius A computers will ship with a fully activated license for Windows 10.The standard model includes Windows 10 Home while the pro model upgrades to Windows 10 Pro, and both have the 64-bit version installed.Why would I want Windows 10 Pro?While the Sirius A Pro includes other upgrades, one major difference is the change from Windows Home to Windows Pro.Only Windows Pro has certain business features enabled including joining a domain, running Bitlocker encryption, and the ability to defer updates. For more information on different Windows editions, see https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/WindowsForBusiness/Compare.Can I install another operating system on the Sirius A?The BIOS will be unlocked so theoretically any OS that runs on a x86-64 platform could be installed, including older version of Windows or Linux.However, alternative operating systems will need driver support, which may or may not exist, for all the hardware to fully function.Currently only Windows 10 will be supported via Ockel.Can I reinstall Windows 10 if something goes wrong?Yes, using an HDMI display and USB media you can do a Windows installation.A support page at the Ockel website and technical support team will be available once the Ockel Sirius A ships.Can I attach Thunderbolt 3 accessories to the USB-C port?While Thunderbolt 3 shares the same style of connector with USB-C it requires extra chips to enable it. The Sirius A currently does not include that and therefore only USB accessories will work.What type of display is included?The Full HD panel is still being sourced, however it will likely be an IPS LCD panel.Can I use a stylus with the display?A capacitive stylus should work with the touchscreen. However, the Ockel Sirius A does not include an active stylus digitizer for more precise location/pressure level detection.What type of HDMI port is included?The Sirius A includes Intel HD Graphics 405 integrated graphics.This chipset includes an HDMI 1.4 port.Can I connect to a wireless display/projector?The Sirius A includes an Intel Wi-Fi AC chipset that supports the Miracast standard.Can I expand the RAM?If you are interested in moving from 4GB to 8GB of RAM, please consider upgrading to the Ockel Sirius A Pro. Adding or changing memory separately is not an option.Can I expand the storage?Two options are available for expanded storage. Every Sirius A includes a microSDXC slot that supports a maximum of 2TB storage (currently only 400GB is available). The built-in storage is eMMC and cannot be upgraded post-purchase. If you would like to move from 64GB to 128GB of storage, please consider upgrading to the Ockel Sirius A Pro.Can I replace the built-in battery?While the battery can be serviced at a repair center, the Sirius A does not include a user serviceable battery. Replacements will we available at a reasonable cost.How can I charge the Sirius A?Two options are available- either AC or USB Type-C.Every Sirius A will ship with an included AC adapter that can be used to power the system and charge the battery. USB-C based chargers or battery packs can also be used.Are any of the full-size USB ports powered for use with external drives like port powered Western Digital Passport for instance?Yes, you will be able to attach portable harddrives that are powered over USB 2.0, 3.0 or Type-C. ORDERING QUESTIONSHow can I order more than one Sirius A?You're loving the Sirius A as much as we do! Unfortunately, currently the only way to order more than one Sirius A is by placing separate orders. This automatically means you’ll receive multiple packages. For orders of 10 units or more, please reach out to our Product Manager Jesper Baumgarten (jesper@ockelcomputers.com).Why is a different country showing when I am from the Netherlands?You probably filled-in 'Nederland', 'Holland' or 'The Netherlands' as your shipping country in the ordering process. Due to a small error in the ordering systems of Indiegogo the synonyms for 'Netherlands' are not recognized. Please reach out to us at support@ockelcomputers.com to resolve this issueHow can an early bird back upgrade from the Sirius A to the Sirius A Pro?When the pro model was announced, backers were emailed a special link to streamline the add-on process. If you did not receive the email or need a new copy, please contact support@ockelcomputers.com.What Micro SD specifications are needed? We advise to use a class 10 Micro SD card. However, the Ockel Sirius A is compatible with all Micro SD card versions up to 2TB. Will there be any import duties or costs?For EU backers, no import duties apply. For all other backers, the answer will vary based on your country. Even if there is no import tariff, the shipper may charge you a documentation fee which is typically small ($10 or less). Any standard internal taxes (VAT, state/county sales taxes, etc.) will apply to all backers based on your local laws.What will be the expected retail price?The expected retail price of the Sirius A will be $699 without shipping. During the Indiegogo campaign you will have to chance to order your Sirius A with a huge discount. Once our campaign is over the price will match the expected retail price. The expected retail price of the Sirius A Pro will be $799.How are the shipping costs calculated?Shipping costs vary on your shipping address. The Ockel Sirius A isn’t a cheap device. That’s why we offer a delivery service with track & trace, proof of delivery and insurance. Please note that any import duties that may apply to the Sirius A (only applies for backers outside of the EU) are not included in the shipping costs.Do you offer refunds to backers?In case you would like to drop-out of the campaign before we ship the Ockel Sirius A or Ockel Sirius A Pro, your contribution might be eligible for a refund. Please note that the full sum of your contribution will not be refunded: there are 10% in Indiegogo and payment fees that will be deducted in these cases, as we have had to pay these already. If you would like to request a refund, please reach out to us at: support@ockelcomputers.com. Make sure to include your  PayPal address and/or bank details in the refund request e-mail. PRESS QUESTIONSI’m from the press, who do I have to contact?You can reach out to our Marketing team (press@ockelcomputers.com) for all your press related questions or inquiries. We also have a press kit available. Please visit our Cision newsroom for more information.Tags: barebone, computer stick, desktop, game console, gaming console, gpd, kangaroo, media player, micro computer, mini laptop, mini notebook, mini computer, mobile computing, nuc, palm, palmtop, pda, rasberry, smart home hub, ultra mobile pc, umpc",48.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column2: catid=26"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">

>ION Glasses are the first-ever glasses — optical or sunglasses — which interact with your smartphone or tablet. They offer you several functions, such as notifications, remote control, alerts in case of loss and customization.

>All of this is possible because ION Glasses incorporate a Bluetooth 4.0 chip, a battery, a multi-color LED set, a buzzer and two buttons. All these components are inserted into one of the frame temples. But you will be the only one that knows it, because ION Glasses boast a fashionable and appealing design, whether used as optical glasses or as sunglasses.

>Even if your phone is on silent mode or in your bag or pocket, if someone calls you, or you receive a chat message, or an SMS, or an update in your social networks, or an e-mail, or an alarm for your date or meeting, ION will notify you privately through your pre-selected light code (you can set the color and the intermittence of the signal). You will be the only one that sees it, and only you will know what it means. You only have to download the ION app, available in iOS and Android, and choose when and how you want the LEDs to turn on and let you stay on top of your smartphone or tablet activity.

>The buttons on ION Glasses, can be used as a remote control to play your favorite music loaded in your smartphone or tablet.Turn the volume up and down or skip a song. Besides, ION Glasses give you the ability to control your smartphone remotely. You will also be able to pass slides in your presentations by simply pressing the button.

>If you want, when your ION Glasses move outside a pre-specified radius from your smartphone or tablet … both will beep. And thanks to the radar function, you will be able to see through the screen of any of your devices the exact location of your ION Glasses. You will also be able to make your smartphone beep by pushing the button on your ION Glasses or making your ION Glasses beep by pushing your smartphone. This will help you avoid losing your gear at the worst moment.

>You will be able to choose your personal notification code, so you’ll be the only one who knows what it means. But you will also be able to simply and easily customize the ION logo in your glasses with whatever light color you wish — or turn off the logo — depending how you feel each day.

>The battery life on your ION Glasses averages about a week, depending on usage. You can recharge them just as you would any other mobile device. Your smartphone or tablet will warn you when the ION Glasses battery is getting low.

column1: • A battery, rechargeable through a micro-USB connection. The charge lasts between 3 and 10 days, depending on usage.
• A multi-color LED set, only visible to the user (in terms of notifications), and which can also illuminate the logo.

column2: >All these micro components are inserted into the right temple of the frame. But it will be unnoticeable to you and everybody else since everything is perfectly and aesthetically hidden.

>By definition, the wearable technology has to deserve to be worn. This is why we have been extremely demanding in terms of design. ION Glasses have been designed in collaboration with one of the leading professional Glasses manufacturers. These are glass frames that you would have chosen to wear. You can use it with optical graduated lenses or as sunglasses, featuring advanced sun protection.
>The frame is made with a new revolutionary flexible and resistant material: TR90, also known as plastic titanium.

column3:
>    So, you have your ION Glasses. But, what if you don’t use prescription lenses? Or maybe you would prefer sunglasses?

No problem! You will find among the perks the possibility to choose this option, with premium UV protection green tinted organic crystals, or in blue mirror effect color.

column1: Thanks for your interest in ION Glasses.
Please select your contribution and your preferred Perk :
ION Glasses are not a mere project. They are a reality.
• The frame prototype is already fully developed.
• we start at this time the first 2.000 units production
• The device technology is finished and works perfectly.
Why do we need your support and more time to have it ready to deliver?
• We have to manufacture the device at a large scale
• We have to pay for the homologation authorizations (FCC,CE)
This is why we need your help. And, as reward, we want you to be the first one to wear the ION Glasses.
This is a summary of our financial needs in order to accomplish the project:
Can the glasses come with prescription lenses?

column2: >Yes, like any standard eyeglass frame. You can have your own prescription graduated lenses at any eye / Optician shop. The ION Glasses are certified to assemble prescription lenses.

column1: What devices do the ION Glasses work with?
With any smartphone or tablet equipped with Bluetooth 4.0
How long does the battery last and how do you charge it?

Depending on usage, the battery life ranges from 3 to 10 days. When your battery is low, you will receive an alert via your smartphone or tablet. You can recharge it like any other mobile device via a microUSB connection at the base of the right temple.
When multiple units are shipped, is only one shipping charge applied?
Yes, regardless of the number of units shipped, a single charge is made for postage.
Is it very hard to program the interaction between ION Glasses and mobile devices?

No, it is actually extremely simple. The application you need to download to set up the connection between your glasses and mobile devices is simple and intuitive, and you will be able to set things up virtually without instructions. There are also tutorials available on our website should you need them.
Dear visitors, thanks for your time and attention...
…and please, be one of the pioneers wearing ION Glasses

","IMPORTANT. We expect to obtain our 60.000 $ Goal. This would help to speed our project up. But, whether we achieve our Goal or not, we commit to finish the ION Glasses project, and to send you the reward you have chosen.

ION Glasses are the first-ever glasses — optical or sunglasses — which interact with your smartphone or tablet. They offer you several functions, such as notifications, remote control, alerts in case of loss and customization.

All of this is possible because ION Glasses incorporate a Bluetooth 4.0 chip, a battery, a multi-color LED set, a buzzer and two buttons. All these components are inserted into one of the frame temples. But you will be the only one that knows it, because ION Glasses boast a fashionable and appealing design, whether used as optical glasses or as sunglasses.

Even if your phone is on silent mode or in your bag or pocket, if someone calls you, or you receive a chat message, or an SMS, or an update in your social networks, or an e-mail, or an alarm for your date or meeting, ION will notify you privately through your pre-selected light code (you can set the color and the intermittence of the signal). You will be the only one that sees it, and only you will know what it means. You only have to download the ION app, available in iOS and Android, and choose when and how you want the LEDs to turn on and let you stay on top of your smartphone or tablet activity.

The buttons on  ION Glasses, can be used as a remote control to play your favorite music loaded in your smartphone or tablet.Turn the volume up and down or skip a song. Besides, ION Glasses give you the ability to control your smartphone remotely. You will also be able to pass slides in your presentations by simply pressing the button.

If you want, when your ION Glasses move outside a pre-specified radius from your smartphone or tablet … both will beep. And thanks to the radar function, you will be able to see through the screen of any of your devices the exact location of your ION Glasses.  You will also be able to make your smartphone beep by pushing the button on your ION Glasses or making your ION Glasses beep by pushing your smartphone.  This will help you avoid losing your gear at the worst moment.

You will be able to choose your personal notification code, so you’ll be the only one who knows what it means. But you will also be able to simply and easily customize the ION logo in your glasses with whatever light color you wish — or turn off the logo — depending how you feel each day.

The battery life on your ION Glasses averages about a week, depending on usage. You can recharge them just as you would any other mobile device. Your smartphone or tablet will warn you when the ION Glasses battery is getting low.
A battery, rechargeable through a micro-USB connection. The charge lasts between 3 and 10 days, depending on usage.
A multi-color LED set, only visible to the user (in terms of notifications), and which can also illuminate the logo.
All these micro components are inserted into the right temple of the frame. But it will be unnoticeable to you and everybody else  since everything is perfectly and aesthetically hidden.

By definition, the wearable technology has to deserve to be worn. This is why we have been extremely demanding in terms of design. ION Glasses have been designed in collaboration with one of the leading professional Glasses manufacturers. These are glass frames that you would have chosen to wear. You can use it with optical graduated lenses or as sunglasses, featuring advanced sun protection.
The frame is made with a new revolutionary flexible and resistant material: TR90, also known as plastic titanium.

So, you have your ION Glasses. But, what if you don’t use prescription lenses? Or maybe you would prefer sunglasses?No problem! You will find among the perks the possibility to choose this option, with premium UV protection green tinted organic crystals, or in blue mirror effect color.
Thanks for your interest in ION Glasses.
Please select your contribution and your preferred Perk :
ION Glasses are not a mere project. They are a reality.
The frame prototype is already fully developed.
we start at this time the first 2.000 units production
The device technology is finished and works perfectly.
Why do we need your support and more time to have it ready to deliver?.
We have to manufacture the device at a large scale
We have to pay for the homologation authorizations (FCC,CE)
This is why we need your help. And, as reward, we want you to be the first one to wear the ION Glasses.
This is a summary of our financial needs in order to accomplish the project:
Can the glasses come with prescription lenses?
Yes, like any standard eyeglass frame. You can have your own prescription graduated lenses at any eye / Optician shop. The ION Glasses are certified to assemble prescription lenses.
What devices do the ION Glasses work with?
With any smartphone or tablet equipped with Bluetooth 4.0
How long does the battery last and how do you charge it?

Depending on usage, the battery life ranges from 3 to 10 days. When your battery is low, you will receive an alert via your smartphone or tablet. You can recharge it like any other mobile device via a microUSB connection at the base of the right temple.
When multiple units are shipped, is only one shipping charge applied?
Yes, regardless of the number of units shipped, a single charge is made for postage.
Is it very hard to program the interaction between ION Glasses and mobile devices?

No, it is actually extremely simple. The application you need to download to set up the connection between your glasses and mobile devices is simple and intuitive, and you will be able to set things up virtually without instructions. There are also tutorials available on our website should you need them.
Dear visitors, thanks for your time and attention...
…and please, be one of the pioneers wearing ION Glasses",46.0,0,"1 Campaign
Hello, my name is Emmanuel Arinze. I’m an IT Professional and part-time inventor resident in Voorhees, New Jersey.

Several years ago I came up with an idea for a portable dispenser that could be used to easily and conveniently store, transport, and serve a selection of drinks to a group of people without the need for numerous bottles, flasks, and other such containers. I call it “Piknik”.
Working out the functionality of Piknik took a bit of imagineering, but I finally figured it out. I built a couple of rough prototypes to prove the concept and then filed a patent application.
There’s nothing like a working prototype to get an inventor all fired up. Up till then you’re not really sure how your concept will work, or even if it will work at all.

Now Piknik is a dream slowly but surely coming to life. It is the first portable, pressurized beverage dispenser able to store and dispense an assortment of drinks from one easy to use device. Like all useful inventions, Piknik is all about providing convenience and alternatives to the user.
I believe Piknik will be useful in many different settings
column2: tailgate parties, picnics, camping trips, meetings, family gatherings and more.

column1: Taking this invention to finished product and then onto production will require several more steps in two phases:
• Professional development and product design of Piknik
• Some additional legal work on the Intellectual Property
• Market research and selection of a manufacturer
Piknik needs your support to become reality. Share our dream! Contribute to the success of Piknik!
Even if you're not in a position to support financially, there are other ways in which you can still help!

Please, please, please spread the word to your friends!  Help us get the word out and make some noise. Share this page with as many of your contacts as you can. This is the single biggest thing you can do to help. Indiegogo makes this easy via the built in sharing tools located at the top of the page. Also share our Facebook page http://www.facebook.com/PiknikDispenser and our website, www.piknikdispenser.wordpress.com.

As you will see from some of the presentation media, the internal workings and arrangements are somewhat complex, with quite a few unique components. Like many household appliances, this complexity is hidden from the user, but takes a lot of design resources to get functionally efficient and easy to use.
Taking Piknik further will need substancially more resources than I currently have available, and will require the involvement of design and legal professionals.
My target with this indiegogo project is to fund Phase I on my list, i.e.
• Professional development and product design of Piknik
• Some additional legal work on the Intellectual Property
To meet this goal, I will need the sum of $32,500.00.

Some of this amount will go towards upgrading my computer to a full CAD Workstation as this will help me work faster and more efficiently, help keep product design costs down, and enable me to share a common platform with the product design consultants.
The requested amount is broken down as follows:

If this campaign raises significantly above the amount requested, it will enable me to move directly to some elements of Phase II without recourse to another round of funding. If the campaign realizes less funding than requested, the project must still go ahead, but the some of the objectives above may have to be scaled back accordingly.
The past US Presidential campaign made it abundantly clear that small business is the major engine of growth for America’s economy.
Helping Piknik and other similar small businesses take off is an important step towards this goal, as it will help the creation of jobs and wealth.
It is also clear that global economic recovery is dependent upon America’s economic recovery, which in is turn dependent on this resurgence of American productivity.

In addition, studies have shown that a nation’s wealth has a direct correlation with its Intellectual Property (IP) assets – patents, trademarks, copyrights and such. The IP assets represented by Piknik and other such inventions are an important step towards boosting the Intellectual Property capital of the USA.
Finally, Piknik will be made with sustainable technologies and materials. It’s use will also help reduce the use of disposable containers such as plastic bottles.
