0,"

For Use with your Mobile Phone, IPod, Kindle, Gaming Device, or IPad

The LapDogg is Simply Awesome!!! We designed and created this product out of a neccessity to operate our mobile phone, IPod, IPad, and PS3 gaming device hands-free. As we began our search almost two years ago we initially thought that there had to be something on the market that would meet the need of somehow holding our devices. Unfortunately and fortunately, everything we found required the individual to be stationary......either sitting, standing still, or laying down. As a result of our fruitless search, we set out to come up with a product that would allow the user to be mobile. Afterall, we live in an extremely mobile and ""On the Go"" society. Simply put, we feel the..... The LapDogg will revolutionize the mobile device industry around the world. Whether you're a master texter, watch videos, gaming, or surfing the internet on your phone or IPad/Kindle, The LapDogg will serve all of your needs. Also, you can detach the shaft and use as a traditional holster/belt clip as well !!!

We have been involved and gainfully employed in the wireless technology industry for nearly twenty years and I have a passion for design and technology that is unmatched. Another passion that we have harnessed since we were little kids is our strong desire to succeed in everything we do. We very much look forward to seeing this project succeed and achieving my goal of making the LapDogg become what the Bluetooth ear bud has meant to the World!!!Stylish Design

column2: Stylish Colors with more to come!"" class=""lazy"" data-src=""http://s3.amazonaws.com/ksr/assets/000/010/155/c4abc98bdce55ac9fcf6913bda7d9787_large.jpg?1338452165"" src="""" style=""""/>
Stylish Colors with more to come!

column1: The LapDogg comes in 4 different vibrant and stylish colors.  Made of a very sturdy lightweight but heavy duty polyurethane polycarbonate plastic.  Designed to hold steady and upright up to 4 lbs.for heavier devices.
Multi-Functional Uses

Beyond The LapDogg's primary use, with the optional LapDogg Suction accessory, you are able to attach to almost any flat, non-porous surface.  This allows the user to attach the LapDogg to almost any surface, including: an office desk, classroom white/chalk board, or in the kitchen.
3 Individual Parts (Phone Connector shown larger to provide additional detail)
(Removable Connector slightly larger than a quarter)!!!!

The LapDogg comes as a complete set, which includes the belt clip, 13 inch colored shaft, and flat mount connector.  It's design is intended to be used with the stylish shaft or to be attached directly to the belt clip to be worn as a traditional-style holster when your not using the shaft.  We will also be offering in the future an optional extended shaft to provide the user a longer shaft.

More Background Story I see the LapDogg revolutionizing how we utilize our mobile and gaming devices. I thing the Lapdogg will become an industry standard and seen as essential as a protective or decorative case that almost every phone has. Smart phones and PDA's were once a luxury upgrade for most users whereas we now see Smart Phones offered with Pre-Pay accounts.  Today, Smart Phones and PDA's account for almost 60% of all phones sold throughout the United States.  But make no mistake, the LapDogg will definitely be a global infestation. Ultimately, we see the LapDogg as a crucial device that will stimulate a more productive society. If we are to think about the multitude of occasions where we have abandoned completing a task or responding to an email until we can have access to a laptop or PC.   Because of the tedious and perceived time required when attempting to complete or engage in a task that will take an elongated time period, the LapDogg will encourge and stimulate you because of the comfort of operating your device virtually hands-free.

At this point in the project we have exhausted all known avenues of funding (Meaning.....our parents and friends) and we need some help to make this dream a reality. Through our research and knocking on doors, we have found that in order to keep control over the development, production and material quality, we will need IndieGoGo's help with $17,000 to get this project off the ground and into stores. This will fund the the first production-run of 4600 devices, some marketing, and other incidentals needed to bring this product to market. I hope that through the many business contacts, social media blasts, and a potential professional athletes’ endorsement of the LapDogg will become the next Croc or wireless Bluetooth earpiece. This project is our passion and in many ways.........our life. The impact on society and our lives will be astronomical!!! I can see nurses, lab technicians, physicians, teachers, warehouse workers, and just about every profession able to capitalize and benefit from the LapDogg.  Beyond all of the professional applications, we can only imagine the millions, and possibly billions, of young kids, tweens, and young adults utilizing the LapDogg for their portable gaming devices.

If we are to calculate and think about the prospect of the number of LapDogg's being sold over the next couple of years and imagine that if only a tenth of a percent (that's point zero one!) purchase one LapDogg.  we feel this WILL be a million dollar business inside of a year and a BILLION dollar business in a matter of a few years.........if not sooner.  About a week ago, we saw a story about the woman who invented a product for women called ""SPANX"".  It's sort of like a girdle!!  Her business is now worth over a BILLION DOLLARS!!!!!  We CAN do this.  I want to thank all of you from the very bottom of our hearts and we appreciate any help you can give.  Every Little Bit Counts!!!!

Thanks again..........we are all truly, truly. truly appreciative.

Smart phones and PDA's were once a luxury upgrade for most users whereas we now see Smart Phones offered with Pre-Pay accounts.  Today, Smart Phones and PDA's account for almost 60% of all phones sold throughout the United States.  But make no mistake, the LapDogg will definitely be a global infestation. Ultimately, we see the LapDogg as a crucial device that will stimulate a more productive society. If we are to think about the multitude of occasions where we have abandoned completing a task or responding to an email until we can have access to a laptop or PC.   Because of the tedious and perceived time required when attempting to complete or engage in a task that will take an elongated time period, the LapDogg will encourge and stimulate you because of the comfort of operating your device virtually hands-free.

At this point in the project we have exhausted all known avenues of funding (Meaning.....our parents and friends) and we need some help to make this dream a reality. Through our research and knocking on doors, we have found that in order to keep control over the development, production and material quality, we will need IndieGoGo's help with $17,000 to get this project off the ground and into stores. This will fund the the first production-run of 4600 devices, some marketing, and other incidentals needed to bring this product to market. I hope that through the many business contacts, social media blasts, and a potential professional athletes’ endorsement of the LapDogg will become the next Croc or wireless Bluetooth earpiece. This project is our passion and in many ways.........our life. The impact on society and our lives will be astronomical!!! I can see nurses, lab technicians, physicians, teachers, warehouse workers, and just about every profession able to capitalize and benefit from the LapDogg.  Beyond all of the professional applications, we can only imagine the millions, and possibly billions, of young kids, tweens, and young adults utilizing the LapDogg for their portable gaming devices.

If we are to calculate and think about the prospect of the number of LapDogg's being sold over the next couple of years and imagine that if only a tenth of a percent (that's point zero one!) purchase one LapDogg.  we feel this WILL be a million dollar business inside of a year and a BILLION dollar business in a matter of a few years.........if not sooner.  About a week ago, we saw a story about the woman who invented a product for women called ""SPANX"".  It's sort of like a girdle!!  Her business is now worth over a BILLION DOLLARS!!!!!  We CAN do this.  I want to thank all of you from the very bottom of our hearts and we appreciate any help you can give.  Every Little Bit Counts!!!!
Thanks again..........we are all truly, truly. truly appreciative.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
0,"
Tangle is the simplest and the most stylish solution to keep your earphones from getting tangled.

If you want a Tangle, we will ship it to you. If you are based in US or India, the shipping cost is included. Shipping Tangle to any other country will be $5. If you are residing outside India/US, please dont forget to add $5 as shipping amount.
If you are ordering Tangle as a swag for your event, shipping cost will be dependent on how many tangles you order.

Sometimes frustrations require immediate solutions. If you cant wait for us to ship the Tangles to you, you can make one yourself. Refer to the instructions here on how to make a Tangle - http://www.instructables.com/id/Tangle-prevent-your-earphones-from-getting-tangl/?ALLSTEPS
We have applied for a patent for the product, but being makers ourselves, we absolutely encourage you to make one for yourself.
• A fashion gadget that reflects your personality
• An opportunity to support Makeystreet - search engine for maker parts

column2: >If you are a regular user of earphones and are frustrated with tangled earphones, then Tangle is for you!!

column1: We dug deep into the problem of tangled earphones and and found that in order to untangle earphones, it requires the user's focused attention, which means that the user will be distracted from her original work for a few minutes. This is what creates the frustration.

Our solution for Tangled earphones does not require your focused attention to use an earphone. Tangle is designed to be so simple to use that you can take your earphones out and listen to music without loosing focus on your primary task.

Tangle is designed to be universal. We have tried our best to design the product to work with every earphone in the market. Having tested Tangle with a lot of earphones we can say that Tangle works for almost all earphones.

This is not a earphone based solution to tangled earphones. Neither is this a solution that works only for certain kinds of earphones. It works for your favourite earphones. You don't have to part with earphones that you already own. Rejoice !!
If you have more than one earphone that you use on occasions, you can use Tangle to organize and store your earphone when not in use.
You can make Tangles for others to use. If you want to make a designer Tangle drop us a mail at alex@makeysteet.com
Let the Tangle that you use, speak about your personality.

The things that we wear reflects our personality. With everything that we use, we are making a statement to the world about what kind of person we are. Some of us are sports enthusiasts, some of us are coldplay fans, some of us are geeks, some of us are cooks .. all of us are something and love something. We associate them with our personalities. Something we want the world to know. Let your Tangle show how cool you are.
Every Tangle has its own personality by virtue of its design that reflects the personality of the designer/maker and its user.

You can get Tangles in designs that reflects your style, personality and interests. Maybe you might want a Pink Floyd Tangle, maybe a Ferarri Tangle, maybe a Meme Tangle. Show the world what you love.
Once you have selected your reward, pick your Tangles from http://www.makeystreet.com/tangle.

If you are looking for a new and innovative way to brand your event/company/business, then use Tangle. Everyone uses some kind of earphones on daily basis. Give your customers a Tangle with your branding on it. We strongly believe Tangle is better branding tool than Tshirts because your customers don't wear your Tshirt everyday, while they are likely to carry your Tangle everywhere with them.
Let your customers show you their love for your brand.
The above image is that of the Tangle that we made for a TEDxKids event at Coimbatore, TN, India.

At Makeystreet, we are trying to design a maker revolution. The problem that we are addressing is ""How do makers find and discover parts for the projects that they are working on"". We as makers had a hard time finding parts for the projects that we used to work on. At Makeystreet, we want to make life easier of the maker in you.

We strongly believe that, if we empower more people to be makers, then these makers can go around and solve many challenges and problems in this world, that the  coorporates don't want to. The money that we raise will also go into funding this startup. Help us design a maker revolution.
If choose ""Support Makeystreet"" reward, you will be acknowledged as one of the early supporters of Makeystreet.
Specifically a lot of the money will go into redesigning the die-punch. We did a die-punch for $200 with which we made the  TEDxKids@rspuram Tangles. A
column2: >lthough the audience at
column4: > loved Tangle, we were not happy with the quality of the cut that we made for them. We think the precision of cut can be made better so that the Tangle would look a lot more classy and would feel better. The new die punch is a lot more precision and will last longer. It is expected to cost $2000-3000.
column5: >The money that you give will go into making the product a lot more finished and top notch.

column2: >The rest of the money will go towards building a search engine for maker parts. We want to build a search engine just for makers so that it will become easier for you to make something.

column1: We have tested the Tangle for over 9 months and are happy with its performance. Your money will help us make Tangle more polished and finished. Each of the designs that you submit for Tangle will give the Tangle a personality of its own that reflects its maker and user.

My name is Alex. I am the dude sitting on the right of the picture. On the left of the picture is Arun. Both of us are batchmates from the Department of Engineering Design, IIT Madras. After graduating from IIT in 2012, we decided to take a year off instead of taking a job. We thought we could do better than that ! We wanted to explore what is it that we really want to do.So for exactly one year we have been experimenting.

Both of us have a lot of interest in product design and making 'things'. The products that we have built might not be perfect but one day we will get there. Some of the projects that Arun worked on are
Some of the projects that I worked on are
Magic Karpet - Intuitively controlled electric skateboard -

One of the things that we noticed is that, all our work has always stayed at the project stage. None of them got to the market. Both of us wanted to build a product that can be taken to the market. So we came us with 'Tangle'. This is our attempt to see if we can build a very simple product, so simple that you can make it at home if you are in so much of a need.

Both of us want to pursue our interests of designing products but the paths that we chose to experiment are different. Arun has decided to pursue a PhD in CMU Robotics Institute, while I decided to pursue entrepreneurship.

In the last one year of our experimental life, one thing we came across is the maker culture. We figured out that there is a community of people who love making stuff, just like we do. As part of my entrepreneurial journey, the company I want to build is for the makers. At makeystreet we are building a search engine for maker parts. One of the problem that we as makers have experienced is that, it is very hard to find and discover parts for what we build. We validated the need with makers around us. The money that we generate from sales of 'Tangle' will go to funding this company.

Alex J V (Echo)
Co-creator Tangle, Founder Makeystreet
alex@makeystreet.com

A lot of really awesome people have attempted solving the problem of tangled earphones before us. Some of them are really cool. The reason why we decided to build a solution ourselves is that we could not find any product easily available that works for earphones that we were comfortable with. So we decided to build a product that is so easy to build that you can hack one yourself at home. Also we noticed that a many of the products that exist in the market are designed for certain specific earphones or is are inbuilt with the  earphones. We wanted to make a solution that works for as many earphones as possible.

While we were at it, we thought why not make it completely customizable so that it can reflect our personality. We are makers and wanted the Tangle to reflect our maker personality so that we will be able to strike a conversation with other makers. Then we realized that everyone would want a Tangle that reflects their personality. And the designer Tangle was born !

column2: title=""So what are you waiting for ? go get yourself a tangle ""/>

column1: What is the design for the regular Tangle?
You get to vote on the design for the regular/standard tangle.
I am not able to select the Tangles from makeystreet.com/tangle.
Right now the website is showcasing the designer Tangles that we have. We are actively coding the site. In a few days we get the functionality ready so that you can select your Tangles.
I am a designer. How do I submit a design for Tangle?
Send us a mail on alex@makeystreet.com. We will send you a kit, with instructions on how to create a Tangle. Make the Tangle and send it back to us and we will upload it on the site under your name.
What is the notch on the Tangle for?

Did we tell you that Tangle works for pretty much any earphone that you can think about? Well the notch is for making Tangle work with earphones that have a mic on the cord or for asymmetric earphones. For such earphones you will need to make a cut along the notch into the oval hole. Along the new cut that you made, you can pass the earphone end of the cord into the oval holes so that the specific earphone works with Tangle.

After winding the earphone, you can pass the plug-end through any consecutive 2 holes out of the 4 circular holes in a stitching pattern. This will keep it in place. Due to varying lengths of earphone cord, you would never know where they end.
You can help us out in a couple of ways
Pre-order a Tangle and solve your earphone problem
Submit a designer Tangle for others to buy - If you are a graphic designer yourself, show the world how awesome you are and make some really cool Tangles.
Refer a graphics designer to design a Tangle - If you know a really awesome graphics designer. You can tell her about Tangle and ask her to design one.
Spread the word far and wide - help us reach out to others in need of a solution to tangled earphones.

By pre-ordering a Tangle you will help us cover the cost of the die punch and the research and development cost associated with it. It will also give us some flexibility to experiment with different print technologies.
We have made 2 die punches so far. First one failed miserably. Second one was satisfactory. We think we can make the die a lot more better. Your money will help us get the best quality Tangle to you.
We thank our friends who helped us in shooting the video. The following are the helpful people you would spot in the video:
Jeevan, Mythreyi, Girish, Tarun, Swapnil, Suresh, Sunil, Praneeth and Hem.
We are not directly associated with the brands that we showed in the video. Neither do any of the brands endorse us. Those images/videos are just to show potential uses.

At Makeystreet, we are trying to design a maker revolution. The problem that we are addressing is ""How do makers find and discover parts for the projects that they are working on"". We strongly believe that, if we empower more people to be makers, then these makers can go around and solve many challenges and problems in this world, that the  coorporates don't want to. The money that we raise will also go into funding this startup. Help us design a maker revolution.
If choose ""Support Makeystreet"" reward, you will be acknowledged as one of the early supporters of Makeystreet.

Specifically a lot of the money will go into redesigning the die-punch. We did a die-punch for $200 with which we made the  TEDxKids@rspuram Tangles. Although the audience at TEDxKids@rspuram loved Tangle, we were not happy with the quality of the cut that we made for them. We think the precision of cut can be made better so that the Tangle would look a lot more classy and would feel better. The new die punch is a lot more precision and will last longer. It is expected to cost $2000-3000. The money that you give will go into making the product a lot more finished and top notch.
The rest of the money will go towards building a search engine for maker parts. We want to build a search engine just for makers so that it will become easier for you to make something.

We have tested the Tangle for over 9 months and are happy with its performance. Your money will help us make Tangle more polished and finished. Each of the designs that you submit for Tangle will give the Tangle a personality of its own that reflects its maker and user.

Hi, my names Martin, and im a college student at Troy University. I plan to major in aerospace engineering, but things could change between now and then. I'm the person that started this campaign. It all started one day the power went out and i heard my phone go off but couldn't find it. Then i thought ""why dont iphones have notification lights like android phones. After about 2 weeks i came up with the first prototype and I've pretty much been working from there making the parts smaller and smaller. And WHAM! Here we are today.
Millions of people have Iphones, but none have notification lights (something most android phones have). Notification lights are used to let the user know the have a message or
missed call waiting. This is especially useful to people who like to
keep there phone on silent or vibrate.  This project will allow you to
sit your Iphone down without having to check your phone periodically. It
will work with missed calls,text, emails, ect. It will connect through
the headphone jack. This case will glow periodically until you check
your notification. There will also be an app to let you customize the
light pattern. I also plan to have a case/light for Ipad and Ipod touch. Updates will be posted periodically.
simple.....FUNDING!!! So far its been pretty much an out of pocket
expense to get parts and stuff like that and a college budget isn't
gonna get this project more prototypes before trying to go
pre-production and hopefully FULL SCALE. That's why I'm asking for your
help. All funds will be used to the product and the product ONLY!!! Not
my life or anyone else that's involved with the project. Now what you
get is straight forward as well.
one dollar and you will have a chance to name the product. Try to come
up with something catchy and easy to say in any language. A drawing will
be held two days after the deadline to pick the winner.
$30 and you will receive a pre-production case. But the only color
available will be blue. (add $15 for international shipping)
$60 and you will receive a pre-production case in the color of your
choice (Red, Blue, Orange, Purple, Green) (add $15 for international

column2: >$140 minimum: Donate at least $140 and you will get two pre-production cases in the color of your choice (Red, Blue, Orange, Purple, Green) (You do
column3: >NOT have to add $15 for international shipping)

column2: >So What Happens If The Goal Isn't Reached?

column1: If we don't reach our goal, don't worry. Though the main goal would still be to eventually have this product mass produced and sold, efforts will focus to getting those who contributed there perks. So if the goal isn't reached the funds will be used to get you your perk!

column2: >So What Happens With The Extra Funds?

column1: Any extra Funds will go into working on a ""Deluxe"" version of the case that will not only glow and protect your phone but will also double as an extended battery.
You can also help by getting the word out about this campaign. There are share tools available to you on this site. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

""Your money and infrastructure have been important...""

[Photos courtesy of Michael E. Mason Photography and Quidditch by Will]

ESPECIALLY NOW!

I'm Jack Snitch, and I've been asked to pack my shorts and mask and head to Burnaby as a snitch runner for the IQA's Global Games on July 19...

Which is awesome. I'm humbled that the Snitch Development Team counts me as one of the best in the world after only a season of work and an injury-shortened showing at World Cup VII this past April in North Myrtle Beach.

Problem: Burnaby is roughly 3,000 miles away from my corner of Virginia.

Solution: I'm going to use every talent I possess to make the upcoming quidditch season as entertaining as possible—for travel money!

What I Need
The goal I've set for this fundraiser will help with the following expenses:

Flights between D.C. and Seattle ($670)
  • Amtrak transportation between Seattle and Vancouver ($80)

But I wouldn't expect you to chip in for nothing! With help from several of you, I've brainstormed a few perks that let YOU get creative with your reward:

One-Offs:

Piggyback Jack ($3) gets you a free ride on my shoulders. I'd use it to get myself carried to the starting line in a World Cup match, except I can't carry myself on my own shoulders...

Or can I?

A Literal Shout-Out ($3) gets any words you want said at any volume you want them heard. Want me to proclaim your greatness at a regional tournament? Want Bane to whisper your name in a seeker's ear? Done.

column2: You..."" ($6) gets you a customized photo op with yours truly—even mid-match, if we can pull it off. I'm game.

column1: Bane the Bard ($6-15) taps into my penchant for poetry, commissioning a piece that can be read aloud or kept and treasured. Your choice.

Speech! Speech! ($30-50) brings me on board as a creative consultant and wide-eyed performer for any situation where you require some hype. Teams and spectators from Miami to Valhalla—and the other students in my master's classes at Virginia Tech—can vouch for my work.

column2: Me"" ($30) buys us an afternoon or evening date. So long as it doesn't involve gory movies or my fear of heights, I'm up for anything.

column1: Train with Jack ($50) could be a workout at your gym, a workshop session with your writing, or some practice for you and/or your team on the pitch. My experience is varied, and my time can be yours.
Jack of All Trades ($100) is a pure business transaction—your cash for my sweat. Moving? Landscaping? Chopping firewood? Bring it on.

...and did I mention that THESE PERKS STACK?

Any contribution above the $3 tier will get you at least a free perk from that level: piggyback ride or shout-out, it's yours, gratis.

For buying in at the $30 or $50 tier, you can choose one extra perk from either the $3 or $6 tier—so a short form poem or photo op is in play, as well.

And for funding me at the $100 tier, you'll get your choice of three extra perks from the $3, $6, and/or $15 tiers. Maybe I'll cut your grass, trim your hedges, help you move, then go home and write you a love letter.

(Maybe you'll want to buy me lunch that day to make sure it's a good letter.)

    Terms &

I'm hoping that fulfilling these perks is going to be as fun as thinking them up. (Except for ""Jack of All Trades,"" which will probably suck. But that's okay!)

With that said, the flip side of these open-ended items is a pair of disclaimers:

Expiration: Any perk you purchase is completely transferable and will never expire until it's fulfilled. I'll try my hardest to give everyone their money's worth as soon as possible, by the end of the upcoming quidditch season at the latest...

And if I'm not able to do so, you'll be entitled to a full refund—and I'll still owe you the perk, free of charge. (Like I said, most of them seem fun.)

Transportation: Perks that require me to be present will be easier to fulfill in a timely manner within the state of Virginia, and no transportation assistance will be necessary.

Outside of Virginia, I'm willing to travel to any neighboring state (i.e. North Carolina, Tennessee, Kentucky, West Virginia, Maryland, or Delaware) with help, or to meet up somewhere. We can work it out.

Beyond that, unfortunately, I'm unable to accept requests for perks—unless they can be fulfilled at a tournament I'll be attending! I hope to attend several regional tournaments and World Cup this season, so don't let geography deter you from buying me.

If you're unable to help me fund this trip, I totally understand. (Hell, if funding things was something I could do off-hand without a second thought, I wouldn't be selling myself for three-dollar piggyback rides.)

By linking to this site, you can still do me a no-cost solid toward Burnaby.

And if you did pick a perk, I owe you. Literally. Maybe something strange, maybe something fun, maybe something I would've done for free (sucker!) — and I'll try to be worth it.
","""Your money and infrastructure have been important...""[Photos courtesy of Michael E. Mason Photography and Quidditch by Will]ESPECIALLY NOW!I'm Jack Snitch, and I've been asked to pack my shorts and mask and head to Burnaby as a snitch runner for the IQA's Global Games on July 19...Which is awesome. I'm humbled that the Snitch Development Team counts me as one of the best in the world after only a season of work and an injury-shortened showing at World Cup VII this past April in North Myrtle Beach.Problem: Burnaby is roughly 3,000 miles away from my corner of Virginia.Solution: I'm going to use every talent I possess to make the upcoming quidditch season as entertaining as possible—for travel money! What I Need
The goal I've set for this fundraiser will help with the following expenses:
Flights between D.C. and Seattle ($670)  Amtrak transportation between Seattle and Vancouver ($80)
Accommodations at hostels in those cities ($90)
But I wouldn't expect you to chip in for nothing! With help from several of you, I've brainstormed a few perks that let YOU get creative with your reward:One-Offs:
Piggyback Jack ($3) gets you a free ride on my shoulders. I'd use it to get myself carried to the starting line in a World Cup match, except I can't carry myself on my own shoulders...Or can I?

A Literal Shout-Out ($3) gets any words you want said at any volume you want them heard. Want me to proclaim your greatness at a regional tournament? Want Bane to whisper your name in a seeker's ear? Done.
Imagine Me & You..."" ($6) gets you a customized photo op with yours truly—even mid-match, if we can pull it off. I'm game.
Bane the Bard ($6-15) taps into my penchant for poetry, commissioning a piece that can be read aloud or kept and treasured. Your choice.

Speech! Speech! ($30-50) brings me on board as a creative consultant and wide-eyed performer for any situation where you require some hype. Teams and spectators from Miami to Valhalla—and the other students in my master's classes at Virginia Tech—can vouch for my work.
...and You & Me"" ($30) buys us an afternoon or evening date. So long as it doesn't involve gory movies or my fear of heights, I'm up for anything.
Train with Jack ($50) could be a workout at your gym, a workshop session with your writing, or some practice for you and/or your team on the pitch. My experience is varied, and my time can be yours.
